reviews.review: Great trekking company. Absolutely faultless!. Outshine is a great company to do EBC trek with as well as many other treks all around Nepal. Nepalese owned and operated, very easy communication and organisation. From the time we arrived in Kathmandu we were looked after. All transfers and tours included. The first day was a great tour of Kathmandu - monkey temple, Crematorium, Kathmadu palace tours etc. very interesting. The trek was amazing, and our guide, Toby (Chhabi) was unreal - he looked after all our needs and was a great guy to trek with. Very knowledgeable and a real support for my wife and I (who are not experienced Trekkers). Everything was looked after and well organised. They ensured we had the best accomodation in all villages. Pream, our porter was amazing - took our two bags up and down the mountain and they were ready and waiting for us at every village we stayed at. A++++++ service and I couldn't recommend a better company to trek with. We will definately be going with them again for Langtan in the future!!!!

Gokul made my day - what a trek and memories up to Lukla. So I arrive in KAT late Friday night, get picked up and head to great guest house/hotel called Mi Casa. I'm staying for a week - wanted to do trek up to Namche but was unsure of weather. Making a long story short - the hotel owners says he knows someone that knows more about Everest Base Camp trek and I'll invite him over for breakfast Saturday morning.We met Gokul at 11 a.m and within two hours I packed my bag, stored other stuff at Mi Casa and was in a van headed to airport to take a heli up to Lukla and start a five day trek up to Tengboche and back. It was nuts and once of the most memorable experiences - I'd say the most - of my two month solo journey around the world. Top notch guide, great service, good guest houses and special thanks to Pemba my guide. He would always tell me to "take it easy" on the way up - his word was "distareh, Bret, distareh - take it easy, take it easy". And I'd highly recommend Nepal - awesome people. Namaste!

5 Out of 5. Namaste!! Greetings from Indonesia.I don't have much to say about Outshine, because the rates have said it all. Since the first time I contact them, which is more than half a year from my schedule to Nepal, Gokul is always responsive and informative until the last minute. Even help us to exchange the rupees, buy water purified table, and so on so on. So do their team, Naba & Bikash who lead us along the trek. They always make sure we're on good & healthy condition, oh and patiently waiting for me who walk like a snail. Despite the altitude sickness and soaring leg I had when trekking, I really have a good time there. It's a great and memorable experience If i had a chance to visit Nepal again, i will contact them for sure. Oh actually i have a lot to say.So finally thank you Outshine!!

Outstanding service from Outshine Adventure. If you are looking for the Everest Base Camp trek, don’t look any further. Outshine is really trustable, from the time to pick us from Kathmandu till our last minute to Kathmandu airport was perfectly organized. At first when we see our guide I felt this child would guide us? After all at end we could not leave him as our parents. His care to his clients is outstanding. He was as flexible as we wish and manage to work in extras as we became aware of the options available. Lastly his inside knowledge and connections helped us do all this avoiding typical delays common to travel in Nepal. If you are traveling to Nepal, we highly recommend you to choose Outshine Adventure. They will care you better than your expectation.

Safe pair of hands. I recently completed the Everest Base Camp trek with Gokul's team, Naba and Kaji. It was fantastic. I trusted them to organise and sort every detail of the trip, which I booked at quite short notice. They managed every curve ball (eg flights cancelled) and were very well connected along the way. I travelled by myself but at no point felt awkward about that.What a fantastic trip - and highly recommend the company to facilitate a similar experience for others.

2nd time with Outshine! . My boyfriend and I did the Annapurna base camp two years ago with Outshine and fell in love with Nepal. We came back this time to do the Everest base camp trek and were not disappointed. Outshine continues to be the best trekking company with supreme service. It was nice to see Gokul again, and he arranged everything for us stress free. We were guided by Naba who was extremely attentive, funny, and who went above and beyond to make sure we were safe and enjoying yourselves. We couldn't have asked for a more perfect trek thanks to Outshine. If you're contemplating trekking Outshine will ensure your utmost satisfaction and safety, hands down. We'll be back for the Manaslu trek soon!

Trekking to Everest base camp.. What a great experience. Outshine organized the best possible trip for a great price. Gokul the owner was fast and very effective. He organized our trip from start to finish. He was flexible and organized. Naba our guide and Kazi our poter were awesome. They made our trip. Outshine is a great Nepali company. We are coming back to climb Island Peak with them.

Superb Service with a Soul. After various inquiries with different tour operators, I finally decided to let Outshine Adventure handle my family's cultural & sightseeing tour of Nepal. The main reason is that the owner, Mr. Gokul Sapkota was quick to reply to my queries. Pricing was reasonable and he was able to offer all that we required- comfortable hotels, private vehicles with air-conditioning, knowledgeable guide & airport transfers. Had I asked for a helicopter in case I needed to be bailed out of altitude sickness, I'm sure he could have easily arranged it too. Okay, I'm going too far talking about altitude sickness. There's no such thing when just visiting UNESCO sites & looking at the Himalayas from a low hill, sipping organic Nepali tea if you please. To put it simply, Gokul is very resourceful & trustworthy.We arrived late at night with our flight delayed for an hour. I thought we could get out of the airport easily as we already filled out our Nepalese visa application online. But then, the airport carousel took so long to spew out the last luggage, with none of ours arriving. We got more delayed coming out of the airport because we had to file for baggage tracking. Anyway, after that arrival hiccup, we were quite happy to see the Outshine representative whose name I forgot meet us when we got out. He & the driver were very patient in waiting for us & i commend them for that. The following morning, we met up with Gokul in his office right in Thamel. He briefed us about our tour. We paid him the balance of our tour cost. He also helped us with currency exchange, giving us a much better rate than at the airport or elsewhere. He was very cordial & we felt assured that we could count on him.Siri, our guide for our day tours in Kathmandu, was knowledgeable, helpful & professional. We also felt safe with all the drivers. All the vehicles used were comfortable and bigger than the typical car in Nepal which can be quite tiny.Before we left Nepal, we had dinner with Gokul and met his beautiful young family. I'm so glad I went with Gokul & his Outshine Adventure team. You can easily see the passion he has to succeed as well as helping others.Overall, we felt safe & had a great time in Nepal. Do go if you haven't. I want to go back someday. Thank you, Gokul and Outshine Adventure team.
Excelentes profesionales. Very good staff, very professional.I surelly recomend this agency, very good atention to the costumers, very helpful all the time.

Yet again Outshine delivers. Just finished my 2nd trek with Outshine Adventures and the same high standard was there. Gokul as always right on the ball with his communication and no hidden extras. Naba and Dhendi our guides were excellent and our porters were real goers as well. We were a group of 5 to EBC and everyone expressed the same level of satisfaction with the whole organisation.Well done Outshine and I'll certainly be using your services again on my next visit.Phil Gordon
City trip Nepal. Gokul arranged everything very efficiently. For the short time we had, we managed to see a lot of Nepal, including Mount Everest! If you visit Nepal or Tibet ..... Call Gokul.

Fantastic Tour Provider in Kathmandu!. Last December, I had a two week holiday planned with my girlfriend throughout Asia, with my first stop in Kathmandu. We arrived New Years eve, with the plan for the next few days to check out all the tourist sites ourselves. Well, a few days of travel from the states and having to switch hotels after one night left us a bit exhausted. We opted to utilize the services of a Tour Provider in the area. We found Gokul and Outshine Adventures here on Tripadvisor. Our hotel was only a 10 minute walk from the office, so we decided to go over and see what could be arranged for the next two days in Kathmandu. Even though it was last minute, Gokul put together an excellent itinerary with one of the best guides I've experienced during my travels! Gokul also advised against some of the items we were asking about (His thoughts were, the weather wasn't clear enough to see anything....he was totally right!)The driver and car were both great as well! I really can't say anything bad about the tours Gokul setup. The guide even helped us with buying some medicine at the pharmacy, and was very understanding when one of us was feeling a bit under the weather towards the end of the tour and just wanted to relax. (Sorry to the Thangka School we were touring at the time....the work was beautiful and If not for starting to not feel well, we definitely would have stayed longer and bought something!) Gokul even helped arrange our airport transfer back to the airport.The trip ended up being such an incredible experience, thanks in part to Gokul. If I find my way back to Nepal (which I very much hope I do!), I will absolutely be utilizing the services of Outshine Adventure. Thanks again for everything!

Outstanding Nepal Tour Operator !!. We booked Outshine adventures on our first Nepal visit and Everest Panorama Trek on December 2014, after browsing and searching tons of Nepal tour operator in the web.We chose Outshine based on their outstanding performance from their previous guests , and we did not disappointed.Mr Bijay Rimal , and later Mr Gokul Sapkota , helped me with the arranging , planning and answering of our trekking related questions faithfully ,from the beginning (almost a year before our December trip).At first , we're concerned about trekking in the Himalayas in the middle of winter , bringing our 13 yo daughter, and none of us did ANY trekking before, but now ,Outshine Adventures proofed that this can be done, safely !Our tour only cost us USD 950 per person , with all the transportation ,lodging on the trek,basic daily foods,guide, porter, hotel whilst in Kathmandu , city tour , return tickets Kathmandu-Lukla, considered very cheap ,for the quality service they provided us.On arrival , they picked us up on time , and escorted to their office , where Mr.Gokul explained some options about the trek , considering the weather , Thank God we followed his advice on going early for the trek.On December , cannot predict the weather in any means, a day late , we would not made it to Lukla because of strong winds , and fog.We would like to thank our guide Roshan , a very experienced tour guide ,for his thoughts , guidance and expertise during the trek, we felt very safe with him. And Tendi Sherpa,our super porter, quiet guy ,with pleasant attitude.After the trek ,Mr Gokul presented us with a farewell dinner , and 3 Everest trekking certificates ,what a nice surprise !!Overall ,this would not be our last visit to Nepal, we would use Outshine Adventures again in our next visit !!

Outshine Adventures Really Shined When Things Went Wrong. I booked the UNESCO 5 days, 4 nights with Nagarkot tour with Outshine Adventures in early March 2015. I did so based on the many excellent TripAdvisor reviews. I was travelling with my 20 year old daughter who was living in India at the time. Gokul (the owner) was very responsive to emails prior to departure and was very clear about exactly what was included and what was not included in our tour package. We were very late coming out of the airport because of long visa lines and also because the airline had lost my luggage. I was worried the driver might not wait so long but he was waiting there with the sign even though we were well over an hour past our planned arrival. Our trip went exactly as planned. Our guide, Amit, was very friendly, knowledgeable, professional, and spoke very clear English. I was worried about our luggage, but Amit put us at ease, saying "your worries are now my worries, so you can enjoy your visit". He and Gokul took over all communication with the airport regarding my luggage and I indeed didn't have to worry about it at all. Amit delivered my luggage to the hotel soon after it arrived at the airport. This would have been very difficult for me to arrange by myself.Another major event happened during our visit. A Turkish airliner crash landed at the airport, which caused the airport to close for 4 days. Our outgoing flight to Varanasi India was cancelled and there was no indication when the airport would reopen. This is where Gokul's services really shined. He took us under his wing and informed us of several options we had of getting to India. We ended up booking an overland bus directly from Kathmandu to Varnasi. Gokul handled everything including buying the tickets, arranging for an extended stay at our hotel, and having a driver take us to the bus station and make sure we we got on the bus successfully. I don't know what we would have done without Gokul and Outshine Adventures. Through the whole trip, Gokul was always working in the background, ensuring we knew exactly what was next. He seemed to anticipate our every need before we even knew what we needed.I highly recommend Outshine Adventures for any trip to Nepal. You can rest assured that he will take care of you, even when things don't go as planned.

3 times within 3 years with outshine and more to come. Hi Guys! This is company is super highly recommended, i have booked my adventure with them 3 times within 3 years for a reason. Gokul is easy to communicate and he's reply is very prompt. He'll arrange for you with what ever u need as soon as u arrive at the airport until u go back to the airport to fly back. Price is very reasonable. and for me what matters most is the it's more than just business, there's soul in it. My friend left his phone in the car on the way back to the airport, while we left the Nepal, Gokul manage to save the phone and take the effort to post it back to us.So book with these guys now!Just in case u want to know which trek did i do: first was Nagarkot, second was Poon Hil, third was Khumjung via Lukla

Fantastic Trekking Company. We did an Everest Region trek with Outshine Adventures in October 2014. Aside from the trek, Gokul (the owner) arranged our accommodation and a day tour in Kathmandu. The accommodation was excellent as was the service we received from when we first booked the trip, during the trek and afterwards.Our guide during the trek, Naba, was fantastic. He gave us great advice and looked after us while I trudged and my husband bounced through the mountains. Unfortunately I had to be helivac'd from Dingbouche due to altitude sickness and even this was arranged seamlessly. The helicopter was there within an hour, I was picked up straight from the airport to the international hospital where I was met by Gokul who took care of everything for me, including arranging everything regarding our travel insurance.My husband finished the trek to Base Camp and came back with amazing photos and lots of great new friends. We had an absolutely fantastic time. I would not hesitate in recommending Outshine for any trips to Nepal.

Outshine is the BEST. Our trip to Nepal was a trip of a lifetime with the help of Outshine Adventure. We trekked to ABC with the help of our amazing guide (Rosan) and porter (Bim) who made our trek entertaining, well organized, and gave us the motivation to complete it! Our vacation was too short to explore all of Nepal, but we plan on coming back to Nepal in a few years to take on EBC and there is no doubt that we will be using Outshine to plan our next trekking adventure! Thank you Gokul for making our trip a memorable one. See you soon!

Outstanding service!. Overall we felt really secured and well taken cared by gokul and his staff. From the time we arrived until our departure date. everything was just perfect. I literally didn't have to think about anything.Kathmandu valley can be really chaotic so hiring a guide is a must if you ask me. Outshine covered us from transport, tour guides and meals for our 5 day stay in Kathmandu. upon arrival gokul gave me a quick briefing from what is included on our tour and what else we can add and edit from the stuff that we talked about online. He also made sure we had all necessary insurances during our stay in kathmandu. Our guides treated us like friends visiting them. they showed us local scenes and told stories of the old world and new. I was glad i chose outshine adventure.

Good Service, I felt secure. a group of us went to nepal and contracted with outshine adventure to be our tour agent. apparently the airlines we flew in lost my luggage and i was left "naked" with only my carry in luggage. the people in outshine took an extra effort to bring me around town at 10pm local time in kathmandu in search for things to be bought. SInce i did not have a local number there in kathmandu, my tour agent incharge of us, Arjun, took his own phone and called my airlines number in kathmandu and coordinated with them. Apparently outshine has quite an influence there. All in all, they aimed for customer satisfaction and to ensure our stay is pleasant. our guide even told us how certain things work in nepal and it saved us from being hustled from other Nepalese. if i do come back to nepal, definitely it will be sunshine =)

Great Tour Company. Lots of tours in Kathmandu basically offer the same thing, but we chose Outshine adventure because of the number of positive reviews online. There was a time when we got a bit hesitant because of the late replies when we were making inquiries and making our transaction, but it turned out that we had nothing to worry about. Gokul and his staff were very accommodating and helpful during our entire stay. They didn't even mind our last minute adjustments during our trip. Will definitely contact Outshine Adventure again when i return to Nepal.

Top notch from A-Z. Upfront communication with Gokul was very swift and efficient and the organisation went very well. Arriving into Kathmandu 4 hours late due to a thunderstorm, someone from Outshine was there to pick me up :-)My guide Hari was a real star. Trustworthy, reliable and always smiling with a great sense of humour.All in all a team of genuinely nice and competent people. I can wholeheartedly recommend them.

Fantastic. Gokul did an amazing job of looking after us. Also thank you to his team, Beji, Hari and Surat, felt like one of the family, nothing was too much. Thank you all for such wonderful memories and fantastic organisation. We are already planning our next trip.

Our trip was flawless. The only thing Outshine can't take credit for was the good weather. We picked this organization based on Trip Advisor and the recommendation of a friend. They arranged everything so well including our flights from Kathmandu to Pokhara and return. We were met at the airport. All connections were perfect. We had a chance to meet several guides from this organization. All were personable and professional. When we left, we felt we had made new friends. Gokul has built a top notch organization in a relatively short period of time that now includes 17 guides. (Our guide, Dambar, had to be the best.) They are worthy of their #1 ranking and I would highly recommend them. We hope to book another trip in the future to a different area - maybe Tibet or Bhutan.

Gokul and his team has done a fantastic job. everything was well taken care of, we had a wonderful time. We were stuck at Lukla with an impending flight out the next day. Gokul and his team were able to get us out via helicopter and literally saved the day. The backup received made the trip so much more enjoyable.

Unforgettable Experience. The trip organized by outshine adventure was outstanding and unforgettable experience, I highly recommend new visitors and Trekkers to take the service from outshine, they will make everything instant for you. Thanks, Anwar

Fantastic all around!. Wow! What a great time I had visiting Nepal. I was lucky to have contacted Outshine Adventure a few months before my arrival. I scheduled 2 private day tours and Gokul was extremely helpful in suggesting how I should spend my time. He also helped me set-up a guided Trekking tour with his staff as well. I very much enjoyed the entire planning process and most importantly the actual delivery was above my expectations.For my private tours of Kathmandu Valley, I had a fantastic guide. Bijay took me to explore so many fascinating sites around the valley. Bijay was so friendly, welcoming and his English was extremely good. I would highly recommend scheduling private tours to explore the best of the Kathmandu Valley and I strongly suggest you do so with Outshine Adventure. My trekking expedition was also amazing as it was a private one. My guide and porter were both fantastic. One of the best moments of my entire "round the world" trip was when both Shankar and Nabarad sang to me a Nepalese song as we trekked our way through the forrest. Just priceless!Hope you find this review helpful.

Top notch service - beginning till end. Right from the moment we landed till it was time to leave at the airport, everything was well taken care of. Everyday was full of memorable adventures that we truly cherish. Kudos to Gokul and his team from Outshine Adventure. We particularly love the Elephant Ride in Chitwan, Water Rafting at Trishuli River, Paragliding in Pokhara and hiking up to Dhampus (not forgetting learning to sing a short version of Resham Phiriri ;) ). Outshine is able to accommodate our last minute add ons without any hassle and we truly appreciated that. An excellent relationship has been built between us and we look forward to more adventures in Nepal with Outshine. Thanks to his team Chaabi, Santosh, Nabaraj, Bijay and Arjun too. Get Gokul to plan your itineraries with you if you ever plan to head to Nepal...

great trekking company. Outshine provided very good service during our stay in Nepal. Gokul discussed with us our travelling needs daily and made all necessary arrangements. Our sightseeing guide, trekking guide and the porter were all excellent. We'll definitely use Outshine on our next trip to Nepal.

Excellent customer service. Outshine Adventure went out of their way to organise the holiday I requested. They were flexible and rearranged my trip for me after I was taken ill in the mountains. I was very impressed with the level of service and would happily recommend them to other travellers in Nepal.

unbelievable adventure in my life. i dont have words to explain abt my tour including with my frens frm outshine adventure,the well trained ,well experienced staff members,sound guiding, made our trip really an unbelievable.the motivation towards the guest was really an amazing frm our tour adventure owner mr. gokul,the reasonable cost of tour which had included all the things needed during the tour was provided,which amazed us,last but nt the least...the tour was really an energtic..

Exhilarating - fantastic trip with Outshine Adventure!. I've been planning this trip science long time. After communicating with few agencies, I decided to go with Outshine Adventure because of their detailed website with all the information. Once I mail them the prompt response made me feel more professional. I found the staff to be very professional and well organized. My trip was perfect. The staff, guide made my trip the best ever. Always my highly recommendation goes to Outshine Adventure!

WONDERFUL NEPAL. I went to Nepal with my family in December. we liked soo much about nepal and we enjoyed a lot in nepal because of Gokul. We were in short Trekking near Pokhara and it was wonderful moment and nice views. Bhaktpur, Pashupati and Patan were so interesting. Also we liked so much Symabhu Nath and Bouddha. i would like to say thanks to Outshine Travel Agency, guide team and specially to Mr. Gokul Sapkota. because he was been very nice with us. Namaste

excellent service, prompt communication, amazing guides, seamless operation.. We did the Annapurna Base Camp trek. The communication with the company was very prompt and informative. The owner is a married couple and the wife Sabina seems to be the one who organizes the trips and kept in communication with us anytime we had a question. Everything was very seamless. The only thing we arranged was our flight in and out of Kathmandu, Exciting Nepal Treks took care of everything else in which there are a lot of logistics involved. I travel a lot and plan all my logistics myself, but the price seemed very competitive and based on the service for literally everything I'd pay again, rather than figure it all out myself. The hotel in Kathmandu is very nice and great location. It includes breakfast and wifi in which both are great. Our guide on the actual trek was named basu and he was outstanding. He really worked really hard to keep us happy. He is very personable, sincere, upbeat and always willing. I give my full endorsement to the company. Josh

Wonderful experience heading to Annapurna Base Camp!. My friends and I were thrilled with our experience with Exciting Nepal. We initially touched base with 2 other companies, but finally settled on going with Exciting Nepal because of the detailed itinerary, immediate response to any questions, and wonderful reviews we read by others. We were not disappointed!We spent 1 night in Katmandu, then several hiking up to ABC. Our guides made the trip: Basu, Kapil, and Samon were wonderful--friendly, warm, informative, encouraging--everything you want along the trail! They were patient and accommodating-- very organized, reliable, and funny! It would not have been the same experience without these guys. We learned so much about their lives and the traditions of the Nepalese people from our time with them. Be ready to unplug, be dirty, and pack light--don't be afraid to ask what you should/shouldn't bring. Also, anything you may need for the trek will be available for purchase (for cheap) in Kathmandu.We were sad to say goodbye but I'm already thinking about going back someday for Everest Base camp-- I won't hesitate to go through Exciting Nepal!!

Time of our lives on the Everest Base Camp Trek!. We had a very joyful and relaxing time during our whole stay in Nepal thanks to the very reliable and helpful support of Subash, who oriented us whenever needed. We had the nicest Guide and Porter we could have imagined, thus we had a lot of fun together discoverng the Himalayas. The guide was very competent in informing us about peaks and mountains and villages. The choice of lodges was very good. The plan for the next day was always explained to us the evening before, so there would be no surprises of walking time etc. During the day the supervision was excellent. As a slow walker I did not feel rushed at all but very well accompanied. Subash kept in touch with us all the way long, providing us with information about routes and weathers. Accordingly, we felt very safe in the high altitude. Back in Kathmandu, Subash provided us with accomodation, a wide range of tourist information, and an unforgettable last dinner that became a very beautiful ending of our trip. We are two students in our mid twenties and we have absolutely nothing to complain. I warmly recommend Exciting Nepal to anyone who seeks a well guided adventure!

16 Days Everest Base Camp Trek. Booking the Everest Base Camp Trek with Exciting Nepal was the best choice we could have made! Already while we were planning the trip, the company owner Subash answered all our questions really fast and in detail via email. So deciding for the right trek and getting everything organised was easy and fun! From the start, when we arrived in Kathmandu, till the end of our trip everything went perfectly well! Our guide Basu did an awesome job by always making sure that we were fine and happy, explaining everything to us and being very flexible about the route and our pace. During the trek Subash kept calling to make sure we were happy and everything was going well. This gave us a very good feeling of safety as we knew that if anything would happen someone in Kathmandu would feel responsible and be there with help and advice ASAP. Our porter was really friendly as well and did an amazing job! Back in Kathmandu Subash provided us with accomodation and tips about the city and was very helpful. On our last evening he invited us out to a typical nepali dinner which was the perfect end of our journey!All together we were very happy with Exciting Nepal! There is really nothing to complain about, everything went perfectly well and I can only recommend everyone to book with this great company!

Amazing Short Break. My partner and i had 6 days to fit as much in as possible whilst in Kathmandu and the surrounding areas, Exciting tours were fantastic, extremely accommodating and made our 6 days completely unique as we changed quite a few things. If you can get Basu Dev for the trek, he is fantastic. Highly recommended for anyone visiting!

Great Experience with Exciting Nepal Treks. Choosing this company for us was really good decision. We got a great and knowledgeable guide for our Annapurna Base camp trek for 11 days, The month was rainy but we were a lucky that we had great view from poon hill. The trek was hard for us but we made it slowly. We are very glad that we had a great time with our guide and correct information from this company.

Kathmandu valley with guide and car. . We visited Boudhanat, Kirtipur, Pharping, Khokana, Bungmati, Bhaktapur, Chagunaraian, Patan, Swayambhunath,Pashupatinath and Kapan monastery. We booked a guide and a car for 4 days and we really recommend it. Kathmandu valley traffic is a mess so booking a car made our trip easier. We visited really nice places and we had amazing moments.Our guide show us the real Newary people and culture, thank you very much Bicash.

A Trustable company. We did 12 days Annapurna Base camp trek with guide Basu arranged by Exciting Nepal treks. The trek was hard for us but our guide makes this easy. We slept in base camp for a night which was different experience for us and it is memorable. The itinerary was prepared by Mr. Subash from exciting Nepal Treks A really knowledgeable person to arrange the trip. I will surely join for my next trip to Everest base camp trek with Exciting Nepal Treks.

Everest, Kathmandu, Baktapur, Nargakot, ... with 22 month old baby. Subash and team were really great: reliable, honest, excellent quality of service for reasonble price. They made our stay a very good experience considering traveling with a young child which was demanding high flexibility. They even organized the taxi to the airport for free. Thanks guys for that service. For us a it was 5 star experience, we really can recommend them.

Kathmandu City Tour & Annapurna Circuit Trek. Exciting Nepal Treks made my visit to Nepal so easy, from the airport pick to the drop off, everything was handled professionally and personally. Mr. Subash, the CEO, met me at the airport and frequently kept in touch during the trek to ensure everything was going well. You really feel like family with Exciting Nepal Treks.Scheduling everything with Sabina was very easy.Razu, was a great tour guide for the City Tour, very knowledgeable and answered all my questions.Basu and Sandesh were absolutely wonderful during the Annapurna Circuit Trek. We stayed at great tea houses. (They knew where the best food is on the way, which is great!)All in all, I highly recommend using Exciting Nepal Treks.

Pokhara tour with Basudev. Hello from Australia,I am missing those days i spent with the Exciting Nepal Treks and Expedition team. we visited pokhara for one week with the team. I liked to thank the team. they are well managed and knowledgeable. Basudev was my guide.He was an experienced and very much helpful person. Everyone in the team are very honest and experienced, we stay there as a family in our whole journey. thank you Mr. Dhruba for arranging everything in nice way and providing us such a well experienced and helpful Person (Basudev) as our guide.i am plannning to see you all there again coming days.Once again we would like to thank the team,thank you everyone

Wonderful Trip !!!. Our last trip to Annapurna circuit was awesome and we had life time experience of Wilderness and natural beauty. We would like to thank Exiting Nepal Trek and Expedition Pvt. Ltd – the best thing that could have happened to us and our trip . The whole team of the Agency is very knowledgeable of the region. The team is very well connected and was hence well informed about the conditions of the trek and always very honest with us. We very much impressed by willingness of the team to always meet our individual needs during the trek. My guests from United States enjoyed it all and have gathered a much better understanding of the life in Nepal and specifically the socio- cultural situation around the Annapuran circuit in general. Once again we would like to thank all team members of Exiting Nepal Trek and Expedition Pvt Ltd..

Second time with Exciting Nepal Trek. I did 18 days Makalu Base Camp trek with Exciting Nepal Team which was very professionally managed. My guide Shiva was so experienced and helpful. They arranged my permit,fly ticket,and other document very quickly . I am really happy with my guide and potter because of their service. Thank you all of you Exciting Nepal team for your service and kindness. Thanks Mr Dhruba ( Manager) for your excellent arrangement.Highly recommended.

Everest trek. Recently went to Everest trek up to the base camp which was my second trip to nepal,and was one of most wonderful thing I have done in my life.the sight of the world's tallest peak and my whole trip to nepal after such a devastating earthquake was very special.I want to thank exciting nepal family and my trek guide dhurba for managing my tour.

Trekking in Everest Base camp after the major Earthquake.. We did Everest base camp trek for 14 days after the two major earthquakes in Nepal. Before the trek, I was thinking about to cancel my trek like any other travelers, but the 50 % amount was already paid for our trek. We also receive suggestions from the company where we booked our trek (Exciting Nepal Treks and Expedition). The owner of the company, Subash himself was always replying and very quickly responding to all our emails and concerns. He assured us that 100 % amount will be refunded, if incase we would have to cancel our trek due to the broken trails resulting from the major earthquake. Our ticket was already booked and confirmed for Nepal and we heard the media spreading the news that Everest trail and many other trekking trails were fully destroyed. But that was NOT TRUE at all. We decided ourselves to fly to Nepal and self check then decide for the trek during our stay in Kathmandu.  Taking the suggestions of the company, we started our trek at the beginning of June. Guide Basudev from Exciting Nepal treks was extremely helpful throughout the journey. We hardly met 25 trekkers in our whole 14 days trek. The camp 'Phiriche' was affected and many tea houses were damaged. Even in Namche and Lukla, few tea houses were damaged in every camp. I met two trekkers on the way and they repeated to us that ( second time to the Everest Base camp ) they found all the trekking trails exactly the same as before and not even a single damaged was noted anywhere. We finished our trek successfully without any problem but many hoteliers and people from Khumbu were worried because the rest of the world was thinking that the trail of The Everest Base camp is destroyed. NOT TRUE. AS WE DID THE TREK BY OURSELF AND SAY IT IS SAFE AS BEFORE.Thank you Subash and the team of Exciting Nepal for helping us make our dreams come true even in such a critical situation. We will be back gain and join your company for the next trek. See you soon.

Fantastic Annapurna Base Camp trek with Beauty Nepal Adventure. We chose Beauty Nepal Adventure www.beautynepaladventure.com on the basis of their excellent website and, more importantly, the large number of very positive recommendations from numerous trekkers that have used their services for our Annapurna Base Camp trek. We were not disappointed with our choice; indeed the organisation of the trek, the care and attention afforded to us both by Mr Bijay, proprietor, and Negendra Rai, guide, was exemplary at all times. At all times during the trek and return to Pokhara we felt that we were at all times in the hands of caring professional trekking guides. Of particular note, our guide was at particular pains to report into his Pokhara base that our party was safe and well following the disastrous earthquake that struck Nepal on 26 April, and experienced by us at Annapurna Base Camp. Thanks again Beauty Nepal Trekking (email: info@beautynepaladventure.com) for a quite excellent trekking experience. We will be back at some time in the futureColin Gorton (gortoncd@gmail.com) Nigel Gooding (nrl.gooding@btinternet.com)

Enjoyable Trek from Nagarkot to Changu Narayan. Dhurba was the manager in our hotel in Kathmandu.When we asked him to recommend a hotel in Nagarkot, not only did he suggest Hotel View Point such has superb views of the Langtang range, but he also advised that we trek ourselves from Nagarkot to Chagnu Narayan. We got a taxi from Kathmandu to Bhaktapur and spent most of day there walking around the old city before moving on spent watch sunset at Nagarkot. On the way our taxi driver pointed out the ridge on which we would be hiking to Changu Narayan the next day and advised that take the left road at Telkot -of the few points on the trek when we would be on the main road. The next morning we were fortunate that the skies were clear, which meant that we had amazing views of the Langtang range from the lookout at out hotel. After breakfast the four of us set out. The hike was estimated to take c. 3 hours, but it took up longer as we stopped to observe village life and take photos of the amazing scenery. If we were needed clarity on directions, where was always someone local who we could ask and they would point the way. That hike was one of the highlights of our trip. It was great to be able to go off on a trek by ourselves; we could go at our own pace and interact with the local people that we met along the way. Dhurba was spot-on with his recommendations - the hotel, the hike and the transport - all of which made our side-trip to Bhaktapur, Nagarkot and Changu Narayan most enjoyable.

Excellent trek in the Himalayas. A dream come true, hiking in the Himalayas! Excellent, positive, encouraging guide. Kamal was thoughtful of all of us and went out of his way to accommodate our needs. He was organized and informative and worked well with our 2 porters. My daughter and I hiked to Annapurna Base Camp. The walk up and down the endless stairs and through the rain forest was enchanting. Fog and rain came and went, but so did fabulous views and countless goats and sheep! We enjoyed the tea houses along the way with the delicious food and wonderful people. One night we had an incredible view of the night sky filled with brilliant stairs and the Milkyway. People from all over the world joined us on the trail and in the guest houses. I hope to return someday and I definitely recommend Ace the Himalaya.

Trip of a lifetime. I completed my #1 bucket list trip this year and Ace the Himalaya made it possible! My trek to Everest Base Camp was so lovely; Ace and Kishore, our INCREDIBLE guide, made the trip enjoyable and easy. We didn't need to worry about a thing and the communication with Ace before the trip was great.

Everest Base Camp Trek. The trek was incredible! We had an amazing time and could not have wished for better views of Mt Everest.Mansing and his team of porters were so kind and friendly. We felt comfortable and welcome everywhere we went. We would highly recommend this trip for anyone up for an adventure.If you go to the Himalayas you must do it with Ace the Himalaya!Definitely and experience we will never forget.

Annapurna Circuit. The trek by far exceeded all expectations! This was my second trip to Nepal with Ace the Himalaya and I would wholeheartedly recommend using Ace as the tour organizer and guide service to anyone and everyone who visits the area. We had a small group (there were 7 of us) and were expertly led by our Head Guide, Santosh and his Assistant, Rupesh. Both were knowledgeable and extremely helpful to one and all. It was "personal" as both Santosh & Rupesh made us feel like a team and also like a family, of which they were a part! I consider them each my friends for life.

Great trip to EBC!. This was a great trip guided by a professional company with one of the best guides (Kishore) we've ever seen. The trip had experiences and views we will remember forever! Everything was taken care of by Ace and made our experience that much better. Our guide Kishore was so knowledgable of the area and spoke very well which made our experience that much better because we could ask questions and really learn from him. The culture, people, and overall experience was fantastic. There were definitely hard times but that was to be expected for this type of trip.

Superb Annapurna Base Camp Trek. I treaveled ABC and Poon Hill last October 1st to 11th.First, Staff was very good.My tour guide Mr. Raj and porters are really professional and friendly.They always made their effort to have us successful trek.Food and Accomodations are really good also.Highly recommend the tour and the tour company.
Upper Dolpo Circuit. Ace did everything well, and I was very appreciative of Krish our guide and the rest of the support team. A truly wonderful experience and highly recommended .

Everest Base Camp and Kalapatthar. Our trek to Everest Base Camp was an amazing experience. The altitude was a challenge but the views were breathtaking! Could not fault ACE or our guide Mansingh, who went to every effort to help us out, even when we were sick. Highly recommended and if I go back to try the Annapurna circuit I would certainly use ACE again.

Annapurna circuit trek. I have just finished the 23 day Annapurna circuit trek with Ace the Himalaya. I was placed in a group of 4 and our guide Nirajan and porters Chandra and Gakul helped make it a wonderful experience. This was their first trekking assignment with ACE and I think they did a great job of handling the different personalities in our group and the different speed of the walkers. Nirajan's English is very good and although Chandra & Gakul's was limited, we still were able to communicate and they were a lot of fun to be with. Chandra was extremely helpful and on numerous occasions carried our bags to the accomodation and then walked back to carry our day packs also.The trek itself was great, beautiful scenery and diverse terrain, Nirajan tried to avoid walking on roads where possible. The accomodation in general was good It was always clean but sometimes a little too basic and we came to realise that just because a tea house claimed they had hot showers didn't necessarily mean the water was hot, or that they had water! Food was generally good, although with every place having the same menu, after 3 weeks, you're over it!!Wifi was available in most tea houses but limited in strength of signal.The Kathmandu city tour was very good, Dil our guide was extremely informative.I would highly recommend using ACE for any trek and thank you Nirajan, Chandra and Gakul for a wonderful time in Nepal, hopefully I will be back.

Annapurna Circuit. A few friends and I booked the 23-day Annapurna Circuit tour with Ace the Himalaya, showed up and, basically, Ace did the rest. We were paired with a couple of other trekkers and Santosh, our guide and his crew tirelessly looked after our comfort and safety and got us over the 17,800 ft Thorung La Pass without a hitch. Santosh's outdoor skills and leadership abilities are par excellence and Prem truly runs an outstanding company. I had a spectacular experience and I would not hesitate to book my next trip to Nepal with Ace.

Annapurnas. This is the second time we have used Ace as our tour provider. Once again we found them to be excellent. They are professional, friendly and thorough in everything they do. They ensure that you the client, maximize your enjoyment of each and every attraction.

Trip of a lifetime!!. I set off to trek the Himalayas , by myself , and after a lot of research I chose this company for many reasons. They're easy to communicate with - Sajiya and Kathy are very prompt to provide the info needed. My trek was EBC with Island Peak , 19 days plus I did a 3 day city tour . Prem Khatry owns and runs a great business, I had the pleasure of seeing him a couple of times , he's very involved with each and every group that signs up with his company. To take personal interest speaks volumes ! My trekking guide was Rajan Rokaha - Raj - what an amazing guy ! Beyond his knowledge, people skills , flexible and tactful , funny and caring , I felt like I was in the most capable hands trekking through the beautiful mountains! I'd book my next adventure based on his availability!! Oh , and had it not been for Raj I wouldn't have some fun and spectacular pictures from this trip !!! On my birthday he surprised me with a cake and made arrangements to get blessings from one of the Buddhist monks at Tengboche monastery .. Talk about going above and beyond! He's a top notch man !Surya was one of the porters - an absolute delight ! Both of them made sure that all is running smoothly more so during the tough parts of this trip. Pemba and Pema were at Island Peak and there's no denying the skills they have to take people up the mountain. Communication was less forthcoming than what I would've liked given that I'm a novice at technical climbs but this was one part of my trip. And Prem has found a solution to improve it , thank you Prem. Trekking in the Himalayas is difficult and AMAZING and it matters a great deal which company you choose to facilitate it ! Go Ace !!!!!! My city guide Dil is a well of knowledge and information about Nepal , its history, people , faith , philosophy! I learnt so much going around Kathmandu valley with him !He's easy going , very sweet and patient and he's enriched my knowledge a great deal ! I highly recommend Ace The Himalaya, they've made this an unforgettable, memorable experience for me ! Thank you Raj , Surya , Dil , Pemba, Pema , Sajiya and Prem !

Everest and an unforgettable experience.. Our trek to Everest Basecamp was unforgettable. Our guide was caring and incredibly knowledgeable about the area, its history and ecological quirks. Our porters were friendly and professional and we had an amazing time. My wife got sick on the way back and the Ace team went out of there way to get her back down quickly and safely. I would definitely use Ace on our next trip to Nepal.

2nd Trek with Ace The Himalaya and just as remarkable as the first time!. I just came back from another trip with Ace the Himalaya and loved it just as much as the first trip! My first trip was in October 2014 on the Everest Base Camp Trek. The guides (Toya and Sunil) were very helpful and professional, it was an overall remarkable trip! The most recent trip I just returned from 2 weeks ago, was to Annapurna Base Camp. I was so impressed and pleased with booking with Ace The Himalaya before, there was no question that I would book with them again for this trek. Once again our guide Kamal was very professional and good at leading us and answering questions. Our porters were very friendly and pleasant as well. It's nice having local guides and porters so you really get to experience the culture and have competent people leading you. Since this second trip was after the earthquake I was curious how things in Nepal may have changed, but everything I saw and experienced with Ace The Himalaya was still first class and I felt very safe being in Nepal throughout the entire trip. I highly recommend this company to anyone!

Rebuild volunteering and Poon Hill trek. This was a well organised trip that saw a group of us helping with the rebuild of a school in a small remote village, sleeping in tents, followed by a four day trek in the Annapurna region. I can highly recommend Prem from Ace the Himalaya who arranged the itinerary. We were looked after so well in the village. There was a cook who produced delicious meals and our guide, Raju, who looked after us everyday was excellent. He also took us on the trek and encouraged us along the way when things got tough! Always smiling and so kind. The two young porters, Santosh and Madan carried our packs and laughed along the way. It was an amazing life changing experience.

Great rebuilding & trekking program with excellent guidance. Casually browsing the Scoopon website, I came across the 13-day Rebuild Nepal and Annapurna Trek Program. I was so attracted the great idea of combining volunteering and trekking that I decided to book it right there and then. The program not only delivered what it said it would on the website, it was bettered by the excellent guidance from our tour guide Raju whom I felt privileged to meet. Raju has been a fantastic tour guide in many ways. He always make sure we were well during volunteering and trekking. He triple checked that we never left anything in the hotel or guesthouses. He answered to all the questions - touristy or personal - we had for him. He put us at ease in every situation with great sense of humour. He sent me to airport and makes sure everything is OK. Throughout this trip, he became not just a tour guide but also a friend. Overall, I highly recommend this tour if you like to help rebuilding Nepal yet also enjoy a little bit of trekking and sightseeing. You'd get to see the beautiful places as Nepal is well known for, and also meet the beautiful people throughout the journey.

Excellent Annapurna Circuit trek!. Very well organized, attention to detail, excellent guide, porters, and office staff. Other trekkers were asking us for info as we were the best prepared and best informed!

Great hike to Everest Base Camp!. Ace provided excellent support and guidance for the hike to Everest Base Camp. They're very knowledgeable about the area and what's required for trekkers to reach base camp. They were very helpful in coaching us the speed to go, what to bring, how much to drink, etc. It made the overall experience very, very nice!

Volunteer Program+Annapurna then EBC. I signed up for 2 programs with Ace for a total of 4 weeks. The first one was the Volunteer Program with a trek around Annapurna and the second one was to Everest Base Camp. My guide Santosh to the Volunteer Program was fabulous! He was very personable and thoughtful, always checking in with my group to make sure our needs were met and we were having a good time. With any issues that came up, he was quick to address them himself straight to the source. I could absolutely count on him. My guide Rajan and his assistant guide Rabi were just spectacular. They were professional all the way, keeping us apprised of the trek and what to expect all the way. They were prepared for any issues that could possibly occur (which did!) My brother had altitude sickness and had to quit the trek. They came up with a plan to guide the rest of the team, along with getting mine and his belongings separated properly and carried them back and forth from where my brother had to stop and where the next guesthouse was. They were phenomenal in their care. I'm truly thankful for their care, their professionalism and their personable warm nature.

Upper Dolpo Trek. It was an amazing 20 days into this remote, but beautiful area. It is a vast landscape. We were fortunate to have been able to observe the lives of the people who live in this harsh, but stunning region. While the trekking was at times tough, with three passes over 5,000m, we were very well cared for by our team. The food was amazing, and our guide, Chris, was both knowledgeable and entertaining.

ABC & Poon Hill Trekking. 2016년 9월, 안나푸르나 베이스 캠프와 푼힐 전망대 트레킹을 다녀와서 리뷰남깁니다. 우기의 끝이라 비가 조금씩 내렸지만 트레킹을 하는데 전혀 지장은 없었습니다. 오히려 햇빛이 강하지 않아 걷기에 좋을 때도 있었습니다. 고라파니까지 올라가는 둘째날과 ABC에 올라갈때는 무척 힘들었지만 MBC와 ABC에서 안나푸르나를 보는 순간 힘들었던 기억은 모두 사라질 정도로 경치가 아름다웠습니다.이번 트레킹이 저에게 의미있었던 또 다른 이유는 좋은 사람들을 만났기 때문입니다. 책임감 강하고 믿음직스러운 베스트 가이드인 Santosh, 듬직한 포터 Amish, 그리고 미소가 아름다웠던 Punam! 다음 트레킹에도 이 분들과 함께 했으면 좋겠습니다.Trip to ABC and Poon Hill is unforgettable trekking in my life. Going up with drizzle and down with slippery trail was quite challenging but it was worthwhile to see Annapurna and Machhapuchhre. Fortunately, I was able to see the beautiful scenery at MBC and ABC as the weather was getting clearer.in addition, I was fortunate to meet the best trekking guide, Santosh during my trip. He was knowledgeable, reliable, and responsible. Without his support and help, I had not been able to complete the trekking. I would give my big thank-you from my bottom heart to our porters, Amish and Punam. Good memory with them enriched my trip to ABC.I would love to come again, if possible, with my best guide Santosh and porters.
ABC Treking. One of my greatest travel of my life. Hard but worth it. Our guide Santosh was great. Managed the treking very well.

Annapurna circuit biking. Very good tour with excellent guide, Santosh.Enjoyed my time riding the Annapurna circuit, which has many challenges for bikers.From mudslides, steep climbs, up to overcoming the limited available oxygen at high altitudes, and even some snow biking.Well organized by Ace and Santosh, who, with his experience, made the trip look easy.

unforgettable. Ace provided us with everything we needed for an unforgettable experience trekking the Himalayas. Immediate turnaround time to every question we had before our trek, personalised support and maximum involvement throughout and after the trek, a guide, Rajan, whose competence, experience, flexibility and ability to cater for every whim of ours were unmatched and porters – Sujan, Poshan and Krishna - whose unwavering smiles cheered us at the end of each day. We are going back and we are choosing the same team for our next trek!

The roof of the world where my soul found a home.. I was fortunate to have an Ace the Himalaya guide by the name of Bharat on my Everest Base Camp trek and I could not be more fortunate for how amazing and life changing an experience this was. Bharat was patient, knowledgeable an absolutely wonderful and gentle soul. The experience, professionalism and top-notch hospitality of Ace the Himalaya is something I would highly recommend anyone trekking anywhere they offer their services. I came back from my trek with many memories that I will not only cherish and treasure but also help me when I need a reality check. I visited and saw the highest peak in the world, played soccer with monks, ate delicious Dhal-Bat and fell in love with the Sherpa people and their great culture. The trek was not easy but an experience this life-altering never is and never will be. I can say that my experience was enhanced because I booked with Ace the Himalaya.

Volunteer Program And Poon Hill Trek. The trip allowed a large group to successfully experience in 3 weeks what it was like to live in Nepal and how the locals spent there time there. Exploring the Annapurna conservation area was an unreal adventure. To top it all off the guides were very hospitable and informative. Highly recommended.

Arupokhari Volunteer Program. Definitely one of the best trips I have been on. We were guided by Santosh and Dipesh for the entire duration of the 3 week stay, where we began by volunteering in Ratmate village and ended with a beautiful trek up to Poon Hill. They have been extremely accommodating and friendly, ensuring that all our needs were met. I would definitely recommend Ace the Himalaya for anyone considering a guide when exploring Nepal.

GV trip 2016. Ace the himalayas surpassed all expectations we had for the trip. Would definitely recommend for anyone going to Nepal. From day one, we were greeted with a warm welcome by our friendly tour guides Santosh and Dipesh. We were then driven to our hotel, where all our rooms had already been sorted out, and everything went really smoothly. During the times that there were hiccups, our tour guide santosh was always there to help us out, and we were really grateful for having him around. During our stay at Ratamate Village, the cooks were excellent, tending to our smallest requests, and they served us juice and snacks daily. Not to mention, the food exceeded all expectations my team had for it, and Santosh would never fail to ask us if we had sufficient food and if he could help us in anyway. During the trek, Santosh and Dipesh never failed to entertain us with their humour, but more importantly they never stopped encouraging us to push harder until we reached our destinations. It was so amazing having such funny, sociable and knowledgeable guides, as they were able to answer many of the queries which we had. Although we didnt communicate much with our porters, they were always smiling, and never failed to help us out. Thank you santosh for making our trip to Nepal truly amazing, and always going the extra mile to help us in anyway possible. You were always attentive to the smallest details, and our trip wouldnt have been the same if not for you. You make us want to come back to Nepal to explore, and trek more. Thanks also for organising the mountain biking for the few of us even though this was not part of the trip. Definitely recommend Ace the Himalayas for anyone wanting to explore Nepal. Thanks for the memories

So well organised and fun!!. An amasing trip through Nepal starting with some volunteer trip and ending in a hike. Let my group really experience village life and see the beautiful sights of Nepal whilst also doing our bit. Our guide also really made the trip incredibly enjoyable.

UNSW GV Arupokhari Volunteer Program. We had an excellent time in Nepal during last three weeks. We had Santosh and Dipesh as our guides for the whole trip. This trip could not be so smooth and that fun without them. They picked us up at the airport when we arrived, arranged a day tour for us to show a few famous tourist attractions in Kathmandu, took a splendid care of us during the days in village & trekking. They even became our mountain bike tour guides to guide us exploring the countryside of kathmandu.The food and accommodation in both village and during trekking are unexpectedly good. The boys in the village cook good food, attentive to our every enquiry regardless it is a big or small problem and accommodate our needs and preferences to the best.The hosts of the guesthouses are super helpful as well, cook good food and very friendly. One of the hosts even invited us to watch and join his dance during our stay at his place. The atmosphere at that night was awesome; it is undoubtedly one of my highlights of this trip.Thanks to Santosh and Dipesh for accompanying us throughout the whole journey, could not have had better guides. I would choose Ace again for sure if I am going back to Nepal next time.

Arupokhari (Ratmate) volunteering trip - UNSW GV 2016. Our team of 17 University students, guided by Santosh and Dipesh, spent 3 amazing weeks in Nepal! On arrival, Ace picked us up from the airport and drove us to our hotel in the touristy Thamel district. The following day, Ace organised a city tour for us. This included a visit to Pashrupathi ( a world heritage site), Dhurba Square and the Monkey Temple. Our two week stay at Ratmate went all too fast! Saying goodbye to the beautiful village and locals was extremely hard. At all times, the cooks ensured we had enough to eat (and the food was delicious), accommodation was comfortable and we were given the opportunity of both re-contstruction, as well as teaching at a local secondary school. The locals were so friendly and accommodating. We were always met with big smiles and ‘namaste’s’ all round ( a common trait amongst Nepalese people). During our last week, we trekked from Nayapul to Poon Hill in Gorephani. Fortunately, we had 9 porters to carry our bags. Although we didn’t converse much with the porters, it was truly amazing to witness their strength and kindness towards us as well. Santosh and Dipesh were amazing guides during the trek! They encouraged us to keep on walking when the trail got difficult, and entertained us with stories of their lives and families. Ace organised comfortable and cosy accommodation at 3 guess houses, that truly exceeded my expectations. Our trip to Nepal would not have been the same without Ace, Santosh and Dipesh! It was truly a life-changing experience, and the best three weeks of my life. - Shakti S

EBC Trek: Could never do it without the dedication of Ace the Himalaya's Guide and Porter. Ace the Himalaya has proved to the most reliable tour company in Nepal. From the start of the enquiry, I was asking alof of questions to Prem, the MD. He religiously answered each and every one of them with much patience. It was a first hand experience of dedication that I experienced. My guide for the trek was Nimesh Nepal and porter, Dipak Thamang. Nimesh is an excellent guide, and a better friend, who made us feel safe in his care all the time. We were 2 ladies, so trust and comfort were important to us when assessing a guide, whom we have to be with for the next 12 days. Nimesh is very mature for his age, and very interestingly, he is able to switch from a professional, serious guide, to a friend who could make us laugh with his silly jokes. The strenuous, long, trek over 12 days were spent playing catching and throwing snowballs, discussing life values, drawing portraits, dancing in the snow, and so much laughing. We enjoyed every moment. During the times when the whether wasn't too good, Nimesh switched to a seemingly serious, professional guide whom we can depend on for safety and navigation. He was also taking care of his porter, Dipak very well, ensuring his safety. Just like how a leader should be.Dipak is a young 20 year old porter, who has such strength. He speaks minimal English, so we don't converse much. However, for many times, he went beyond his duties as a porter, and took care of us ladies by catching us when we fall, and staying back to walk slowly with us, rather than just walking at his usual fast speed and porting the bags from point A to point B. The entire experience was life-changing, amazing, and I give 10 stars..heck even 100 stars, for such excellent service. Thank you Ace the Himalaya!!

Great support on this trip!. I had incredible support on the EBC trek. First over e-mail from Prem to whom I asked many questions; then from Sajiyah in the office when I started to get cold feet about the trip and she explained all of my options and the flexibility of the guides; and finally, and most importantly, from Krish, the main guide who stuck with me the entire trip, even though I was way behind everyone else, and gave me constant encouragement. It is really because of him that I made it. He made me feel welcome and belonging even though I worried all the time about my slowness. He was smart and funny as well.

Amazing Trek into the Himalayan Wilderness!. I went solo and joined a group trek to Everest Base Camp and Kalapatthar. Ace the Himalaya did an amazing job making sure that we were well prepared for the trip and our lead guide, Raj, was hilarious as well as incredibly knowledgeable about the mountains, villages, and more importantly, the best ways to get us up/down from altitude safely. We were incredibly blessed with great weather during the off season, and had an absolutely beautiful trekking experience.

Adventure Multi-Sport..All the adventure you can ask for... We booked the multi-sport adventure tour because we wanted to see more of Nepal than just base camp. We went white water rafting, bungee jumping, mountain biking, hiking.. basically anything that ended in "ing". They took excellent care of coordinating all the events. Nepal is not a super easy place to travel with traffic that is extremely unpredictable, but they were able to accommodate for all of us. Chris was our tour guide and he was very knowledgeable and took our requests for travel changes and suggestions. Only thing I would recommend is to bring a little mask to combat the pollution/dust.

Unforgettable Rebuild Nepal & Annapurna Trek Tour!!!. I could not have made a better decision than to book the Rebuild Nepal and Annapurna Trek tour for my first trip to Nepal. Their customer service was great - my questions were always answered in a timely manner - and the pre-departure meeting made me feel like I was in great hands. Throughout the entire trip the guides and cooks were extremely professional, yet so much fun to be around. Santosh did a WONDERFUL job as a guide - everyone absolutely loved him - and the others on the trip were so much fun. Ace the Himalaya put together an itinerary that enabled me to get culture, physical activity, beautiful scenery, and a lot of fun into one trip - well done!! I highly recommend using Ace on your next trip to Nepal.

An incredible experience. Everest base camp is an beautiful place - but the people you're surrounded by make it great. Madan and Rabi were the best base camp guides you could ever wish for and treated me like one of the family. Ace the Himalaya did an excellent job providing information on preparation, travel, insurance etc and were always very responsive when i had questions. An incredible experience with incredible people.

Ace the Himalayas - Everest Base Camp Trek Review. Our EBC guide, Ram Hari, did a great job throughout the trek. He was extremely friendly, knowledgeable, and personable. The porters and assistant guide were also great. Always felt safe and comfortable with everything Ace the Himalayas did. Would recommend Ace to other people.

Adventure multi-sport. Ace the Himalaya provided me with one of the best experiences of my life. I had tons of fun and recommend the hotel upgrade options in Pokhara and Chitwan. Manoj, the main guide, was excellent and communicated the itinerary very well. I'm hoping to use them again for future treks in the Himalayas.

Trip of a lifetime!. Amazing! Incredible! Life changing! Beautiful! Challenging! I can go on and on!!! The company does a great job of communicating with you prior to the trip, during and even after the trip. They made me feel at ease even though this was my first over seas trip. The guides were by your side every inch of the way and made sure you got whatever you needed. Although the altitude made things a challenge, they made sure you had enough time to get acclimated. Prem runs a very professional business and I highly recommend him.

Easy to plan and top notch guides. I used Ace The Himalaya several different days and their guides Robbie, Krishna and Kumar were great! Ready to answer questions, and helpful!! The communication via email before I got to Kathmandu made planning my days easy and everything was clear, no hidden costs, this is a fabulous service to use in Nepal!!!!

Trek to Everest Base Camp. My husband and I recently completed the EBC trek in May, and it was 100% the trip of a lifetime. We were paired with another couple that we absolutely loved and have become life-long friends with, and we cannot say enough amazing things about our guide, Suman. He went above and beyond every day to make sure we were comfortable, that all our many questions about the culture and areas we were in were answered, and that we were having the best time possible. And it worked! We plan to stay in touch with Suman as he is just a wonderful person in general, and hope we can come back to Nepal soon and try the Anna Purna Circuit with Ace and Suman! I also wanted to say that we met multiple like-minded trekkers along the way that we became friends with and compared our guides and companies, and without a doubt, Ace the Himalaya was the easiest to work with, offered the best prices, and they were so helpful getting everything set up for us both before and after the trek. Their whole team combined made what could have been a very complicated trip considering foreign travel, multiple groups, etc so organized and well managed.If you're looking for an adventurous trip with some of the most spectacular views in the world, a place to meet fantastic people, and a company that will help you do it- Ace is the place to go and Suman is the man to request!! You will not be disappointed with your trip- it's impossible, believe me!Crystal & NatMaine USA

13 day Rebuild Nepal and Annapurna Trek...just brilliant !. This was my first trip to Nepal and I am very happy that I did it with Ace . The whole experience was made easy because of them and their very caring staff. Our lead guide Santosh was amazing and took care of everything...I didn't have to worry about a thing. We started our trip with the rebuild program in Arupokhari where we helped with the early stages of the foundations. The work was hard but we all came together as a team and I found it to be one of the most rewarding things I have ever done. The cooks looked after us very well and ensured we were well fed...i celebrated my birthday on the rebuild and the cooks made me a birthday cake...a chocolate one at that! We left this amazing little village and went off to our next adventure which was our trek to Poon Hill...and all I can say is ...wow....words cannot express how fantastic it was. The scenery....the village life...even the numerous tea and guest houses we passed on our way up...and up we went! Santosh eased us all up there and when we finally got to Poon Hill we all sat in wonder....just magnificent. My whole experience in Nepal is hard to put into words but the mix of humanitarian work with a trek is a winner. I encourage anyone to do the 13 day rebuild and Annapurna trek with Ace. They just made everything so easy. I trust them which is why I have just booked the Everest Base Camp trek with them...I wouldnt do it with anyone else.

Rebuild and Poon Hill Trek - Amazing Experience!. My partner and I just got back from our first trip to Nepal with Ace the Himalaya, and it was amazing. I would say it was a once in a life time trip, but we were so impressed with Nepal and our experience with Ace (our guide, Santosh, was the best!) we have decided we are going back in a few years. We chose the Rebuild-Poon Hill Trek program through Ace, since it felt like one of the best ways to give back to a community that was devastated by the 2015 earthquake. Arrival and departure at the airport were taken care of by Ace, making travel days less stressful. Our drivers to get to the village of Arupokhari were very skilled, both navigating Kathmandu traffic and on the 4 wheel drive roads to the village. In the village we were housed in a tented camp, with comfortable sleeping pads provided. All the meals cooked for us were excellent, and there was always plenty of food. The green beans, while one of the more simple dishes, was one of the most memorable (probably due to all the butter and garlic!). Everything was always very tasty. Our volunteering work was helping to clear and level the foundation of the house, followed by helping with the early stages of foundation building. It was hard work, but very rewarding. Life in the village was also a rewarding experience. I did get sick while in the village (rookie mistake, don't drink the "safe drinking water" in the 5 gallon jugs at the airport), and Santosh was an excellent caregiver. He took me to the medical center in Aarughat and the Dr there knew exactly what to do. I was out of commission for one day of volunteering, but thanks to Santosh's quick actions to getting me to the medical center it was only one day. The trekking to Poon Hill was an equally amazing experience. We lucked out with the first break in clouds in a few days, resulting in a sunset hike as opposed to sunrise.All in all, we had an wonderful time with Ace the Himalaya. Santosh, our assistant guide Dipesh(spelling), the porters, cooks, and drivers were all fantastic. 10/10 would recommend, and we will be booking with Ace again when we come back in a few years! Technical recommendations: bring 3 passport pictures with you... Ace needs 2 and the travel visa needs 1. Water purification tablets were needed on the trek, either bring from home (what we did) or be prepared to buy in Pokhara. Trekking poles are recommended, you can cheap but reliable ones in Kathmandu or Pokhara for 800 rupees.

Rebuild Nepal and Annapurna Trek. Me and my brother had an amazing experience with Ace. We participated in the rebuild program where we were stationed in Arupokhari and helped the locals set up the foundation for one of the new homes Ace was building. We met lovely people from the village ranging from elders who would give us nepali tea to the children who would visit us during their breaks. Several days later we were hiking and looking amongst some of the best mountain ranges I've ever seen on top of Poon Hill. Definitely recommend it and Definitely ask for Santosh as a guide if you can. Trust me ;).

Everest Base Camp Trek with lead guide Kumar Thapa. My husband and I have only the best things to say about Ace the Himalaya and our experience trekking through beautiful Nepal. Our lead guide, Kumar Thapa, was incredibly helpful, supportive, friendly, informative and fun! We were always well taken care of by our guide and the assistant guide. It's tough work trekking at high altitude in unfamiliar places but our guide did a great job at helping to make our experience enjoyable and unforgettable. We will always be grateful to Kumar and the Ace the Himalaya team for being apart of our memories of the adventure of a lifetime!

Incredible Trip!. Amazing! My guides Dil, Hem and Ram all took excellent care of me. All very knowledgeable in all things Nepal. My driver Ganesh, well, you couldn't ask for a better one. Everyone was extremely helpful, generous and kind. Nepal itself was beyond my expectations. Ace the Himalaya went above and beyond to make my visit worthwhile. I will definitely be back and will sign on with them again

Nepal - Scenery, Challenge plus Culture. Our recent trip to Nepal April / May 2016 was enriched by our excellent local guide Nemish from Ace the Himalaya His willingness to answer our probing questions on not just Nepal but his own life enabled us to learn plenty. Culture is an experience in itself and the stark contrast with ours in the land of Oz added so much to what was a fantastic trip. Nimesh used his experience to ensure not a wasted minute. Look forward to meeting him again when next we visit Nepal.

Amazing trekking experience. From my initial inquiry to the departure from Kathmandu we received only but the best service from this company. All my inquiries were answered very specific and promptly. Sajiya was my contact person and she dealt with our booking, customized trekking package and special requests in a very professional way. It just gives one the reassurance that you are dealing with a company that knows their stuff. Manoj was assigned as our trekking guide and we had 3 porters, Kalika, Sandip and Krishna. We could not have asked for better- supportive, friendly and very willing to help when the road got tough (and it did!!). We could not have asked for a better support system! Thank you guys!!! Accommodation overall were good, some places probably the best what one can expect. Thorough research is essential, especially when you are a first time trekker in the Himalayas. We trekked from Lukla to Tendboche( had time constraint) and looking back it was the most amazing experience ever. I highly recommend this company and thanks to all for making this such a memorable experience.

14- day Annapurna Base Camp Trek. Amazing! I was a solo-woman traveller and very nervous to do this trip on my own. However, as soon as I landed in Kathmandu I was greeted by my amazing guide, Rajkumar! He was very kind, and super enthusiastic! Right away I was brought to the beautiful hotel, and people treated me like family! Kathmandu is overwhelming, especially to a solo-traveller, but they answered all of my questions and made sure I was comfortable. The actual trek was incredible. The views and the people you meet will change your life. The accommodations were perfect, and my guide always made sure I had the best room available! This company is truly a step above anyone else! My only regret is that I didn't stay longer! Be brave, and sign up for this trip with Ace, you won't regret it!
Everest Base Camp Trek. Great experience! Our guide - Madan - was a pleasure to trek with! Funny and informative. Can't wait to get back out there and use Ace the Himalaya again!

Annapurna trek and Pokhara. Resham our guide was fantastic, he showed us round Pokara. We visited The Davis Falls, the bat caves, the Tibetan refugee camp,and the Gurkha Museum . It was great to be shown these places by such an enthusiastic and knowledgable guide who also had a wonderful sense oh humour. A really memorable day.

amazing company. Ace the himalaya did a great job on the organisation of this wonderful journey! We all had a great time, it was such a pleasure to meet all the friendly and humorous people of nepal. Our experienced and committed guide Bharat, never lost his kindness or ran out of patience. Also I want to mention the absolutely polite and friendly and so helpful porters. From the time I arrived, until the time I left, I was in very good hands and all the time feeling very welcome!!It was definitely one of the best trips I´ve ever made and the team of ace the himalaya played an important part!
fabulous tour guide. Kumar was a fabulous guide for various attractions around Kathmandu and beyond. Personable and excellent customer service. He is extremely organized whilst being flexible. +++

A genuine company, highly recommended. Myself and husband booked on the rebuild and Poon Hill Trek for 13 days with Ace the Himalaya. From the time of enquiring till we arrived home we have had first class service Prem and his team have both their people and visitors close to their hearts. Due to postponement from others we were the only 2 on this trip. Our guide Ramhari was the best, so knowledgeable and really looked after us from day 1 to departure. Thumbs up for Furi our cook who made fantastic meals though too much, Sukra who was a great off roader who got us safely to and from the village and not forgetting Sushanta who carried our bags.
