We didn't have the best driver (there's some question about his name, but I understood it as Raz). Unfortunately, he left us waiting around for about 45 minutes. Kedar was very apologetic about the wait and said he would report it to keep it from happening again. We had no problems after that and got around just fine.The next morning, Rovin picked me up at the hotel and we caught our flight to Lukla, where we met our porter, Santos. Both Rovin and Santos were great hiking companions and since they each spoke a lot more English than I did Nepalese, we were able to easily communicate. They frequently checked in with me to make sure I felt good and had what I needed and I felt extremely safe and at ease while trekking with them. By day three, we were playing cards and board games and they felt more like friends than anything else. It was a lot of fun and I'm thankful I was with them especially because I was traveling alone and would have been bored on acclimatization days and evenings without their company. They both taught me a lot about the landscape and people of Nepal. Rovin especially, taught me a good amount of language. I was in very good hands and felt extremely well looked after. The trekking was incredible and I had a really good experience, mainly because of these two guys. They took care of everything; all I had to do was walk. Because it was monsoon season, we had clouds and rain and ended up stuck in Lukla for 4 days after the trek. I wasn't worried, since I had a few extra days before I had to go back to work. Plus, Rovin and I passed time playing cards and talking. I spent my last three days in Kathmandu, mostly in the company of Rovin. I did some things I wasn't expecting and went to a few beautiful places. Rovin became a friend and I hope we stay in touch. My trip wouldn't have been the same without him- he was an essential part of the experience for me, being both an excellent guide in the mountains and a great teacher elsewhere.Overall, Ace was a great company and I would definitely use them again. They have quality people working for them and can take care of customers' needs efficiently and economically.

memorable and inspiring trip ~ everest base camp trek. did the annapurna base camp trek two years ago with ace. Because of the great experience then, ace was obviously the choice when we wanted to do the everest base camp trek this spring. Again, ace did not disappoint and we were well taken care of during the trek.special thanks to out guide raj, who made sure we ate and drank well during the trip, and who went up the steep slope of kalapattar twice when one of our members decided to summit again during descending.

I couldn't have asked for anything better. Never would I have thought that coming to Nepal and volunteering would have been such a great experience, something that has definitely left me with a lasting impression and wanting to go back. This has been mainly due to the work and great service that Ace the Himalayas gave to me and my friends. Whether it was the tea in the morning to the hiking and treking to the volunteering efforts we conducted, Ace was always there to help and I never felt a moment where I was unsafe or unguided. The friendliness of the guides and all those involved was something that definitely impacted me. The constant song and dance, as well as the true concern they had for our well-being meant a great deal to me as it ensured we were properly cared for. The catering was excellent, with a hiking chef accompanying us, the food I recieved in such a remote area was truely outside my expectations. Overall I could not have asked for more from Ace, they were brilliant in their services and the friendliness and approachability of all members of the team was fantastic. It is hence that with no hesitation I give them a 5 star rating.

A rewarding, fun filled experience. Traveling in Nepal has definitely been one of the most enlightening, eye-opening experiences thanks greatly to ACE the Himalaya and the excellent service they provide. During our volunteer work in Nepal, Ace the Himalaya made sure that we were taken very good care of. We were never without the bare necessities. The cooking staff, porters and guides were exceptional in making us feel comfortable and providing us more than just the bare necessities. They went out of their way to provide us the best! I can't speak highly enough of the guides that showed us around. They made the experience very memorable through their vibrant personalities and good English. Furthermore, the guides always gave us a helping hand when we needed help as well as ensuring that we were safe at all times. You could always count on them to look out for you. I highly recommend Ace the Himalaya and the service they provide. They always go the extra mile for you.

Great passionate guides. I went to visit the villages Ace the Himalaya is supporting through Sambhav Nepal ( http://www.sambhavnepal.org/). The guides were helpful and very passionate about their community. I had a great local village experience to see what their life looks like. I am very impressed how much support they have done and they are going to do to the villages and everybody in the community is working together. If you want to see and experience a real Nepal, Ace the Himalaya will make this happen for sure, not only they are good at trekking but also unforgettable cultural experience trip.

Awesome time!. My group was volunteering at Arupokhara, guided by Ace. Ace was great in prodiving experienced and helpful guides for my volunteer group. They were were attentive to my groups needs, especially when some of us got sick. The food was excellent and the camping was great!The trip was successful thanks to Ace the Himalayas!

Fantastic Experience. I had an amazing time in Nepal, and the ACE team really helped make the experience what it was. All the staff were helpful, friendly and really good fun, and our guides Rajendra and Gyanu were fantastic in every way! Thanks for a great trip.

Safest and Most Amazing Experience ever. Ace the Himalaya guided myself and five friends to and from a volunteering project in Arupokhara. The staff from Ace were exceptional and although their English fluency was not perfect, it was sufficient for effective communication and many fun and interesting conversations. The guides from Ace were exceptional in their knowledge of the terrain and tracks that led us to and from Gorkha, there was never a moment when we felt lost or unsafe. As well as this, they were well-prepared for any sickness or exhaustion from the participants during the trek and did well to look after all our needs and ensure our safety.The trip, as a whole, was professionally conducted and the staff from Ace only added to the experience of a lifetime in Nepal. I have no hesitation in recommending this company to any fellow travellers!

Very Pleasant. The trek itself to EBC and Kala Patthar was of course beautiful. The guide and porter were exceptionally kind, responsible, and generous. I literally didn't have to do anything for myself except for the whole walking bit. They were attentive and went out of their way to make sure that I was comfortable and well-looked after. I would definitely recommend this tour company to everyone!

The folks at Ace the Himalaya could not have been more helpful. Trekked the Everest Base Camp trail and explored a bit of Khatmandu with Ace the Himalaya. My many pre-trip e-mail questions were promptly, courteously and thoroughly answered. Our guides and drivers were so helpful and accommodating.The trek itself is fairly arduous and requires coordinating many details. Our guides, Borat and Raj could not have been more helpful or more capable. They handled every challenge calmly and graciously. I would absolutely use this agency again.

Amazing trip of a lifetime!. I recently travelled to Nepal and did Mt Everest Basecamp with Ace the Himalayas.  Ace was highly recommended by a friend of mine who had also used them to do the same trek.  My friends and I had such an amazing time trekking the Himalayas and seeing the wonders of Nepal.  Our experience was no doubt enriched by the exceptional services provided by the Ace team.  We were well taken care of at every point of our journey.  I was very apprehensive about reaching basecamp due to my fitness level but the team was extremely patient and encouraging.  I am especially grateful to our guides Raj and Bharat as they helped me to accomplish something that I never dreamed of being able to do.  The strength and spirite of the porters was such an inspiriation.  Ace also helped us organise our trip to Chitwan on very sort notice.  There, we were able to go on jungle safaris, bath with the elephants and chill out after our successful climb to Basecamp.The friendliness and hospitality of the Nepalese were exceptional.  The scenery of the mountains were simply breathtaking!! My friends and I met some amazing people along our journey.  We can not thank Ace enough for helping us create some fond memories for which we will cherish forever.  This was truely a trip of a lifetime!

Our trek to Everest Base Camp surpassed all expectations. My fiance (after a proposal at Everest Base Camp :) ) and I have just returned from an amazing trip to see Everest with Ace the Himalaya. From the first moment we touched down in Kathmandu we were made to feel so welcome. We met Chris, our trekking guide, on our first evening and we given a full briefing on what was to come. From our first meeting Chris was professional, informative and very friendly. We looked set for a great trek! And we were no disappointed. The 12 days were just great fun. Chris was fantastic throughout. He looked after every member of our group with such care, always checking that we were feeling OK. Being at the back of the group for 99.9% of the time he also had to follow me for 12 days and despite the odd clash in music tastes (Chris liking the vengaboys, me not so much) he was a great trekking companion with a brilliant mix of banter, jokes and himalayan knowledge! He even managed to take a quick snap of the base camp proposal without us realising which is something that we will treasure for ever!Overall the trip was 10 out of 10. We could not have asked foranything more from Chris, Yim & our three porters. If anyone is looking to make the trek to Everest Base Camp in the future I can 100% recommend making the journey Ace the Himalaya and Chris. You would be mad not too!

Everest Base camp. Fantastic trip!. The guides take really good care of you when you are sick. I was sick for 7 out of the 11 days , so was the slowest on the trip but Raj also known as Dr Raj, took really good care of me (had allot of patience) making sure I had medicine and ate food (even when I didnt want to as didnt feel well) to ensure i had enough energy to make it up the mountain. Definetly recommend this trip.

Everest Base Camp Trek. I picked this group mostly because of all the positive feedback from different web sites and I can say I was more than impressed. Ace helped me through a difficult visa problem in India and restructured my trip to account for a lost day as a result. They carried out a well planned comfortable itinerary with good lodgings and food for this style of trek. My guide Raj was very impressive, and paid great attention to my condition throughout the entire trip, coaching me when I needed that extra energy and resting when I didn't have it. He was well versed in recognizing signs of altitude sickeness, what foods to avoid, local customs, and attentive to my hydration status, yet was laid back enough for me to experience the Himalayas in my own style if I needed. I would strongly recommend this group to other trekkers. People I had encountered on the trip paid much more money and received treatment that appeared inferior to mine. Ask for Raj if you can as his style of guiding is probably the best you can ask for. Thanks guys for a great trip. Hope to see you again in the future. Definately one of the best experiences of my life.

Everest Base Camp Trek with Ace - HIGHLY recommended. I just completed the Everest Base Camp Trek (16 day tour) with Ace the Himalayas and have nothing but praise for the company and it's guides. From the very beginning, the Director of Ace (Prem K. Khatry) was wonderful to work with. Every time we emailed him a question or concern, he responded immediately. In fact, I don't think I've ever gotten such personalized service from a tour company before.I was with a group of six (from the US, Australia, New Zealand and Malaysia) and we all arrived at different times. Ace picked all of us up at the airport and we were taken to the Hotel Tibet in Kathmandu, which is very nice and comfortable and a 15 minute walk to the tourist center of Thamel.On Day 2 of the tour, we had a city tour of Kathmandu with stops at the Bodhnath Stupa, Pashupatinath and Bhaktapur, which were all on my list of 'things to see' while in Nepal. Luckily, I could cross them all off my list without having to arrange my own transportation and guides. How convenient! Our guide that day, Prakash, was fantastic. He is clearly a wealth of information on Nepal!There were 14 people on our EBC Trek, we had 4 Ace guides and 7 porters. I cannot say enough about the level of service they provided. We were all at different fitness levels and there was always a guide at the front and back of the group to assist as needed. Several people had issues with altitude sickness, stomach upset, etc. and the guides were right on top of it. In fact, one morning I took an asprin because my knees were a bit sore, and one of our guides, Bharat, immediately asked if I was feeling ok and if I needed anything. It was nice to know that someone was looking out for us and making sure no one came down with any serious altitude issues. Our other guide, Raj (commonly known in our group as 'Dr. Raj') kept a close watch on my friends who were sick in bed (one with tonsilitis and the other with altitude issues). He checked in on them regularly and it is such a relief to know that you'll be taken care of even though you're far from home in a country you're not familiar with. You can't put a price tag on that kind of service.In addition, the guides were fun and very easy to get along with. At night, we stayed in basic teahouses and since it was cold outside and not a lot of things to do in these small villages, the guides played cards with us at night, taught us how to play Bagh Chal (a popular board game in Nepal) and chatted with us about our day.We were all thrilled to reach Everest Base Camp and after a celebration with tea and cookies, I was still wanting to go in further to walk around the tents. I have to give a big 'thank you' to Bharat for offering to take six of us on an additional 1 hour trek into base camp (on top of the 9 hours of trekking we'd already be doing that day). It was an experience I will remember forever. Bharat's work day was lengthened an additional hour, but it provided us with a once in a lifetime experience. Incredible.To me, one of the best things about about booking a trek with Ace is that you're supporting a local Nepali company. I was highly impressed with the level of service they offered and the amount of personal attention we received thoughout our experience. I don't think a company based in an outside country would be able to provide the same level of service. If I have the opportunity to return to Nepal (and I hope I do!) there's no doubt that I'll be booking another tour with Ace.
Awesome experience!. Ace the Himalaya is a great company. We loved our trek to Mt Everest Base Camp! Gyanu was the best guide on the trail!

This trip is fantastic. Our group of 6 went to Everest Base camp and had a great time. Ace is a great company but their guide Gyanu was just the best I have seen. He was caring,attentive,entertaining, and compassionate. Anyone going with Ace should absolutely ask for him to be their guide--you will not regret it. He was a consummate professional in every way .

A tough, but rewarding holiday, made better by the staff of Ace the Himalaya.. 2 friends and I recently returned from the Everest Base Camp Trek with Ace. It was an amazing experience, made better by the friendly, energetic, and knowledgable guides and assistants from Ace. They were always available to provide assistance to anybody who needed it, were so organised that you barely had to worry about anything but the altitude and the walking.The accomodation was always the best in the town we were staying, and was reliably comfortable, especially by Himalayan standards.

Annapurna Base Camp trek-Thank you for making my dream come true. Trekking the Himalaya was my dream for years, I finally did it while leaving 3 kids at home and having a break from everything."Ace The Himalaya" helped me to enjoy NEPAL - the wonderful country with the best views by providing the best guide & porter for the Annapurna Base Camp trek & the Nagarkot area trip. Krish (Kishor Neupane) my guide was the best companionship, he took care of all my needs , anchorage me when it was hard and answered my endless list of questions about nature, culture, customs and believes. He is the kindest and funniest man I meat in my journey. Khilanath (Kancha) my porter is a young man, shay and humble with the sweetest smile and the three of us had a lot of fun and laughter.Thank you for making my dream come true.Dorit Sasson, Israel.

A fanatastic trip that showed everything that Nepal has to offer!. We spent almost 5 weeks trekking and touring around Nepal - all organized by Prem of Ace the Nimalaya. Every detail was looked after and handled with care. We spent about three weeks trekking around the Annapurna and the Everest region. We had the pleasure of having Raj (Rajendra K.C.) guide us on both treks as well as going out of his way to help us extend our visa in Kathmandu. Raj was very considerate and always advised us how to stay healthly and safe. He also packed fruit for us to enjoy every night of our trekking trip - definelty the highlight of our evening! Resham was our porter for the Annapurna area and Shiva was our porter for the Everest region and both were very strong young men with great personalities and welcoming smiles. Between Raj, Resham and Shiva - we were introduced to a couple of new card games and a board game - they were great! We were treated to a couple of city tours in Kathmandu and Pokhara - both extremely interesting! To finish off our holiday - we travelled down to Chitwan National Park and spent a couple of days exploring the jungle and viewing rhinos, monkeys, deer, tigers, wild boars, and many birds - all while on the backs of elephants! Incredible! Thanks so much!

life changing experience. I had an amazing experience in Nepal, such an adventure!! I was very sad to be leaving. I found the service was excellent, it was great not to have to worry about getting from place to place, from the moment we arrived in Nepal we were very well looked after, you could say even spoiled!! Our guides and porters were excellent, and had so much knowledge on the culture and history of Nepal which they were more than eggar to share with us. We had great fun also with our guides, singing, dancing and laughing all the way to Poonhill and back!! It was fantastic to learn and see so much of Nepal, I feel we were very lucky to have experienced so much of this beautiful country in such a short space of time. This trip has had a huge impact on my life, and i would very much like to return soon to this wonderful country and get the opportunity to spend some more time with the beautiful Nepalese people.Thank you for a wonderful service and i wish you all the best with your business, and i hope our paths will cross one day in the near future.

Wonderful experience. This tour was the first part of a trek up the Langtang Valley to Kyanjin Gompa.The tour was given by a well informed guide who spoke excellent English and made us feel at ease as we visited various,mostly cultural sites. He was happy to reply to any questions. We were driven by private car and were well looked after. It was a very interesting 5-6 hour tour.The trek was very well organised and any emails prior to booking and before we left Perth were always answered within 24 hours, always a good sign.We chose to go as our own group,so we had a guide and a porter and we would recommend this choice. It meant that we travelled at a pace to suit us,and also the lower number allows much more interaction with the guide and porter. They looked after us extremely well and we were able to enjoy the whole trip.We would recommend that paying a bit extra and using private transport is a much better option than local buses,as our transfers were relativly relaxed compared to the comments of others we met who used local transport..All in all we were very pleased with our choice of this company and would have no hesitation in using them again. Pick ups, transfers, meetings etc were all on time and the people were friendly and helpful.

A Memorable Experience with Ace the Himalaya. I used Ace the Himalaya for my Everest Base Camp Trek in March 2011. From the time they picked me up at the Airport to when they dropped me off 16 days later everything on the trip was professionally dealt with and delivered as stated on their website. The accomodation in Kathamandu was a 4 star hotel and the guest houses on the trek (from speaking to other guided trekkers) always seemed to be in the upper tier with respect to cleanliness and comfort. I even had my own shower in my room in some of the guesthouses. Robyn, my guide on the trek, was great and a pleasure to be with. He was very attentive, knowledgeable and always concerned with my well being. The porter, Santos, always stayed with us which was very convienent in case there was an unexpected change in the weather and I needed some other article of clothing. This was unlike many other porters who I observed that were several kilometers ahead of the guide and client. The tour of Kathmandu and surrounding area with Prakash on Day 2 was very imformative and an excellent introduction for a first time visitor (i.e. myself) to Nepalese culture. I had a minor issue with my visitor's visa for Nepal and Ace was more than helpful. Without hesitation Prakash took me on his motorbike to the Visitor Immigration Center in Kathamandu and straightened out the issue for me and insisted on no renumeration for his efforts. I hope to return to Nepal some time in the near future and Ace Himalaya would definitely be my first choice.

Perfect trip with a great guide!. We did the Everest Panorama Trek as we had little time but wanted a maximum experience and Ace the Himalaya delivered. Our guide, Suman Thapa, is friendly and fun loving while taking care of every detail with professionalism and experience. He knew the area well and provided a wonderful experience. The trek is remarkable in beauty and in the people of the Khumu. Ace the Himalaya operates by taking care of the little details and doing those things that make it a great time- from organizing the flights, to lodging and meals and keeping an appropriate pace for their clients- it was top quality. As the trek went on I noticed the other trekkers and their guides and I understood that Suman was in a league of his own, other trekkers were envious of the experience he was providing us. I was also impressed with the cultural and environmental sensitivity that Suman displayed and the manner in which he educated us in these areas for the Khumu.This trek is spectacular- ideal if you have little time but want to experience the big mountains and have time in this part of Nepal. I strongly encourage trekkers to hire Ace the Himalaya for a good trek. This is particularly if you are a woman alone or a small group of women- Suman and Ace the Himalaya provided a respectful and safe experience that I recommend highly.

So unbelievably great, can't wait to go again!. This was such an amaizing trip on so many levels. First, I must say we had the best guide ever. He (Suman Thapa) spoke english so well. He was incredibly knowledgable about the area we were in (Lukla to Tengboche), the local history and culture, the wildlife, every peak and elevation, the list goes on. He also told us about other treks in Nepal as I expressed great interest. He was patient and kind. could go faster or slower depending on the hikers that day. was knowledgeable in the dangers of elevation & hypothermia, as well as sincere concern when one of us was sick. Was very flexible with the trip when sickness altered the plan without any hesitation or any indication of complications with same. He was a really great guide, oh and.... so incredibly invaluable in getting us to and from Lukla as airport announcements were completely unintelligeable in english and knowledge of the maneuverings in these airports was crucial! Having done this once, I would never go without a guide and preferrably this guide (Suman Thapa). Nepal was amaizing and yet we only tasted a drop in the bucket. Such amaizing views and such wounderful people! I can't wait to go back and hike several other trails. Nepal has SOOOO MANY giant mountains it's crazy! With all the glaciers, that means endless waterfalls, rivers and creeks! soooo much to see and do, and amaizing people everywhere you go! such industrious people!

Amazing Trip. My girlfriend and I did both the Annapurna Circuit and Annapurna Sanctuary with Ace the Himalya. We planned our trip from the United States and corresponded regulary with Prem Khatry (owner) in Nepal via phone and email. He was very helpful and worked with us to create a custom itinerary. The guides spoke great English! We enjoyed our trip and would book with them again!

"The Trip of a Lifetime". Walking in the Himalayas, through the beautiful valleys, crossing the bridges over the rivers, climbing the peaks, and simply immersing myself in the Sherpa culture, seeing their villages, their homes, and how they live, was truly the experience of a lifetime. Everything I saw and experienced resonated at a deep level in me. I will be thinking about this trip for a long time to come. And my guide, Rabin, although he could walk circles around me in the thin air, was always patient and waited for me to catch up. And he always took good care of me.In Kathmandu, I was treated to a wonderful tour of the city and the temples by Prakesh, another excellent guide who shared with me his extensive knowledge of the area and it's many points of interest.All in all, I can highly recommend Ace the Himalaya.Charlie WatkinsFountain HillsArizonaUSA

My first visit to nepal. We visited Kathmandu , remote villages, Ghorka and Pokhara all organised by Ace. Our guide Kisnor ( who answered to Chris) met us at the airport with a very new spotlessly clean vehicle and this set the scene. Chris and the other guides we met all spoke perfect English. They took us sightseeing in Kathmandu and helped us with local shopping.We camped in remote villages and met some of the beautiful gentle Nepali people and children who liked to practice their English . We also stayed in three different hotels and everything was well organised. The hotels were all located off the main street, quiet for sleeping and each one even had a garden. I doubt we could have found these on our own. The hotels were very clean, probably rated three star.The company specialises in treks but in the off season they can organise for small groups. we suggested the places we wanted to visit and they did everything else.Pokhara has two very good museums, one on the Himalaya including the tribes and expiditions and the other museum is on the Gurkha soldiers.Nepal is not a wealthy country and services such as garbage collection do not operate as in a country such as Australia. If you go there please consider what you carry in ( such as plastic containers) and try to carry the emplies out.My husband who travelled with me had been to Nepal in 1971, we don't plan to wait another 40 years to visit this spectacular country again.

Great adventure, awesome service. Expedition Hiunchuli.What a great adventure. Prem from Ace the Himalaya prepared the entire expedition and our meeting upon arrival in Kathmandu was as if we would know each other for many years.After moving to the Annapurna area, we met our staff and started hiking all the way to Annapurna base camp. The service during the hike was excellent. Food was delicious and the accommodations were of good standard. At the base camp we camped and started climbing towards the peak of Hiunchuli. Even if we couldn't reach the peak due to the weather conditions and to many avalanches, we had a fantastic time with great experiences, lot's of fun and insights into the Nepali culture.I highly recommend Ace the Himalaya as organisation for treks, climbs or other adventures. There are so many in Kathmandu and I'm glad I was looking for something special and found it!

Great company providing efficient and friendly service. We visited Nepal with a Rotary team to present a week long teacher training program in a remote part of Gorkha. All our travel and accommodation arrangements were organised by Ace the Himalaya and they also organised a few sightseeing excursions for us in Kathmandu afterwards. They were very efficient and looked after us extremely well. All the staff were very friendly and knowledgable. We could not have asked for better service.

Everest Base Camp. I did the EBC tour with Ace in Jan 2011. Raj was my guide and because it was the middle of winter we didn't have any other participants but still had a ball. From the moment I contacted ACE they were great at organising the trip and answering any questions. Thre day trip in Kathmandu was very informative with Prakash. The tea houses were great even though we were often the only people there as most trekkers are smart enough to avoid winter but it was unbearable (minus 20 celsius). I wouldnt hesitate is recommending Ace

Beauty, nature, action & adventure - ACE made it real.... It's now almost a year ago - but never I could forget any of these countless outstanding moments during my trip in the Annapurna-Valley!Starting in Besisahar, like all the people who are doing the Annapurna-circuit, and walking through this ineffable beauty of nature, with all its shining colors... Meeting so many people from around the world and having interesting talks and funny evenings! Being teached by Suman and Pemba, my great guides, gave me a wonderful insight into the culture, land and people, how they live and so much more!In Pisang Village, Pemba, me and our team left the others - heading towards Pisang Peak! The days on the mountain were full of unforgetable moments! Just everything was fantastic... The steep hike up the slopes; the evenings and nights in the great VE25 tent; the food - that is soooo delicious, as no guesthouse could ever keep up with and I almost always ate ways too much - I just couln't stop with all these healthy & tasty veggies and the huge varieties of meals our cook prepared!And then, of course, the summit-day! Starting in the middle of the night, with headlamp and warm clothes, we headed up towards the top - and many hours later, the sun just has risen, we arrived at a surprisingly wind-calm summit!What a moment.... no words could ever describe!!!Pemba always let me feel very safe. He is a highly skillful climbing guide, handling every situation on the mountain!The tour never stopped with revealing new stunning views, moments of happiness and laughter.... adventures... and so much more!I thank Pemba, Suman, Prem and all the ACE-members for this unforgettable, unique experience...Your way of spoiling your clients is really outstanding!See you all very soon...Namaste!

Awesome. From our first phone call to Kathy - the Australian Rep, the entire team were so helpful and orgainised. The trip itself was absolutely incredible and even though it didn't quite go to plan, Prem and our guide, Bharat, were always there including reorganising our entire trek. Bharat and the porters were always helpful as well as knowledgeable making our trip fantastic. I would defiantly recommend Ace the Himalaya if thinking of trekking through the wonderful country of Nepal.

Everest Base Camp adventure!. Regardless of the circumstances or situation, my guide from Ace was always professional and went to great efforts to ensure I was well taken care of. My guide and porter could not have been more patient, encouraging and supportive. I can't describe only one memorable part of my trek, as the entire trek itself was a wonderful experience! The views were spectacular and the chance to meet and chat with other trekkers in the evenings at the guest houses was always provided great conversation and learning experiences! Even though I did not reach Base Camp (due to my own physical limitations) I still had a fantastic experience that changed my life! Thank you Ace for making it a safe and wondertful experience!

A dream come true. my daughter and I had the most fantastic time trekking to base camp with Ace. From day 1 our enquiries and booking was straightforward and prem in the office answered our emails by return. On arriving in Kathmandu we were whisked through the mayhem of traffic to our hotel and given good advice on where to eat if we wanted to go outwith the hotel.The following day we were taken round kathmandu to all the sights and the guide was excellent and very enthusiastic.We were met by our trekking guide Raj and taken to the airport for our flight to lukla which was amazing. From then on Raj looked after us, he knew everything about the area, knew the names and heights of every mountain we could spot! Yem our porter did a great job carrying our gear and was an all round really nice guy. We could not have asked for better service on the mountain and by the end of the trip we treated each other as friends. Our favourite part was climbing Gokyo Ri starting in the early hours, the view from the top was breathtaking. The few tips i would give are climb kalapathar in the afternoon when the sun is on everest and be meticulous in your hygeine especially your drinking water, we found the trip quite easy because we stayed healthy, people who didn't fell by the wayside. The reason we chose Ace was becuse they were a nepalese based company with good enviromental policys and we feel we made a great choice.Thanks Ace and your team.

Trekking in the Himalayas. A great trekking company. The price was very reasonable and easy to pay. The website tells one exactly what is on offer and whatever was offered was fulfilled. The trek to Everest Base Camp was well organised from day 1. The accomodation was as good as is available in the Himalayas which is not saying a lot; all food and accomodation was included in the price. I had an excellent guide who was fully commited to the trip and often offered side trips which others might not have bothered with. I made Base Camp and we climbed Kala Pattar at 5500m and had brilliant views of Everest and the sorrounding mountains as the sun rose. A view never to be forgotten and all in all a once in a lifetime trip.

Experience of a lifetime. Hi Prem, Namaste !!Everest Base Camp Trek was amazing, I can't praise ACE highly enough for making it so special. The service provided by Prem, Porters and Guides was fantastic and allowed me to make the most of my Himalaya experience, it will stay with me forever. I would like to think I have made a friend in Raj who was our Head Guide and I hope to return some day and complete a different trek.Itinerary, Travel & Accommodation were all of a much higher standard than I had anticipated and great credit must go to Prem and his team, ACE were the first company I looked at and that is exactly where I would rank them. I genuinely would like to thank you and the team for making my trip the experience of a lifetime and I do hope to return someday and take part in a different trek, I'll be asking for Raj as a guide. Tony Grant Maersk Oil Maersk HouseCrawpeel RoadAltensAberdeenAB12 3LG DD

One of the best trips of my life!. I hiked to the Annapurna Base Camp with Ace and had an amazing time. Prem was great to work with and patiently answered my hundreds of pre-trip questions. Our Guide and porter were very nice and made sure we were comfortable. Nepal is a wonderful country and the hiking was spectacular. Be prepared to work for your meals, but it was a great break from mundane office life.

What a Great Experience!. I work in the adventure travel industry so I am often very critical of guided trips, I have to say that Ace exceeded each and every one of my expectations. The guides and porters were lovely and knowledgeable and our experience in Nepal was amazing. I highly recommend Ace to any operators looking for in country partners or any travelers looking to explore the wonder that is Nepal

Everest Base Camp Trek with Ace The Himalaya. For the second consecutative year Ace The Himalaya has provided me with a wonderful vacation giving me memories which will surely last a lifetime. Last year was the Tibet-EBC land tour and this year the Nepal-EBC trek. The Nepal-EBC trek took 11 days to complete, starting at Lukla at 2800 metres we trekked 9 days to reach our high point, the top of the Kala Pattar ridge at 5600 metres. The first 2 days of the trek were very pleasant walking along the Dudh Kosh river through pine and rhododendron forests passing many farms, villages and guesthouses. along the way. The climb to Namche Bazaar on the 2nd day was the first test of the trek being a grueling 2 hr climb gaining 600 metres in altitude but the view from the town when arriving is spectacular.Namche Bazaar lies in natural amphitheatre like bowl in the side of the mountain at 3440 metres looking across at 6000 metres peaks. Climbing to the top of the hill behind Namche Bazaar you're rewarded with the first view of Everest, Nuptse, Lhotse and Ama Dablam to the north. Following an acclimatization day at Namche the trek resumed walking north to spend the night at Tenboche with it's wonderful monastery and views of Everest and Ama Dablam. As the trail heads north from Tenboche slowly gaining altitude the pine forests give way to shrubs and rocks and the thinning air becomes apparent as the pace gets a little slower. Two nights were spent at Dingboche at 4350 metres with a day trip up the Chhukung Valley for acclimatization. One of the highlights of the trek for me the mountain vistas walking up the Chhukung Valley in clear blue skies were truly remarkable with Lhotse and Nuptse looming like a giant wall to the north and Ama Dablam spiking the skies to the south.Leaving Dingboche the trail heads north to the mouth of the Khumbu Glacier and the landscape becomes desolate at the high altitude with huge boulders and snow and ice. The hike up the Khumbu Glacier to Everest Base Camp was an obvious highlight of the trek. Though Everest can't be seen being hidden behind the Nuptse ridge the views of Nuptse and Pumori and all the lesser peaks are breathtaking along with the rugged desolation of the area. After lunch at Gorak Shep we walked the last few kilometres to Base Camp at 5365 metres. After decades of reading and dreaming about the area it was truly an exhilarating feeling to finally make it.Early the next morning after staying the night at Gorak Shep we made the 2 hour climb up to the top of the Kala Pattar ridge. Truly the definitive highlight of the trek for me the climb seemed long and grueling with the pace being very slow at the high altitude but the view from the top made one forget the effort to get up there. Everest down to the South Col is in clear view and so close now. The Khumbu Glacier and Base Camp now seems far below and looking out and across at all the peaks and valleys of the area it seemed we were higher than the 5635 metre elevation on my GPS.The trek out back to Lukla seemed anticlimatic but it was sure nice to get back into thicker and warmer air and grab a hot shower at Namche Bazaar.Overall I would highly recommend the trek to anyone with an adventurous spirit. The scenery is spectacular, the Sherpa people always friendly and hospitable. The trail itself was exceptionally well maintained at the lower elevations and the guesthouses we stayed at though often fairly crude and basic in accomadation were always clean and comfortable. It's hard work to make it through compounded by the thin air of the high altitude and one must be in moderately good shape with good endurance. For those of us whose age is advancing (I'm 53 yrs now) it's certainly do-able. There appeared many of us in their 50's and 60's along the trail.I can't thank Prem Khatri and his staff at Ace The Himalya enough for the organization, execution, courtesy and professionalism on all aspects of the trip. Ace always make you feel that they truly care and takes pride in providing the customer with all his needs to make his vacation a truly wonderful and unforgetable experience. Special thanks to trekking guides Bharat Adhikavi and Dhurba for their knowledge, patience, good humour and stamina. Both wonderful companions to have on such a trek making the entire adventure such a carefree and enjoyable experience. A special thanks to the three porters whose stamina and strength were truly remarkable and without whom the trek wouldn't of been possible. And finally a special thanks to city guide Prakash Aryal whose knowledge of local history and customs were truly impressive, which combined with his good humour and friendliness made the Kathmandu tour a perfect start to the vacation. Without the slightest doubt I would strongly recommend Ace The Himalayas for anyone considering traveling through the Nepal, Tibet, Bhutan region.

Trek to Everest Base Camp. Wow...what a fantastic experience! Me and my partner Paul trekked as a couple with a guide and porter and can honestly say we had the most memorable time. Communication with Babu was first rate from the moment we booked. We were met on arrival at Kathmandu and taken back to the office to go over the itinerary for each day's trekking and ask any questions and then taken to our hotel before the flight up to Lukla the next morning. Each day was well planned out and we felt very safe in the expert hands of Shyam our guide. Arrival at Base Camp was the ultimate achievement and we are so happy that we chose Unique Path Trekking as our tour operator as they made our experience one we will never forget. Thank you Babu and team.

Excellent all round. These guys were brilliant.Travelled in a small group of 4 friends to climb over the Gokyo Ri and see the lakes, however the weather in Lukla was shockingly bad for weeks. No problem, a few quick phone calls and we were off on safari for a few days (it had been planned for the end of our trip). On return weather still bad & Lukla not an option, again no problem, off to Annapurna base camp via Poon Hill instead. Our guide, Shem, brilliant as were the porters. The admin behind the scenes was first rate and we were always given options and involved in discussions about changes of plans. They also provided guides and transport for several excursions around Kathmandu, all exactly what we wanted, not too guide heavy and plenty of time for us to explore at our own pace.Happily recommend then.

Above and Beyond. My wife and I with a group of friends have trekked with Unique Path on two occasions. The first was a trek to Annapurna Base Camp. The second to Everest Base Camp. Both treks have been memorable and the team from Unique Path made these adventures truly memorable.Annapurna was a fantastic experience where the Unique Path team ensured everything went to plan. A truly professional outfit. This made them the logical choice for our return trek.Our next trek to Everest Base Camp however, truly highlighted the professional and selfless approach of the Unique Path Team. Literally hundreds of metres from Base Camp when the April 25th earthquake struck and this after our party had been separated due to a medical emergency.It is at times like this that you need good people at hand and coordinating from afar. At no time did we feel abandoned or alone. The Unique Path Team only had a focus on us and our safety. They coordinated and ensured our party members who needed emergency evacuation were looked after and greeted as they arrived in Kathmandu. And for the rest of our party, we were guided professionally down from the mountain.Babu and his professional team put their own personal dramas aside to ensure that we were all delivered saftey home.Thank you Unique Path. We will be forever in your debt and I will be organising my next trip with you in the New Year.

Fabulous Nepal trekking company! You know what you're getting and that's quality!. I have been to Nepal three times now, and on my last trip booked with Unique Path- I highly recommend them above other companies. As a youngish lone female I felt totally safe, incredibly well looked after and came back with a lot of happy memories. I remain very impressed with the level of organisation, professionalism and the quality and knowledge of Guides and Sherpas. Babu was honest and upfront, itineraries were clear and there were no hidden costs. The cost of the treks and mountaineering were also fair and employees had insurance provided. Babu organised for my partner and I initially to trek to Annapurna Base Camp, then I went alone to Mera Peak 6200m and Island Peak 6195m. I would book again with Babu and Unique Path in a heartbeat.

Truly amazing guide service for our Everest Base Camp trek!!!. First, I want to say that we found Unique Path Trekking and Expedition through doing an internet search on guide services in April 2014. My friends and I wanted a highly rated guide service and also one who was responsive and answered our questions. Doing a huge trip of a lifetime like this and trusting someone you have not met in person or have a friend / relative to vouch for requires a certain level of "testing" the owners by asking whatever questions concern you and will allow you to make a choice based on a level of perceived trust. Babu was completely responsive, patient, and provided the best possible "pre trip" experience we could have even asked for. Once we arrived in Nepal, we met with both Babu and our guide Sonam. They both helped make sure we were ready to go and had all of our questions answered for the path ahead. Moving to the "during the trip" experience, Sonam made sure every day that we understood what the plan was, how much water we should drink, what we should eat along the way (including what we should NOT eat or drink!), and worked with us given the different pace of those in our group.

Trek to Ama Dablam Base Camp (4700m). This is my 7th time trekking in Nepal is like the 1st, still so exhilarating. I have been going with Unique Path for the 4th time. This trek's goal is to Ama Dablam base camp. We encounter a lot of expedition groups waiting for the "day" to summit. I was curious and I went forth to 2 Koreans (folks are in their 60s) and was told they are there for almost 2 months!!! My salute to these hardcore folks and their determination as I heard from a Sherpa climbing Ama Dablam is very "technical". Despite the upcoming festival, Mr Babu and team are professional and have been taking care of us from the beginning till the end of trip. I really appreciate their effort and patience showed towards me and my mates. We are honoured to have K.C. as our our guide with good knowledge of the mountains and our 2 porters, Budi & Man, patience and kind as our team. K.C. is my guide for the 2nd time and he was like before, jovial, like a "Dai" (Brother) to me. Dhanybad! Great job! Excellent service! Best choice!

Trek to Ama Dablum Base Camp, Himalaya mountains. I didn't expect myself to fall in love immediately with the sport, and the mountains and people of Nepal as this is my first ever trekking trip. I am glad that I chose Unique Path to plan and arrange for all the necessary logistics support (such as lodging and food) for my 12-day trip as they totally understand the need of first time Trekker (like myself). They provide me and my friends with their very experienced trekking guide (KC Bhim) and porter services to ensure I have nothing to worry about, except to enjoy the journey into the majestic mountains of the himalaya. Thank You for the unforgettable experience and for providing me with the best on-route support, Unique Path! I will be back for more. ;)

An amazing experience. We had a long time goal of going trekking in Nepal. When we finally made the commitment and started planning one of the major decisions was whether to trek on our own or with a guide. We chose a guide and porter as we also chose a long (15 day) trek. Unique Path had very good to excellent reviews in our research and they lived up to those reviews. We built in extra days in our planned itinerary and that was a very good thing as well. I suffered from gastro problems 2 days into the trek which slowed us and hiking at high altitude has it's challenges as well. We used our extra days to slow our ascent to stay within the recommended altitude gain recommendations. Something we would caution other trekkers to do as altitude sickness is no fun and climbing to fast can void your travel insurance should you need help.Fantastic experience in a country of wonderful people and spectacular mountains. Unique Path adapted our trip plan to meet our needs and wishes, they were very flexible and accommodating. We could not have completed the long trek without our guides help and our amazing porter to shoulder a significant amount of gear. It allowed us to trek with lighter loads and enjoy the experience more.So do your homework, come prepared and do not hesitate to contact Unique Path for help. They are a great choice for planning and carrying out any trek in Nepal. Highly recommended!!Cheers,David & Karen

Best experience. In the past, my husband and I have used Hari`s company more than once to organize a 20 day camping trek to Manasalu and a multi day tea house,camping trip to Langtang -Gosainkunde.He also helped us organize our Bhutan and Tibet trips.From the equipment to the staffing the treks could not have been better organized.Hari goes the extra mile to ensure your holiday will be the best experience.Hari you are class A

Outstanding Choice. Unique Path Trekking & Expedition is reliable and professional in their job. From the beginning till the end of our trip we were well taken care of. As first-timers trekking the Himalaya we need someone like them. My friend who's a seasoned trekker recommended Unique to us and I have to agree its definitely a good recommendation.Well done to the company, our guides and not forgetting our sherpas too!

The Only Choice - A+ SUPERB! . My girlfriend and I were fortunate enough to take this trip of a lifetime a while back and could not speak highly enough of every aspect this trip. From the moment we landed in Kathmandu, transfers were arranged and we were effortlessly guided to Thamel. Our guides Ramon & Raj, alongside our sherpa Yup made all things possible with ease. The professionalism, experience, and hospitality of this team makes choosing this company for your Nepalese trek quite easy in my opinion and would certainly use Unique Path again. We chose the Gokyo Ri trek during the month of May which was fantastic. Less popular than Everest Base Camp but comparable views and we oftentimes found ourselves surrounded by snow capped mountains with no one else around. It was heaven! Highly highly recommended. Thank you so much unique path! We hope to return soon enough for the next one!

Everest Base Camp / Gokyo Cross Chola la Trek. A friend and I did the 17 day trek up to Everest Base Camp and down via Chola pass. It was quite simply an amazing experience from start to finish. We first met at the Unique Path office where we were given a full introduction into exactly what to expect.Our guide Sonam did such a great job of looking after us. It's clear that Sonam had a real inside knowledge on exactly where to go and what conditions to expect. We felt safe and in good hands the entire time. Sonam went above and beyond his duty by taking us around Kathmandu when we returned. We even had the chance to visit the owner Babu during the festival of Desain that year. Such kindness and generosity... I count them both as my friends to this day and I look forward to going back to trek with them whenever possible!

Trip of a lifetime. For my 50th, I wanted to check off an item on my bucket list--a trek to the base camp of Everest. I did a lot of research and chose Unique Path Trekking & Expedition. It was deeply satisfying to support this Nepalese company. I had an amazing guide and porters... and the experience was amazing. Because of my experience on this trek, I also made a last minute decision to visit Chitwan National Park, which was equally memorable. Wonderful people to deal with. If I ever get another opportunity to visit this fabulous country, I would not hesitate to book with Unique Path Trekking & Expedition again.

3 Passes Trek. Thanks to Babu and his staff we had an incredibly enjoyable 3 Passes Trek trip. It was a fantastic hike with many highlights. From the first dealings pre arrival to Kathmandu, the trek and right through to the last ride to the airport, we found the Unique Path Trekking staff friendly, courteous and professional.We had a safe and well guided trek thanks to our guide Buddhi and tireless porter Yogendra. Their patience and assistance allowed the trip to run smoothly and without incident and at a pace suitable to us.

The journey of my life. I used the word "Journey" on purpose, because it was more than a trip! I found the trekking company via Lonely Planet. I wanted something local. They were great! They welcomed me in kathmandu and walked me thur the itinerary, what to expect etc. Baby was really lovely. My guide/porter, Sambhu, was adorable and he was my guardian angel for 14 days up in the mountains - absolutely great service! They even reimbursed me back since we had to change itinerary due to poor weather conditions - I would recommend wholeheartedly
Amazing trek. I did a solo trek with an amazing guide. The trek couldn't have been organized any better. I had the time of my life and reaching Mt Everest Base Camp is an overwhelming experience.

Wonderful staff! Best Adventure!. We did a Pokhara trip and Base Camp Everest with Babu's team member, Subash. It was a wonderful trip from start to finish! We were so well taken care of; we had to worry about nothing! Subash really worked to be able to let us see and do everything that we wanted and still even made further suggestions of spectacular things to see. Up Everest, he was a knowledgeable guide and has turned into a good friend to us. Will definitely return to Nepal one day, and will definitely turn to Unique Path for a real good trip!

Very professional and trust worthy . Excellent service very profesional. Everything in the contract was met. All promises kept. Bhim is a very expirienced responsible trustworthy guide. This is a very good company.

Great staff and superb service. Apart from great and kind people I have to specifically praise the manager we exchanged email with as email replies were prompt, easy to understand and always helpful. I highly recommend the agency.

Namaste.... Beautiful Nepal, people, nature and experiences.... I have been on 2 trek in Nepal with Babu and his great team....Both trek was fantastic, top professional from start to end.Babu is very kindly... People helpful great guides with lot of knowledge, beautiful nature and lot of amazing experiences... Go to Nepal - you will never regreat.... !

Great nepalese Agency. Even if over 60 our trekking experience was fantastic : nature,culture,different ways of life, a professional guide ( Mr. Dambar ) , Rajh and three very good and kind porters ( Arjun ,Resham, Som ).
We made this Trek (Around Annapurna) in October 2011

Amazing Annapurna trek experience. had a wonderful trek through this region, very experienced guide and exceptional sherpa services
stayed in great tea houses, basic but clean and hygienic, and few creature comforts!
beautiful impressive scenery and the whole trip allowed us to go at our own pace

EBC / Chola / Gokyo - most amazing experience I've had. I've been fortunate to have had the opportunity to travel quite a bit - but this was easily the most amazing journey I've been on. Babu from UTP was great, this was my first trek and he put me at ease and was very accommodating to me being a solo female traveller. What really made the experience so enjoyable however was Rewanta (guide) and Tej (porter). Two of the loveliest, trustworthy people around. Rewanta is super professional, knowledgeable and accommodating. Tej is a legend. Two happy, fun guys who I enjoyed spending 14 days with. Cannot recommend enough.

Visit to Annapurna Circuit. May 2014 Hike to Annapurna circuit using guides from unique path trekking and expedition. The guides and handlers were mostly professional and friendly, it was a lovely trip and i had a very good experience

Organized trekking at its best. I have made three trips to Nepal in the last 7 years. Each time Babu has put together a wonderful and exciting itinerary ensuring all aspects of the trip have been covered.My Treks included Annapurna circuit, Langtang district and ABC base camp. His team are friendly and very helpful. I will continue to promote this trekking company to my friends, and hope to make my fourth trip to Nepal and visit the Everest region sometime soon.

Great track in the Annapurna region!. I did a trekking with Unique Path in june 2014 and it was just great! Fantastically well organized and a really friendly funny and helpful guide! If I could do it again I would do precisely the same thing and I therefore recommend it to all of you!

One of the best travel agency to organize your trekking - extraordinary experience!!!. One of the best travel agency to organize your trekking!We did a private trekking from - Jiri to the Everest Base Camp and back to Lukla, from there flying back to Kathmandu.Our 26 days of trekking was amazing and we have no regrets of using Unique Path Trekking & Expedition whatsoever. We are looking forward to meeting you again personally in Kathmandu and do another trekking. Still good memories thanks to Babu Sitaula.

Excellent reliable company that provided an amazing experience!. We did the Annapurna circuit in March and had an excellent experience dealing with Unique Path Trekking. Babu and his team were very straight forward to deal with as we planned the details of our trek. We were very happy with the services provided by our guide and porter throughout our trek. I thought they went above and beyond to lead the way and teach us about Nepali culture. During our 5 week stay in Nepal, we also used Unique Path Trekking to set up a 3 day tour to Chitwan National Park. Again, we were very impressed by their recommendation of company to use and would have no hesitation doing so again in the future. We hope to have an opportunity to visit Nepal again and will certainly be booking our next trek with Unique Path Trekking!

Life changing! October 2014. Sonam was the best guide anyone could ask for and a wonderful person. Babu and Sonam went above and beyond to make sure it was an unforgettable trip. Two of my girlfriends and I did Everest Base Camp and it was a trip of a life time. Life changing!

Unique experiences.. I have trekked with Unique path 4 times over the last 11 years, Annapurna circuit, Everest base camp Gokyo ri, Annapurna circuit A.B.C and the lantang valley sacred lakes. I can wholeheartedly recommend Babu and his team of Guides and porters, their commitment, knowledge,and professionalism are second to none.I do plan on a 5th trek and will again, be trekking with Babu and Unique path.

Manaslu, Tilicho, Mustang, and Katchenjunga. My wife and I have been trekking in Nepal with Unique Path on three separate trips. Manaslu '10, Katchenjunga '12 and Tilicho Lake in '14. In all, Unique Path has greatly exceeded my expectation in their attention to the details, and exceptional planning. Every effort was made by Babu and the staff to ensure that we were able to enjoy our trip and the magnificent sights in Nepal. I am much looking forward planning my next trip to Nepal with Unique Path!

Goes Above and Beyond!. We were a little under prepared for our trek to base camp but Babu and team at Unique Path Trekking were able to provide us with essential gear. Raj guided us over 12 tough days all the way to the top of Kala Patthar + Everest Base Camp. This was one of the most memorable and amazing adventures we've ever been on mostly because of how seamless the whole trip was. Delayed flights back from Lukla Airport and changes in accommodation were never an issue with Babu managing everything behind the scenes. We happened to be near Kathmandu during the large earthquake last year and Babu and his team were incredible even during such a crisis. If we return to Nepal we would definitely seek Babu's services again cannot recommend highly enough!

The best. From 7 times trekking in Himalaya 2 times I enjoyed second to none hospitality, courtesy and professionalism of this company. Both times the first to Mera Peak and the second to Langsisa Ri our small group was protected by Mr. Dawa Tamang and we made friends with him. He is the best of guides in Nepal I met.

Support Locals!. I did a trek with UP onto Gokyo in 2008. I was a bit nervous having booked the trip from Germany and not knowing what I got myself into. But I was convinced that I wanted to support locals instead of booking at an agency in Germany. And my bravery was rewarded thousand times. The team of Unique Paths is so delightful, experienced and nice. They get my highest appraisals. They hire locals only. And get them insurance and treat them super fair. Which you will rarely find in the Himalayas where thousands of tourists travel with agencies that don't insure the sherpas or guides, let them schlepp way too much weight and make them stay in worse housing than their guests! Not with UP. They are fair all the way. The hotel they put us in was the best in Kathmandu. Please be aware of Nepal standards but for Nepal standards this was the best. They were always on time. The guide was very knowledgable and fun and gave is our space. Even had medical ideas around altitude sickness. The sherpa that schlepped our luggage was adorable and we tipped him a a lot. He was providing for his family with this. Please book UP. They are the Fair Trade of Nepal!

Everest Base Camp trek. First time in Nepal. Extremely happy that I chose Unique Path Trekking. A testament of the company's competence is when they have to seamlessly overcome unfortunate circumstances (such as adverse weather and changing flights etc). The owner, Babu was very efficient. One of his guides, Shambu, was absolutely fantastic. He was truly passionate the environment and knew about the different floras and fauna. My time in Nepal and the EBC will stay with me forever........ Superb experience !!

Annapurna Circuit via Tilicho Lake. This was my second trip to Nepal and it was an easy choice to have Unique Path handle the trip. In October 2013 there was an unexpected 3 day snow storm that caught us (13 people) high in the mountains and impacted plans to reach EBC. It was great to have an experienced team handle the situation safely and flexibly. Although this trip had less drama I appreciated our guide's suggestions, based on current conditions, that made our trip truly outstanding. Looking forward to my next Nepal trek!

Dependable and knowledgeable company in Nepal. I have used Unique Path on at least 4 occasions, from a solo traveler to with friends and then to groups of up to 60 people. Babu is very dependable and he has always met our expectations and requirements, from camping trips deep in the Himalayas to Kathmandu city excursions. I have recommended Unique Path to many friends.If you are looking for a dependable company to deliver the services in Nepal, look no further than Unique Path. I highly recommend this company.

Everest Base Camp Trek 2014. As a life long hiker, backpacker and adventurer, it was a dream to hike the Himalayas. We contacted several trekking services in the area and chose Unique Path Trekking & Expedition. We could not have been more satisfied by our decision. Babu and his crew took great care of us (3 friends) and even went out of their way to provide us with impromptu tours of the Kathmandu valley after the trek. I developed sincere friendships from this life changing trip and will forever thank Babu for his hospitality. Namaste.

Experienced Tour Guide Operator for Everest Base Camp Trek. If your requirement for a tour guide operator for an EBC trek are as follows:1. Experienced and knowledgeable of the logistics, terrains and intricacies of the trek2. Reasonably price3. Awesome customer service and guidesLook no further than Unique Path Trekking & Expedition. Our trek was plagued by numerous incidents - flight delay, sickness (and not the altitude type of sickness) and what-not you can have from a long ardous trek. But through it all, Babu and team were patient and decisive (when we were indecisive and decisions need to be made) in making this trek a successful one. Believe me, if I say we were not the easiest group of customers, but the service was first class which made our trek definitely a once in a lifetime experience. Definitely consider this trekking company if you are looking for an unforgettable EBC experience.

Everest Base Camp Trek. Unique Path did a great job to organised our trip. Babu is a very nice person, where he provide good advice and handle all incidents promptly during our EBC trek. I will recommend Unique path to my friends as well.
Great time in Nepal. We had a lovely time in Nepal. We did the ABC trek with Unique Path, who did a great job! Thanks so much

Everest Base Camp Trek. Unique did a terrific job organizing my private group of 6pax to EBC, the personal invites for a Hong Kong friend, the porters, the guide , the food were first class...on top of this...one of our friends had to be air lifted back to Kathmandu from Tengboche...Unique handled the entire liaising with the insurance company without a single phone call needed from us..all the requirements was met and exceeded and the next morning...the helicopter came...We are thankful for the support given...We have recommended Unique to all our friends and family for all events in Nepal. Namaste!

Everest Base Camp trek. I had a wonderful time with unique path.they don't only see it as a job but it is in their DNA to provide the very best to their clients. We had multiple cancellation due to bad weather however, Babu was very patient and ensure we will reach Lukla without impacting our tight schedule. My guides were the best making my trek an achievement. I was sick, fever and down with diarrhoea and I thought couldn't made it to BC, but my guide took care of me and able to be versatile and flexible in our trek plan, so I could get ample rest to achieve my goal. It was definitely the right choice to have unique path as my agents and there is no doubt having them as your agent.

Amazing experience. My trip to Nepal was amazing thanks to Unique Path. Babu met with my on the first day, making sure everything was OK before departing to Annapurna Trek. I went alone, so my guide Shiam was my traveling companion, always checking if I was enjoying the trek and making efforts to make everything perfect.

Base Camp Trek. Our trip with Unique Path Treking was an absolute highlight for our group after many years of travelling.Babu and his team were a pleasure to deal with and nothing was a problem for them.I would have no hesitation in recommending them to anyone.We will return to do the Annapurna Circuit.

Excellent Tour-Trek Agency. I am pleased to recommend Unique Path Trekking & Expedition. The owner, Babu, is a very knowledgeable and reliable person to deal with when it comes to customizing trips. He has planned my trips to ABC and EBC with his nephew as my guide, and has also helped me plan trips to the Dhaulagiri Circuit, Mera Peak and Island Peak. I believe that his prices are reasonable, his services are good and overall the trips are well planned and flexible enough to account for complications that may arise. Please consider booking your trip and tours through them, as I was able to do both trekking and sight seeing in one package.

Trek Gokyo EBC and Chukhung etc. Santosh office is in the Thamel district of Kathmandu - government approved. Flight to Lukla and a guide for my three week trek. Highly recommend him as well as the porter/guide for trek Furdeni Sherpa who is first class and can be found through Santosh.

If you are looking for an awesome trek or activity, this is your guy. I discovered Adventure Master Treks from one of the locals giving me a ride from the airport to my hostel. I couldn't have had better luck. He dropped me off at Adventure Master Treks and introduced me to Santosh. Santosh is the manager and he is a great guy with solid English. I told him how long I was staying in Nepal and what I was looking to do, and he hooked me up with the perfect trek, with an awesome guide - Ramkumar, who was awesome. Can't wait to go back and do a bigger trek - Highly Recommend!

Amazing!. My boyfriend and I booked the Annapurna Base Camp trek through Adventure Master Treks - our best decision in Nepal!Santosh (the company owner) will go outside the box for you to make your experience the best possible. Apart from arranging the necessary things for our trek, he also helped with hotel bookings, transport and other activities. He was always available for whatever we needed, which made our whole Nepal stay run smooth and easily.Along with us on the trek, we had our amazing guide Gokarna. He has great knowledge and experience of the mountains, from which he could give answers to all of our questions. Neither my boyfriend or I are very experienced trekkers, so he felt safe having around as well as a great fun company. Especially thankful for teaching us to play Dumbal ;)I would definately recommend Adventure Master Treks to anyone looking for an amazing adventure in Nepal!

Amazing adventure!. Booked the Annapurna base camp, everything went smooth, super friendly staff, and very good price for two persons.  Everything thanks to Santosh the company owner!Our guide was really amazing as well.  Friendly, always up for a good small talk and answering all your questions about the Himalayas.  Would recommend Gokarna as guide! + friendly staff Very helpful  Good price  Answer all questions  Easy to contact - Can't really say anything negative about adventure master treks! Thanks for an amazing adventure!
Good experience. Very good experience with adventure master treks. They helped us to make our trek and gave us some very good advices. I recomande it !!

Best experience in Nepal. I was in Nepal for a week on holiday. I met Santosh, the boss, on the day I arrived, and without him and his company my trip would simply not have been possible. I had nothing booked other than accommodation, and no idea of what was available to do. Santosh arranged visits to attractions in Kathmandu, as well as a trip to a National Park (Chitwan - I recommend it!). Aside from the excellent service, it was all very reasonably-priced, and always with a smile :) On my last day, coming back from Chitwan, I left my wallet, with my passport and credit card inside, on the bus. I quickly informed Santosh, and he took me around all the bus stations until we found it. A lovely man and a brilliant company. Thank you. Namaste!

Great Annapurna Trek!. I visited Nepal in late August for 12 days. I discovered Adventure Master Treks by chance the first day I arrived in Kathmandu, and to my surprise, these guys arranged everything for me in only one hour. The second day I did some sightseeing in Kathmandu with one of their drivers who was a really nice guy.After that, I did the Poon Hill trek (6 days) in the Annapurna area. This place is simply amazing and is something you MUST see. My trek guide, Gokarna, was incredible. He let me set my own pace during the trek, and was always willing to discuss with me the history of the places we visited and the local traditions. Although we visited around 10 villages, I strongly recommend that you do a longer trek (at least 10 days) up to the Annapurna Base Camp. Unfortunately, I didn't have more days but I'll definitely visit this area again.

Amaaaazing! I will come back... . When we first arrived to the airport, we were a bit overwhelmed by all the taxi drivers, who desperately wanted to to do business. When we first found one, he (of cause) had a cooperation with a trekking Company in Kathmandu. We were a bit suspicious, because we had heard so much about companies trying to cheat tourists - but it turned out we had no reason to be that. Before we came Nepal we had done a lot of research about prices and different tours, this company had totally fair prices from the beginning. We did a 10 days trekking to Anna Purna basecamp - and it was 10 unforgettable and wonderful days! Our guide Gokharna was so so kind and helpful, and we felt totally safe in his company! I will recommend Gokharna to everyone, he did an AMAZING job and most important he got us to the top. It was freaking mindblowing - next time I will reach for Mount Everest! Just do it, and feel safe to choose this company. Thank you, for making our ABC trek perfect...

Perfect experience. Santosh was incredibly kind and generous. He managed to get us discounts everywhere we went, and was always available to help in any way he could. My friend lost her wallet on a bus, we went to see him about it, and after a few calls he took her on his bike and they went and successfully retrieved it! Top man, top company, no need to look any further.

Great Himalayan Annapurna Trek. After spending several weeks in India, I decided on a last minute trip to Nepal where I hoped to go trekking. I arrived in Kathmandu without any plans and was somewhat suspicious after being approached by someone at the airport who accompanied me to Adventure Master's Office. I met with Santosh who explored my interests and offered several recommendations. I was pleasantly surprised that there were no high pressure sales tactics. Santosh encouraged me to think about it overnight and get back to him the next day. I did so, checked out Adventure Masters on TripAdvisor, did a little comparison shopping and decided on the 5 day 4 night trek. Santosh offered a better price than the competitors. I would be responsible for purchasing food and beverages on the trek. Everything else was included and provided. My guide Hira was excellent. He had a wealth of knowledge about life and trekking in the Himalayas, introduced me to many locals during the course of our trek and was a pleasure to be with. The trek was physically demanding but Hira paced us accordingly. Given that it was the beginning of monsoon season, there were only limited opportunities to view the peaks. I knew this when I signed up. Nevertheless, the opportunity to experience nature and the local culture made the trek one of the highlights of my trip. I would trek with Adventure Masters and Hira again in a heartbeat and highly recommend them.

Arun Valley & Everest Region. We met Santosh at our hotel and he made the arrangements for a 25 day trek for us.We trekked the Arun Valley Trail from Tumlingtar up to the Everest region, and then up to Gokyo Ri, EBC & Kala Patthar, returning to Kathmandu via Lukla.Santosh arranged:a porter/guideboth flights, for us and porter/guidetaxi in Kathmandunational park permitsTims cardWe had a great experience on our trek and would highly recommend it. The 9 days in the Arun valley are very beautiful, and the Khumbu region above is staggering, we highly recommend the trek, although the long time (25days) does take it's toll and it is very hard work.The guide that Santosh arranged for us (Jangbu) was excellent. He was local to the region and clearly had the local knowledge. His English was very good, and his French excellent. He was a greatt companion throughout the trek, and invaluable as a guide taking care of all our arrangements on route. Santosh's arrangements were all done on time, and all the flights and permits all worked. He also arranged for us to meet Jangbu and himself the evening before our departure, and had an informal debriefing with us in his office after which was very professional. Our only criticisms are that he did not introduce himself as a trekking organisation but claimed to be from the hotel before leading to his trekking office. Also the evening before we departed he gave us a "schedule" that he had "made". This was actually a copy from another camping trekking companies website that was not relevant to our own plans. Other than these small problems we were happy with his service.

BEST TIME OF MY LIFE!!!!!!. Our trek to Poon Hill with these guys was absolutely fantastic. When we initially arrived in Kathmandu we were brought to the office where we met Santosh, who was very transparent and open about the treks and our options. He organized a perfect trip given the amount of time we had in Nepal, and we headed off the next day to Pokhara. Our guide (and later friend) Raj was incredibly helpful with each little detail of our trip, from when we got sick to finding the best food. Super reasonably priced and the best way to enjoy Nepal's beautiful nature!

best trekking company!. In the first we met them at the airport. We were a little bit suspicious, but we traied there service with 5 day Poon Hill trek. First of all, when we discussed with other trekkers we had the best price offer. Gokarna who was our guide was fantastic, Industractible and helpful. In the end he become a good friend of ours. The company was also willing to help with some airport luggage problem, acomodation and so on. We definatelly recomend them to all of You!

Mardi Himal trekking . Traveling for over 25 years in Asia this was one of the best organized package travels ! (Flight, hotel, trekking ....) Perfect organisation ! Everything was arranged for a very good price. We did the Mardi Himal trek with one guide and one porter. The guide was very professional and anticipated to all our requests. A very good experience. The porter was unbelievable. Dragging 25 kg for 80 km and the smile never went of his face. This was the best experience ever. I would recommend this organisation to everybody without doubt. Good job guys ! Thanks for all!

Annapurna Circuit . Everything went very smoothly! Santosh are friendly ask him anything abt the trek he'll tell you everything you need to know. The guide yageendra Kc is very patience with me, as i keep asking him 'what mt is that' he even give me the freedom to choose which town to stay/which route i want to go, like the side trip to ice lake ect. Would def come to nepal again :)

Annapurna Circuit. I started the Annapurna Circuit on April 7 2016 and it lasted 11 total days until April 17. The company was able to work with my limited schedule to make the trek quicker, but also enough to be enjoyable and safe. Prior to the trek I was given good advice on how to maximize my entire time in Nepal, while also having enough time to enjoy the trek.
