I had belongings that I did not want to bring with me on the trek and the company offered to store my bag with no extra charge until I returned to Kathmandu.Hiramani was my guide. He was very knowledgeable. I started to notice as the trek went on that other guides would ask him questions. I didnt have to worry about anything (accommation, getting my own water, when we would leave in the morning, etc). His top concern was safety. Doing a high elevation trek bring many challenges, but I was able complete the trek with absolutely no issues. I noticed some trekkers that decided to go without a guide made mistakes that effected their ability to finish the trek.
trekking and rafting in south Nepal. Excellent service, friendly staff. Didn't need to worry about a thing during our stay. Good recommandation!

Awesome agency, 17day trek including Everest BC and Lobuche East summit expedition. After visiting many agencies offices, we choose them because they were the most affordable ones and Santosh had the best information about our trek. Our guide Jangbu (who spoke french also, luckily for us) took care of us from our hotel and brought us back after 17 awesome days. The Lobuche east expedition was taken care of from Kathandu and the climbing sherpa met us in Lobuche for the training and the 2-day expedition and provided everything with his helper (equipment, tent, food, etc.) I would book with them again for sure.

Poon Hill/Hot Springs w/SITAL- best guide!. This is my third time tracking in the Himalayas and this was by far our best experience mostly because of the guide and this particular trek. Sital did an immaculate job and our porter Raj Was almost a second guide hanging with us the whole time.... both made it amazing. I would highly recommend this trek and our lovely guide Sital !!! Also early mid March is the best time to trek

Great adventure and wonderful guide!!!. I did 16 days Annapurna circut with the company. Everything was organised very fast and professional. My tourist guide was amazing and provided me not only professional help but also we became very good friends. Thank you Sagar Karki!!! Thanks to his help I could feel more not as a tourist but very often as a local visitor in many hotels adn teashops (eating and drinking tea with owners). Great experience!!! I will be back!!!Lukasz

Two weeks circling some of the most beautiful mountains in the world. I spent two weeks walking around some of the most beautiful mountains in the world (Annapurna Circuit) and was pleasantly surprised that we were able to stay in some very local trekking towns. This is different from the typical tourist type of things I have done in the past and I would highly recommend it to someone who has two weeks or a little more to spend in nature. You can book through Adventure Master and ask for our guide, Hira. He will customize the trek to your needs and is very good at telling you what is best for you. I definitely needed his advice for certain parts of the trek. It is possible to trek on your own, but I would advise to have a guide for the first time. Especially someone like Hira who has done this trek over a hundred times and was able to go down the trails completely covered by snow and basically invisible without any problems.

Amazing company and very helpful with anything you need :-). Very helpful staff and great company. It helped me with all my needs in Nepal and organised all well from the guided trekking to ABC to the paragliding and chitwan. He also moved the dates for me without any problem :-) very kind and helpful :-) Let them know what u need and they will help you out. Thanks alot ;-)

Great trekk with Sithal. I had a great experience with this tour and company.All was booked in advance in Kathmandu, and the boss of the company, Santosh was helpful and made sure all was taken care of.Sithal, my guide, picked me up at the bus stop in Pokhara and took me to the place I was staying, then helped me pack and define a trek path according to my time and wants.I have to say I ran into a lot of people on the trek and all of them loved Sithal. The best guide, super helpful (even helping other trekkers), experienced, flexible (we changed plan as I wanted to go to the hot springs) and just hilarious. Make sure you ask to get him as a guide, he is the best.We even chilled the days after the trek in Pokhara :)Everything was easy and great, and the only bad thing was that I could not stay longer.Enjoy the Himalayas!

Seamless organisation and best guide possible. We've found Adventure Master through our guest house after we hadn't booked anything in advance. After discussing our ideas we quickly put together an awesome travel plan taking us to the Annapurna Base Camp and me later on to Chitwan Nationalpark. Our guide Gobinda "Sam" was a national treasure and made the journey fun and unique. I can highly recommend him and the team from Adventure Master to anyone who thought about trekking the Himalayas.

Had an Awesome Trip . I was travelling through India for a month and had a few days left. Flew to Kathmandu last minute and Santoss took care of everything upon my arrival. He works out of the Pilgrims Guesthouse, has a desk in lobby. Both he and the Guesthouse made this trip very memorable for me. Great people, Great location, very clean room, reliable hot water and wifi. Thanx Santoss for your recommendations and assistance, which made up for my lack of planning.

adventure & explore. we came in nepal to explore & see the world far away from all the headaches,material running..... we stayed in kathmandu, pokhara, vaktapur, nagorkot.... adventure master helped us a lot!! as we are new here, specially after earthquake we were little afraid..but all safe here,,we travelled long way, paraglided thr beautiful sky, rafted, explored thr world beyond our views. people are here so warm hearted, never felt like we are away from our homes!! wherever we went,we enjoyed the magnificent hospitality from the people of nepal. we wish... your coming adventures would be enjoyble & relaxing like us..exploring inner eyes!!! thnxxxx..... MUNMUN & MAHMUD,Dhaka, Bangladesh.

Great jelp. We are doing ABC trek without a guide, but this company, particularly Santosh, was still amazingly helpful even though we weren't booking much through them. Gave us loads of information about Kathmandu and wrote us an itinerary/gave us a map for the trek free of charge, as well as giving his number in case anything went wrong. Very friendly, helpful people who you can trust! 5/5

Adventure Master Agent and Guide made the diference!!. My husband and I recently returned to Europe after 14 days in Nepal. This agency was responsible for our tour, we handcrafted our tour together according to our 14 days availability. Our agent - Santosh devoted a great deal of his time in discussing our primary interest in having a great trek experience. Santosh was great in handling all the arrangements to include our hotels, personal drivers, buses reservations, private tours and doing a follow up afterwords. He had explained to us about Nepal situation at the moment - the crisis of fuel, gas and eletricity which didn't almost affect us. Thanks Santosh for your warm smile.During our 4 days trek to Poon Hill we had one of our best experience ever!!! We were able to see beautiful views, contact the amazing Nepali people, experience their culture, food and happiness. Without question what made the difference in our trek was our private guide - BHARAT KUMAR which spoke very good English, he was friendly, polite, knowledgeable, patient and funny. We had a great 4 days with BHARAT ; ) He really stands out from the other guides, he was always walking behind/next to me making sure to help me if needed it, he patiently waited me to get my breath back whenever I needed it, he was kind to us and to Nepali people, we had great conversations during our trek, he taught us some Nepali words, the name of the trees and mountains, he also let my husband win every card game round. lololololo One thing I had missed in our experience which was the connection with other travelers, I guess it was because of our tight schedule. Poon Hill trek was beautiful and magical. It is a very tranquil trek with a great atmosphere. I was very impressed with the structure of the lodges and restaurants along the way. If you decide to do a tour in Nepal, I would recommend the following:1. Make sure to ask for Bharat as guide ; )2. Learn to say Namaste/Bohini/Di di/Dahi or Bayi. These simple acts of respect go a long way3. Travel Light, Light. Light; did I say Light. You will burden yourself with Luggage if you do not heed this advice. 4. If you are taking buses, go Turist bus, first class or private car. It is well worth the few extra dollars. MAKE SURE WITH YOUR AGENT. 5. Try to avoid public transportation such as local buses which can be extremely overcrowded in the larger cities. Rush hour can be overwhelming. Take either a metered taxi or arrange for a private driver.6. Make sure with your agent the quality of the hotel, if you have heating/AC in the room and if the hotel is experiencing power outage - very common. Lastly, our trip to Nepal exceeded our expectations. I highly recommend this company and our guide for your custom handcrafted tour of Nepal.

A.B.C November trek. Me and my wife were on abc trek with the best guide from Adventure Master Trek! Everything was organised very well and fast. We haven't any problems during a expedition , guide carried us all the time, make some advices and share with us some pieces of history and culture! These trip was marvelous!!!

Easy to organise and great guide. We arrived in Kathmandu and immediately sort out a trek, we were introduced to Santosh who understood the region, duration and requirements we were after. No hassles, everything ran to plan and the guide Shital was great company and went out of his way to add the little things that made the trek even more enjoyable. Highly recommended.

Amazing experience, great value for money. My friend and I arrived in Kathmandu with no plan but knowing we wanted to do a short trek from Pokhara. We met Keshab from Adventure Masters in our Kathmandu hotel and he suggested a 3 day Poon Hill trek which would be ideal for our time available and our fitness levels. He clearly broke every cost down and we were so comfortable booking the trip and knowing everything was taken care of. The whole 3 days we didn't have to worry about a thing. All our transport and accommodation was taken care of and we had an excellent guide - Gopal. Gopal was quiet but very knowledgable (although sometimes difficult to understand) and he encouraged me up the hard stretches and let me go at a comfortable pace the whole way (as I'm not the fittest person!) The trip was an excellent experience and we felt it was great value for money. The only 2 negatives I have are that on the final day (Christmas Day) we let the guide know we wanted to be back in Pokhara early to celebrate Christmas and we descended the mountain really quickly to do so but then the driver taking us back to Pokhara was 30 minutes late so we didn't arrive in Pokhara until later than we had hoped. Also, on our return to the hotel the guide made me sit down at a computer to write this review (with him standing close by) when I am tired and just wanting a hot shower and to celebrate Christmas! Awkward! Apart from these things, I can't fault the experience at all. Amazing trip!

👌. A friend and I did a 7 day trek with these guys and they were great. Santosh the manager was very happy to help organise everything for us all the way from Kathmandu and back. Sam our guide was an absolute legend! Funny and always there to help us along the way. Went above and beyond to help us out during and even after our trek! Had such a great time with him!

Pleasant trip at Poon Hill!. First time here in Nepal on Nov 2014, was given a warm welcome at the airport, the scarf given is so lovely! Everything was well organized, the hotels were perfect! I particularly like the experience during the hike, never felt so close to the nature before. I'm looking forward to hike again in Nepal with Keshab as my guide!

Annapurna circuit guide. I did the Annapurna circuit in October 2015 (my first trip to Nepal) and would like to thank Adventure Master Treks for a great experience. I was planning on doing the trek solo, but I have to say that the last minute decision to hire a guide was a good one. My guide, Mr. Sagar, taught me about culture, language, flora, fauna, and pointed out many things that I would have otherwise missed without his help. He always had a smile on his face, like all theven considering the difficult times in the country due to recent events. My hat's off to him and I'm looking forward to revisiting Nepal and travelling to the Everest region.

Wonderful vacation through Adventure master treks. As we arrived in airport, we got the great hospitality from adventure master groups. They already managed 5 star hotel for us, the leading member Santosh Adhikari organized our trip to Annapurna base camp as consider a good price which we could easily afford. In the mountain we got the great services from the guide, he treated us like a family members. Thank you very much Mr Santosh Adhikari for organizing the great trip to us and all the members for your great hospitality. We love you guys.....

Pokhara Lakeside and much much more.. I have known and trusted Adventure Master Treks now for over a year and a half. I have been in Nepal six times in that time and many times booked through Santosh and his team for my adventure and travel needs. I have been to Pokhara, Everest Mountain Flight, major Kathmandu tourist sights inside and outside the KTM Valley and Santosh even took us out for dinner and a cultural show! Santosh knows his stuff, he has been doing it a long time. He is professional, caring and now a good friend. I would not hesitate to recommend his services for all your adventure needs in Nepal. Thanks again Adventure Master and team, you rock!

Just Perfect. I didn't want to lose time with organisation, Santosh manage everything for me perfectly : car ,driver ,mountain guide ,hotel exactly what i didn't want to take care of so i could only use my time for enjoying Nepal: mountains ,culture, music ,temples. Hari his driver speak a perfect english and have a really good knowledge of his country and culture also btw the car was perfect too,i learn a lot and i had great time with him THANKS A LOT HARI :-D .the mountain's guide Rajendra is just a great great man too, lot of knowledge speaking a perfect english and manage to bring me to my goal in time which i can tell you due to my smoking addiction wasn't done but he (we) did it he also gave me a few choices all the time it was possible THANKS A LOT RAJENDRA :-D for your brightness ,yoga and laugh.as we say you recognize a good captain at his crew .Santosh is a great captain THANKS A LOT SANTOSH :-D for made me discover a great nepal and let me use all my time for what i wanted without stressing about oil blockade etc well done i will be back :-D

Amazing trekking organised from our arrival until the end!. The trip was superbly organised and run throughout our two weeks in Nepal! We were welcomed at the airport and taken to a hotel we had pre-booked before getting to Pokhara (Where our trek would start) a couple of days later. Keshab was a fantastic guide whilst we were trekking around the Anapurnas and his knowledge of the region and country was invaluable! Everything was always well organised and on time from the walking, the accommodations and we even had a few special surprises! I highly recommend his services and this trek was a once in a lifetime experience that everyone would enjoy without a doubt!
Annapurna Circuit Trekking with Adventure Master Treks. 10/10, would go again with Adventure Master Treks with Keshab as guide!They are friendly, funny, and helpful! Strongly Recommended!

Ghorepani Poonhill Trekking with friends. We booked the Ghorepani Poonhill circuit (6 days) with some friends in november 2015. Really good organization, nice guides, beautiful landscapes and great weather ! Five stars to Keshab and his team, five stars to Nepal ! "Danebad" !
Awesome 7 days trek. The Poon Hill trek is awesome and Keshab, our guide, was really nice and ready to help for everything else related to our stay in Nepal. Looking for a trek, go for it !

ABC trek. We had really great time with them. We did Annapurna Base Camp trek with Poon Hill. Everything was well organized, we could focus on enjoying trek, culture and mountains. Our guide was Bharat and he is the best man in the world!
Awesome guides on an awesome trip. We took the Annapurna Circuit with these guys. Keshab and team were awesome, showing us around and being flexible around our arrangements.Had a great time!

Great trekking, even better people!. Keshab took us on a 10-day trip up to Annapurna base camp and it was the most stress free thing I've ever had to deal with. The plan was easy to follow and there was no pressure to stick to a time limit. From Kathmandu to Pokhara to the base camp and back again everything was worked out for us. Me and my friend had an absolute ball and it was very affordable on a shoestring budget. 10/10 would recommend.

Helpful porters + Excellent tour guide + Incredible scenery = UNFORGETTABLE EXPERIENCE. Namaste. In November 2014, I traveled to Nepal with a bunch of friends. A total of 10 of us from Malaysia signed up for the Annarpurna Circuit + Tilicho Lake trekking tour. We hiked along mountainous region of Himalaya Range as if we were in an expedition in the movie "Everest". It was strenuous and challenging at start. However, as time passes, our fatigue was entirely engulfed by the amazing views of "Vanila ice cream with chocolate top" - the snowy view of mountains.Not forget to mention, our tour guide, Keshab was a great young man who can speak fluent English and Bahasa Malaysia. He shared a lot of hiking knowledge with us. For instance, he didn't recommend for us to take medication for altitude sickness. He would rather suggest us to stay longer time for acclimatization. As Nepal is not a developed country like US, wi-fi doesn't come handy. Keshab would sometimes entertain us with his Nepalese David Copperfield-styled magic. Porters in the company were also very helpful. Please be more generous with your tipping, though they don't request it. Also, do hire additional porter if necessary. It is not an easy job to be a porter, carrying tens of kilograms of weight behind their backs.Overall, it was an amazing trip. I will definitely go to the same country and sign for the same company under the same tour guide AGAIN.

Trekking . My friends and me spent nearly two weaks, to hike the Annapurna-Circuit. Gopal thapa magar, knew everything about the Mountains around and brought us to the most beautiful places around. It was a good choice to take this Company.

Amazing service!!!. I used Adventure Master Treks for my trip up to Everest Base Camp. The service they provided was 5 star. They took the time to answer all my questions and went out of their way to accommodate any other requests I may have had while visiting Kathmandu. They were able to customize my tour to give me a once in a lifetime trip. Very professional and also you felt like you were visiting a good friend. I have recommended this company to all my friends that are interested in trekking in Nepal

Good price, great service. We booked a 5 day tour with Santosh during the fuel crisis (2015) and thus far (day 3) we've been pretty happy with the services. His prices were very reasonable considering gas is insanely priced in the country right now. We also were not happy with the bus service so Santosh sent a driver all the way from Khatmandu to Pokhara to pick us up and give us a ride. The driver was also super nice, did a day tour of Khatmandu with us and took us to see all the temples and now is supposed to take us to Nagarkot tomorrow. Pleased with the services so far.
Poonhill Trekking. I had poonhill trekking with Adventure Master treks and it was really good organized, good guide, good knowledge about mountain and everything. Thank you to Keshab for everything.
Great time with Sam Gobinda!!. I had an amazing time with Sam doing the Poon Hill trek! He helped me out when needed and gave out great information. Thank you!
Great Job!. We had a grat time in Nepal, thanks to Adventure Master Treks and their very personal and spontaneous planning; the trek of a lifetime! Thank you so much!

Poonhill trek. I spent 3 weeks in Ramechapp volunteering with my friend, when we decided to go on a trek last minute in our last week before going home. We were recommended Nepal Trek Adventures and Expedition and decided to send an email to organise a trip. Binod was fast to respond to our enquires and organised a trip the perfect trip for us swiftly for a brilliant price. We were provided with an excellent guide and porter who made our whole experience a lot of fun. All hotels, transport and food were provided for so we didn't have to worry about anything. The whole trip was highly customisation and designed to meet our personal plans. I could not fault the company, we are very thankful for the whole team making it such an amazing experience!

Rewati is simply amazing - EBC July 2016, survived.. I booked to go on a trek to EBC at the very last minute - luckily it was the off season and Rewati was available to guide me through this journey.I was a bit concerned at first as this was my first ever trek, but Rewati's experience, level headed way of expressing things, his genuine care and vast experience of the trek really allayed these fears.Luckily for us, Rewati also knew another group who was doing a similar itinerary as us, so we managed to join as a group of 3 trekkers, which really made the trip extra special.For me, this trek was the hardest thing I have ever done. It was a hard slog up the mountain, and the altitude sickness was crippling (but manageable). The accommodation is relatively basic, and there will be days where you go without a shower - but is it all worth it in the end? Yes. Without a doubt!Also, simply put, without Rewati, I would not have made Base Camp.I got bad altitude sickness at Gorak Shep (struggled on the way up already to be honest) - but for Rewati's quick thinking in (force) feeding me a garlic soup + snickers, I would probably not have been able to meet up with the rest of group at Base Camp.Full props to Rewati, he is amazing. Book him by name if you decide to go.I had no experience in trekking, I was under-prepared (did not have a fresh water solution) etc - but Rewati made it work with minimal fuss.

EBC'16, they made it possible.. More than a year back, I was reading an article about Mt. Everest and got to know about Everest Base Camp and how tough and intense it was to reach there. Though I consider myself pretty fit in the normal course of life, the thought of doing EBC at that time, appeared pretty extreme and physically challenging. I spoke to couple of my friends and after some inclusions and drop-outs, we were finally 6 of us who were serious to consider and attempt this mother of all treks. After doing our initial research, the biggest and the most important agenda for us was to identify and finalize the professional agency that would help us in our endeavor. We spoke to many agencies, some international, some local Nepalese, but short-listing and settling on one was not easy; thanks to the numerous models that all these agencies operated in. Finally, as a wise man once said, “word of mouth is the best form of advertisement”; with the help of a recommendation from a friend we stumbled upon Nepal Trek Adventure and Expedition in this big jungle of Nepalese trekking business. Our friend provided us with the co-ordinates of Binod Sapkota’s (alias Babu), the Managing Director of Nepal Trek Adventure. Babu was available on every medium you could think of, whether it was phone, whatsapp, email, etc. and his response time was quite fast. Thanks to our group of novice trekkers and our amateur trekking experience, we bombarded him with all kinds of questions through emails, whatsapp and occasional calls at odd times. In our group of 6, five of us were guys and the sixth was a girl and as she was the only female in the group, she had some very specific questions pertaining to hygiene, safety etc. Babu, like a true gentleman, responded to all our queries and eased our anxiety. He very patiently explained the nitty-gritties of the trekking expedition, helped us with pictures to make his point and with the comfort he provided, we did not think twice and finally went ahead with our bookings.We landed in Kathmandu, and were greeted and received by none other than Babu himself at the airport, thus making us feel at home at once. During the next day of stay in Kathmandu, which was for better acclimatization, he arranged a small city tour for us in the morning, a trip to Thamel market for our last minute trekking shopping in the evening and a detailed briefing at dinner time to prepare us for the next day and the days to come. He introduced us to Rewati Prasad Parajulie, our guide, friend and the go-to person for anything and everything for the next 11 days. Rewati commanded a good experience of the Himalayas, EBC and other kinds of treks and was very level headed. Next afternoon in Lukla, we were also introduced to Binod Rana Magar, one of our porters and most importantly a second hand and assistant to Rewati. Every activity during the trek was managed and planned so well that we did not feel the enormity of undertaking one of the world's most difficult treks.All in all, I’ll say the support from Babu from Kathmandu and all the guidance and help from Rewati and Binod from Lukla to EBC and back made the EBC dream come true and seamless for all six of us. After our trek, just before boarding the flight back home, I made an individual decision of returning to Nepal for other treks in and around Mt. Everest in future as a precursor to the big step of reaching the summit someday; and for all these future treks, one thing is for sure, we would love to have Babu, Rewati, Binod and the rest of the team with us.

Seamless!!. We were a group of six novice Trekkers who committed to undertake the EBC trek together. Once the plan was finalised, we were left with the mammoth task of finalising the agency who would make our dream a reality. We surfed the net, did some research and spoke to various friends and colleagues who had already been to EBC; the outcome was a list of 4-5 shortlisted agencies. One thing that was a bit baffling was the huge range between what the various agencies were charging and therefore making Apple to Apple comparisons was becoming difficult. After all, what was the premium experience that an agency which was charging twice the sum over would provide compared to other agencies? Luckily, one of our colleagues who is an avid EBC Trekker guided us to Nepal Trek Adventure. Being the only woman in the group, I had lots of questions specific to safety and hygiene. It will be least to say that Binod Sapkota aka Babu - the trek Director was very prompt and receptive to all our questions right from the word go. He was able to address my inhibitions and relieve my anxiety to a great extent.From the time we landed in Kathmandu, Babu made sure that all our needs were catered to. We were introduced to our guide, Rewati Parajuli the day before we were leaving for Lukla.I cannot speak more highly for our guide, Rewati who was more of a friend during our 11 day trek to EBC and back. His calm demeanour and ability to find humour in all situations kept us going throughout the trip. Binod, one of our porters who was also acting as Rewati's assistant was like a breath of fresh air. He ensured that small details were tended to and took special care of me, which was so endearing.Wherever the ascent was challenging, I just had to follow Rewati's footsteps and thereafter it was a breeze to complete the day's trek. All in all, my friends and I were extremely happy with the services of Nepal Trek Adventure. I intend to undertake many more treks in the Himalayas and I would always want Rewati as my guide during all these hiking expeditions.

Good Agency n a great guide made our EBC successful and memorable. Nepal trek and adventures was the agency our group of friends finally zeroed on after a lot of research and recommendation. Binod,the owner, is truly professional in his approach.Our guide,Rewati Prasad Parajuli, and the group of porters really helped us to achieve this successful adventure .Rewati followed all of us very closely during the trek and also during the evenings to check if every one was doing good.He ensured every body was eating well and drinking water at regular intervals.In very short time he knew strengths and weakness of each one of us and steered the whole group in the most efficient way taking help and grooming one of the Porters,Binod,towards becoming a good guide.The boarding and lodging was decent and will highly recommend Nepal trek and adventure .Thanks again to Binod(babu) and Rewati in making our dream come true.

Very Enjoyable EBC trek. I went on the trek organised by Nepal Trek Adventures in May 2016 and I had an absolutely smashing time. Its a tough trek, but a combination of beautiful weather and an excellently organised team ensured we had a fun and more importantly safe trek. I would like to specially mention Binod (The owner) and Rewati (Our guide) for their impeccable planning and patience with a rambunctious group. I also recommend Rewati for his ability to keep us motivated through the tough stretches of the trek. It was an awesome experience and I can thoroughly recommend both the Everest Base Camp Circuit and Nepal Trek Adventures.

Everest Base Camp made Memorable. Nepal Trek Adventure was the Agency selected for our trip with a small group of friends. The Best part with Binod (fondly known as Babu) and guide Rewati Prasad Parajuli ensured and put in all efforts so that they understood us from day one. That was really touching. Babu and Rewati ensured we leave our footprints at Everest Base Camp and take back wonderful memories. Nepal Trek was well versed with all the requirements for the trip and proper guidance was provided. The Tea Houses and all nitty gritters was looked at. Happy to have chosen them for this trip.

Awesome EBC Experience with an awesome agency !!. I had reached out to Nepal Trek Adventures post getting a recommendation from a friend who is a seasoned hiker and expert. We had done a thorough research on Nepalese and International agencies before we finalized on Nepal trek Adventures. Binod (the proprietor, whom we fondly also call Babu) is humble and professional in his approach. He was reachable on phone, watsapp and on email and had addressed all our queries and concerns before we landed in Kathmandu. We were a group of friends, some of whom were of average fitness and hence we were concerned whether we would be able to complete the 11 day trek. Binod in his briefing session had shared some of the best practices to ensure that our hiking was a success and assured us that we will be well taken care of.Binod had aligned Rewati Prasad Parajulie as our guide and he did a fantastic job in ensuring our hike from Lukla to EBC and back was smooth, we had adequate breaks, were fed well and were put up in clean tea houses. The potters were diligent in their responsibilities, and one named Binod had been doubling up as an assistant guide which was very encouraging to see. The acclimatization planned throughout the hike was effective and we successfully completed the trek with zero injuries. Now thats what customer orientation and a good agency is all about !!!. To top all the above, Binod was kind enough to sponsor a day trip around kathmandu and host a farewell dinner :)

At ease in all aspects. Booked a 8day tour with 5 days trekking up to 'Gorepani Poon hill' with Binod. Binod was highly recommended by a friend who has taken more than 3 tours with him so being a female solo traveller my mind was put to ease. Binod was very promt to send me replies to my many emails re tour and what to bring to Nepal and the details of the tour. From the moment i landed to my departure i had no reason to worry as all necessary details were taken care of....from transport in Kathmandu to moving around in Phokara with a paragliding trip all i had to do was just be there. My guide Shiva made sure i was safe at all times on the trekk and never left my sight on the trekk during some steep climbs even lifting my pac as it was a lil challenging at times. Anil at the hotel made sure all was ok with the rooms and showed me where to go for shops ect.....all in all i definalty recommend their services as my time in Nepal was limited and they made sure to take care of all the small things that i would have found time consuming on my trip.....will definatly be back as Nepal and its people are so welcoming with big hearts....Namaste

Great local agency with heart and brain. We needed a local agency to helps us with various booking and coordination in our trip and Binod was a great help to make things smooth and safeGreat staff all along the the chain of services. Nepal Trek Adventures staff was relaxed always trying to make sure we were comfortable.

AMAZING ANNAPURNA TOUR TREK. It was difficult to choose between all the many agencies that are offering treks to Nepal. I decided to trust a young and dynamic company runned by Binod! Everyhing was perfect, it was the best experience of my life.
Thank you again for organizing what will remind an unforgettable memory!

Very organized trekking trip. Thanks Binod and our guide Shiva for taking us to Everest Base Camp and back in one piece! From so many travel agents available in Kathmandu, it's difficult to choose at the very beginning. I am lucky to have a friend recommend NTA. And my experience proves it's the right decision. The guide finds responsible porters. We are guided to very decent tea houses. The return flight from Lukla to Kathmandu is on time. And the driver is always waiting for us. EBC is a must-go adventure for me and I recommend Binod and his company.

Awesome adventure. "What is the cure for boredom? Adventure!!" From Never Cry Wolf. Gyan was easy to work with and Gyanendra was the best guide. In Nepal for business and I took my son for a short 3-day trek to Chisapani, Nagarkot and Bhaktapur. Did 35 miles in 3 days. Gyan even sent his 11-year old son to trek with us. We had a great time seeing the culture of the villages and the forested areas. Would recommend this company every time. Much less expensive than other companies, too. Only advice would be for Gyan to provide a more trip specific packing list. I was a bit unsure what to bring because the list he provided was for longer, higher elevation treks.

These guys do a superb trek.. We selected Nepal Trek Adventures NTA for our Annapura Circuit Trek from the internet. Our experience from start to finish was exceptional. They left no stone unturned to ensure that the entire trek was a trip of a lifetime. Binod the MD of the company runs a very professional operation. Our guide Kreexna`s attention to detail for the entire trek was hugely impressive. We are a couple in our early 60s. We had an amazing experience on the entire trek. We hiked the entire circuit and each day Kreexna discussed our options and outlined what he would recommend as the best ones. We were never disappointed with his recommendation. His selection of places to stay was always on the money, hot shower and wholesome food guaranteed. Our Hotels in Katmandu and Pokharra were first class. This trip was one of the best we have ever been on, thanks to Binod,Kreexna and the staff. It will live long in the memory. Greeted at the airport on arrival and escorted to the airport on departure. We arrived in Nepal nervous because of all the hype. We are so glad we decided to go. We left Nepal having made new friends and the experience of a lifetime. If you are thinking of going don't think twice. Binod and the guys at NTA will do the business.

The most epic hiking trip that I ever had.. The hiking plan is very practical. The owner of the trekking company Binod is very helpful. My flight got cancelled and he offer 2 more free nights in his hotel to me. His hotel is super clean and everyone there is very helpful. Cannot expect more.

Wow.! Blowin away. The trek was everything you could expect. It was absolutely incredible, from the moment we got off the plane to the moment we got back on the plane everything was takin care of by Binod. It was fantastic. He did a great job with pairing us with Dahana would couldn't have been any better at his job as a guide. All in all it was a incredible time and I highly recommend it .

TRIP OF A LIFETIME! . This company is awesome! I can not thank Binod, Dahna, and the rest of the staff enough for everything you did for my brother and I. My brother and I made the trek to EBC. We decided last minute to plan a trek in Nepal and were surprised how fast Binod was able to accommodate us. Our guide and porter were amazing! The whole trek our guide, Dahna was friendly and was more than accommodating to what my brother and I wanted to do everyday, but always keeping us safe. Everyday was unbelievable and so much fun. Even though some days were difficult, Dahna was very encouraging and made every step of the way enjoyable. All the lodges we stayed at had comfortable beds, delicious food, and showers were usually always available. If you are planning a trek in Nepal you must go through this company. Hands down, this was one of the best trips I have ever been on thanks to Binod, Dahna, and the staff. They will do whatever they can to make it the best trekking experience for you. Thank you again for the memories, we will never forget this trek and the people we met along the way!

Help with everything even Medi-evac! . I used this company after a referral from a friend. Binod took care of everything we needed while in Kathmandu and on our trek. He took the time to understand our needs and catered to them perfectly. He set us up with a guide and porter that matched our personalities and trekking style. I highly recommend this company. Unfortunately on our trek one member of the team suffered from altitude sickness and had to be heli-evacuated from 4920m (Lobuche) after reaching Kala Pattar (5545m) the day before. The guide and company had cell phone and satellite phones that helped them coordinate our insurance and medical assistance while reassuring is of our safety. We were all (5) taken back to Kathmandu and our sick team member evaluated at a private hospital there. He was in good health after coming off the mountain and well looked after by medical staff and Nepal trek adventures throughout his visit.The guide and company was very flexible with our travel plans and accommodated everything we needed wether it be an extra day here or trek more or less that day.The hotel in Kathmandu is nice as well and the restaurant has a great menu ad bar that are well pricedIf I could give 6 stars I would. Thanks for everything.

Nepal, an adventure . Whenever I plan to go back to Nepal for a second adventure trip, there's only one company that I ll be more than satisfied to book everything that I want to do in Nepal, NTA.It is a professional company run by Mr. Binod Sapkota who gave us a great 12 days plan, unforgettable days.

Tibet. I enjoyed spending time in the country side of Nepal drinking milk tea with the goats and kids and such beautiful scenery. It was December and a very bitter cold night while on the way towards Lhasa. It made a lasting impression though the landscape is so isolating and alien and in a culture so mild in comparison to India which i would say is the extreme opposite as a sensory experience. I was very greatful that Binod and his team helped me to make this trip as i was denied by well over a dozen other companies who did not have a proper group to make it possible to enter Tibet under the srutinized and restrictions.

Thank you NTA.... I planned to hike the Annapurna Circuit in March 2015 and booked the tour by NTA. Unfortunately I had to return after 3 days due to very bad weather conditions. Binod and his team were very flexible and they took time to make me different suggestions for alternatives. In a case of emergency of a friend on the Poonhilltrek Binod & his team reacted fast und straightforward to help.Binod, Shiva, Raj, Pawan... everyone was kind and helpful. And every appointment was perfect in time.

Nepal 7 day trip. My friend and I had such an AMAZING 7 days experience in Nepal. The people were wonderful, the culture is fabulous, the food was YUMMM and the views spectacular. Due to me having such a short time span I decided to book with a travel company ''Nepal Trek Adventure and Expedition" and they couldn't have been more helpful and fabulous to be around. They organized everything down to a T. We enjoyed 3 hours of water rafting in Krishuli with the lovely Arun, journeyed on to Pokhara to complete a 3 day hike to Poon Hill and got to spend two days in Kathmandu where we bought some wonderful hand crafted gifts. . Thank you Binod for organizing our trip and Dhana and Krishna for being fabulous guide and porter, the trip wouldn't have been the same without ye. Wishing ye all the best from Liz and MaryOn a separate note we organized to do the Everest Base came flight, anyone thinking of doing it don't bother it is a massive waste of Money, firstly our flight was delayed by an hour including the half an hour we had to sit in a bus on the runway for some unknown reason, the flight doesn't even fly over Everest, the plane is freakishly tiny and it costs and outrageous 200 dollars. It also felt like it lasted a half an hour.

A trip I'll never forget!!. I can honestly say my trip to Nepal was one of the most exciting, memorable and fun filled trips I have ever gone on and this was all due to Binod and his team. From the minute I arrived off my plane, I was provided with a sense of security and relief as his team was there to pick me up from the airport. Immediately they made sure we were prepared for trekking, accompanying us to local shops and recommending what we needed. Each member of staff were so warm and welcoming and ensured that we were looked after in every aspect. After a fantastic white water rafting adventure with some travellers we met along the way, we were accommodated with a private bus down to Pokhara. The 3 day trek was the most amazing experience of my life. Apart from the unbelievable scenery and fantastic people we met along the way, our guide Dhana and porter Krishna were the most heart warming, helpful, fun filled and knowledgeable people I could have been around. I could almost say they were my Nepalese family! They really helped you capture a true insight into the Nepalese culture and the way they live. Eventhough I was only in their company and the country for a week, I have to admit, Nepal and Binods team have really earned a special place in my heart. Their decency and hospitality towards us was second to none. You will not regret going with them! I can't wait to meet them again for my next Nepalese adventure!!:)Mary (Irish girl;) x

Don't bother with Nepal if you don't use Binod and his team.. This is my second time to Nepal, and if I can possibly help it, it will not be the last.Binod, Ram, and Radj are family at this point. That is the level of service you will get from Nepal Trek Adventure. I travel to Nepal solo and I have never once felt unsafe. The team and collection of partners in Nepal will never leave you feeling ripped off, cheated, or questioning your decisions.Make SURE you go to A.K. Imports for your pashminas, sweaters, and blankets. I am still shocked at how kind they were. And I never had to haggle. The experience you would want to get from a visit to Nepal will be magnified 10 fold with this company. The sky is the limit, literally for what Binod and his team can put together for your packages. I have paraglided over fish farms and rice patties, touched the birthplace of Buddha, had a private day of meditation deep in the Himalayas, been off the beaten path, and have shopped until I dropped in the local streets glittered with goods beyond your wildest dreams! Enjoy Nepal the right way with Nepal Trek Adventure

Best decision!!. We are so happy that a friend had recommended NTA and we chose them for our Nepal trip! Everything was planned and perfected according to our preferences. Binod worked with us extensively to plan a trip suited to our needs. The guides and drivers were lovely and very helpful. Choosing this company made our trip stress-free and hassle-free!

Nepal Adventure. My friends and I made a trip to Nepal last April. The wonderful Binod and his team were highly recommended to us and before we arrived everything was organised perfectly to the very last detail. It was an amazing experience and NTA made it very memorable for us. I would highly recommend NTA to anyone travelling to Nepal as they will ensure you have a fantastic trip no matter how long or short the stay is!

Recommended. . My husband and I enjoyed a customised 2 week tour organised by Binod earlier this month (December 2014). Our trip included Ghorepani Poon hill trek (4-5 days); 4 hours White water rafting (Grade 3+); 1-2 days at Chitwan National Park; Nagarkot to watch sunrise; Baktapur; Pashupatinath and Monkey temple. The trips all went well. The standard of accommodation was great in Katmandhu, Pokara and Chitwan. Only Nagarkot was a disappointment. After being in Annapurna the views were disappointing (cloudy/polluted) and hotel was a bit grubby. All very enjoyable. For recommended.

Wonderful Experience All Around!. NTA arranged a Poon Hill trek and stays in Kathmandu and Pokhara for me and two friends. Every aspect of the trip was fantastic! Binod was responsive and helpful in planning for the trip, and was very flexible with our shorter time frame for completing the trek.The pickup service at the airport and comfortable lodging at the Hotel Veda in KTM made for a great start and an easy welcome in KTM, and that great service continued throughout our time in KTM before and after the trek. Binod, the front desk attendants at Hotel Veda, and all of the NTA staff went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed. Our trekking experience was a highlight for all three of us. Krishna (our guide) and Razon (our porter) were awesome!We would absolutely recommend NTA to our friends. We wish we could do it all over again!

Everything was just ... perfect!!!. When our Nepal plan was confirmed, we were having a serious headache over which tour agent to choose since there were so many trekking companies in Nepal. Nepal Trek & Expedition was not our first consideration but luckily it was our final choice. Binod and his team were amazing. He was extremely helpful in everything. All of our concerns were solved satisfactorily and efficiently by his team. Binod spent numerous calls to help arrange a very good insurance package for us, which made us really feel confident to start our trekking, especially after recent avalanche in Annapurna circuit area. Our guide Krishna and our porter, Raj are great. Krishna is such a helpful guide with a lovely smile always on his face. He was very patient with me on the way even though I was very very slow. He is also very considerate with our demands and always tried to get us the best things available. Raj is very friendly porter and he helped us a lot with our luggage. Without him, we could have never made to the base camp. Thank you Nepal Trek & Adventure team! You would definitely be our choice in our next Nepal trek.

Brilliant!!!. This trek was easily one of the best experiences I have had travelling. I found Nepal Trek and Expedition through Tripp Advisor after searching through numerous companies.He was brilliantly efficient, upon arriving in Kathmandu we easily finalised the trek and we were off.Both our guide and porter were both very friendly and helpful.We ended up making a few adjustments to the itinerary but Binod was more than accommodating and made sure that we were always safe.I would easily recommend this company to anyone seeking an awesome trekking adventure!

A Great Experience. All in all a great experience. Binod was excellent to deal with, addressing all of our concerns both before and during the trek. Our guide Rabi was lovely, even when I began to feel ill due to altitude. He made sure that I felt safe and comfortable throughout the entire experience. I would highly recommend Nepal Trekking Adventures to anyone who is looking to trek in Nepal.

Efficient and friendly tour company. From the moment I initiated contact with Binod until my last day where he personally drove me to the airport, I would say he exceeded my expectations. He is very approachable, professional and accessible. He replies to messages almost asap and went out of his way to make sure I was satisfied.What impressed me was the effort he made to ensure I had my down jacket for our EBC trek (which was left behind in the store the day before). He made arrangements to send it with other people joining our tour group.There was 4 of us in the EBC tour group and we merged with another group of 3 who were doing the same trek until EBC. The two merged groups formed one big family with a great dynamic. We were also fortunate enough to have two guides - this was a good thing as our guide was lacking in some skills which was managed well afterwards.Upon our return Binod took us out for lunch and dinner and received and managed all of our feedback about the trek and guide feedback really well and very professionally.Binod also manages De Hotel Veda, a nice hotel in central Thamel where I stayed and he's also opening an adjoining restaurant soon.He's a good businessman and runs a professional service. I would recommend him to my friends and I would recommend and praise Dana as an exceptional guide.

helpful, flexible and dependable. We spoke to one other company that we found to be really pushy before visiting NTA which helped us to see how helpful they really are. Binod, the owner, made us feel really welcome; listened to what we wanted as well as what we didn't want and walked us through a couple of itineraries that may suit. As well as being more approachable his price on a like for like trek vs the other company we spoke to was considerably lower!Our guide, Jit (aka Jimmy), was very friendly and, as it turned out, resourceful; when the inevitable delays occurred flying in and out of Lukla Jimmy always managed to get us where we were going with the minimum of delays despite planes not flying or bad weather coming in from the mountainsOur actual trek was awesome and we have some amazing memories and photos of our time. We elected to do the Everest mini trek which is basically part way to base camp so you can see Everest in all its glory but the trek was half the time and didn't go above 4000m (good for insurance purposes!)When we came back Binod took us and Jimmy for coffee and listened to our feedback which was another nice touch.There are trekking / adventurer companies every second building in Thamel and it is really hard to choose someone to work with as some of these treks cost a lot of money but I would recommend Binod and NTA

Best Trekking Agency. We recently used Nepal Trek Adventures to do the Annapurna Circuit in October, and we can't say enough good things about the company and the staff. The tour company owner, Binod, was extremely organized and responsive to our concerns. He set us up with everything we needed, from a great guide and porter to airport transportation to meals and city activities and shopping for our trek. Binod arranges for his guests to stay in his own hotel, which is one of the nicest hotels in Kathmandu. Our guide Deepak was excellent. He was attentive to our needs and had no problem slowing down the pace when we were tired. He was friendly, easy to talk to, and extremely kind. He also knew all the shortcuts and which areas were dangerous. Our porter Raju was also wonderful and helped to arrange our accommodations and meals at guesthouses. We happened to be on the trek when the October 2014 blizzard hit the Annapurna region, so we eventually had to turn back. Binod, Deepak and Raju were so helpful during this time in contacting our families to let them know we were okay, as our cell phones had no signal. They even arranged to buy me a birthday cake from a local bakery the night of my birthday. Even though we could not complete the circuit, we had an excellent experience with Nepal Trek Adventures. We felt really comfortable and safe the whole time, and we would recommend NTA with enthusiasm!

Ghorepani-Poon Hill Trek / Absolutely amazing!. What a great trip!I have just returned from 1 week doing the Ghorepani - Poon Hill trek. When first inquiring about the different treks available for my short break, I contacted many travel agents by email. Binod, Managing Director at Nepal Trek Adventures, was extremely fast and descriptive about what could be done during my short time in Nepal. He was very honest and explained the entire trip as well as what was needed. Traveling by myself and being a woman, I was very careful with the company I would choose. Needless to say that I was very reassured and booked quickly with them.Everything was well taken care of upon my arrival in Kathmandu, from the airport pick-up to the hotel (which belongs to the company). Even though I landed late (midnight) Binod and his team welcomed me at the hotel and introduced me to my guide Dipak. Next morning off we went! The trek was amazing, walking at my pace and Dipak was very attentive making sure that everything was taken care of and that I was at ease in every location & situation. He would share information on the local culture, tradition, fauna & flora and many other aspects. For travelers with only a week to spend hiking, I highly recommend the Ghorepani Poon Hill trek, it has a moderate difficulty (you have one day where you will climb 3200 steps though!) but it is worth it! The landscape is amazing and the highlight is the sunrise from Poon Hill at 3210m!I arrived as a client and left as a friend of both Binod & Dipak's, very down to Earth people who's aim is to share their beautiful country with you.If you are planning a trip to Nepal, don't think twice and book with Nepal Trek Adventures, you will not regret it.I am planning on returning in 2015 to do the Annapurna Base Camp and will definitely go with Binod and the team.

EBC & Gokyo Lakes. A few months back I contacted Binod about organising a hiking trip to EBC and Gokyo Lakes, which has been dream trip of mine for many years. Right from the first email I sent him, Binod was extremely helpful, efficient and easy to deal with. It's can be scary booking a big trip like this online, but the trip with Nepal Trek Adventures was so much more than I could have ever hoped for. Binod organised absolutely everything from the moment we landed in Kathmandu to the day we left to return home. Airport pickups, hotel accommodation in Kathmandu, flights into Lukla, trekking, and then all of our activities in Kathmandu/Nepal when we returned. Nothing was ever a problem for Binod and his team and they all went over and above. Our guide through EBC & Gokyo Lakes, Dana, was experienced, knowledgable, caring, encouraging and was always making sure we had a great time. He got us great rooms at each of the guest houses and always made sure our tummies were full for all the trekking! This will not be my last trip hiking in the Himalayas (the magic of the mountains got under my skin!) and I'll most certainly be travelling with Nepal Trek Adventures next time I go. I could not recommend them highly enough, you will not be disappointed!

Everest Base camp - Oct 2014. I decided to go solo to EBC and Kalapather and was recommended To reach out to Nepal Trek Adventures by a couple of friends who had dealt with Binod Sapkota and his team . I came to katmandu after having spoken on the phone and sealed the deal with Binod . He said , just come over and enjoy the experience while we take care of everything .. And he was true to his word .... The package deal included all meals , accommodation , lukla tickets , kat hotel stay and local sight seeing . What I was committed is what I got and more . This arrangement made me focus on my trek and helped me see EBC and Kalapathar and realize my dream .The Himalayas cannot be looked at as a casual and a mere sight - seeing experience .It is bound to throw up a few surprises and few punches along the way . But the way Binod and team rose up to the challenges and helped out is commendable . One example was when I was stranded in lukla bcos of a storm in kat and airport was shut down , Binod asked me to stay put at my hotel , had a guy wait at the airport for my tickets , and ensured I had a smooth way out of lukla ... Made me feel like a king in the Himalayas - thanks Binod and the entire team for making my trip hassle free and memorable

Excellent Annapurna circuit trek with Kiran as guide. We found this agency via Tripadvisor and had an excellent trek (our first proper trek). Kathmandu is full of agencies who will all promise the same package for the same price more or less. This makes it very hard to pick the best one for you.If you have time, I recommend spending a day researching this carefully, particularly meeting your guide, as this is what will make or break the trek for you.We first met Binod, the very charming and charismatic owner of Nepal Trek Adventures. He was very honest and upfront about his business and the way the Nepalese trekking tourist agency works, which we liked - he stood out from the rest and made it very easy to trust him.We met some of his guides and went with Kiran, who we strongly advise. We also met guides from other agencies who were extremely underwhelming, inexperienced, or who spoke very little English. Kiran had done this trek numerous times and spoke very good English.It's not expensive to hire a guide, especially when the cost is split between two. We recommend getting a guide instead of a porter guide - you will really get more out of it. Also, ideally carry your own bags: if you don't need it, don't bring it. We met a 47 year old woman carrying her own bag (she kept overtaking us and made us look like panting old men in the high altitudes), and a family of 5 Swiss of all ages, also carrying their own bags.But if you do hire a porter, please remember they are also human so don't overload them with heavy bags! We saw a lot of porters carrying far too much (some up to 35kg) during the trek.Kiran was our guide for the Annapurna trek. This was our first proper intense trek so were like two small boys needing a bit of nannying. Kiran was perfect. He sorted out everything from where to stop for a coffee/apple pie rest, to sorting out the accommodation bill at a local rate. He made sure we saw everything of interest and was so thorough and professional with every minor detail - always with a positive nature.We also had a few altitude symptoms when we hit 4,000-5,000 metres and higher. Kiran was patient and gave good advise for curing any altitude sickness symptoms, like going slower, drinking more water (oxygen in the water helps) and even drinking coca cola. We normally use coke as a toilet cleaner but found it helped rid of altitude headaches quite efficiently!The Annapurna circuit is by itself amazing, but having a good guide makes this experience one of those memorable experiences in your life.I highly recommend this agency because of the very honest way its owner, Binod runs the business, and, for Kiran who was such a terrific guide. Try to persuade Binod to give you Kiran as a guide if he is available - you won't regret it!

Langtang valley trek with Kreeshna. A group of four friends, we have done trekking in Nepal with Kreeshna in Langtang valley end of May 2014. Kreeshna was our guide during the trip. We left from Kathmandou to Syabru Besi where we started the trek itself. We passed through Lama Hotel, Langtang village and Kyangin Gompa. We did the same path on our way back. We all really enjoyed our trip. Kreshna took care of all organizational issues during the trek (bus tickets, choice of lodges to stay and places to eat). He knew extremely well the region of Langtang and provided us great advice regarding the places to stay. Thanks to his very good knowledge of the local environment, he enabled us to have contacts with local people in Langtang valley what made out trip even more enjoyable and authentic. And last but not least, his never ending smile and good mood contributed in a very positive way to make our trek pleasant and inspiring. We would definitely recommend Kreeshna as guide in Langtang but also other regions that he knows well. We will not hesitate to contact him again for our next trip in Nepal !!!

Fun in Nepal!. Nepal Trek Adventures provided me and my classmates with an unforgettable experience. The trip was enjoyable not only because of the awesome activities we did but also because of the great staff that was present throughout our journey. I recommend this trip to everyone!

trek to Nepal. I have done some trek in Nepal was really special because of their hospitality, caring, big mountains, many ethnic group and so on. The whole trip to Nepal was unforgetable, i must say, if someone was planning to organise trekking, tours and climbing, just contract him (Santosh Gauli), he will manage easily your programme in Nepal.

Good Agency, Lovely Nepal. I'm a 30 years old guy from Italy, I have been for two weeks with my father in Nepal and Tibet and we asked to Binod, the manager of the agency, to organize the trip. Well there are hundred of agency in Kathmandu but I choose this for the good price and Binod was very kind and professional. Everything was fine; when a landscape destroyed the Highway from Tibet to Nepal and we couldn't come back, Bindo rent us an helicopter the day after...many other tourist had to go by feet trough the jungle. So I raccomand this agency. I don't use to write many reviews on Tripadvisor but if you have any question you can concoct me in private, this is my address: fab.vinci@gmail.com

After research we came down to this agency !. We went to Nepal without thinking about doing a trek. But after some "negotiation" with my wife we decided to give a try. The first thing we did was to research and read some reviews. We visited about 3-4 agencies. Out of the all Binod (the owner of Nepal Trek) was the one that was the most straight forward. No need to negotiate price, because it is probably the best in Kathmandu, but that doesn't mean the service is less. As you will quickly find out, many tour companies will use similar type of tea houses on the trek, so regardless with who you go, you will ended up on same quality place. The most important thing when doing a Trek is to make sure you have a connection with your Guide and that he understands your needs. You do not want to have any problems on a 14 day trek to Everest with your guide, so we wanted to make sure our guide was patience, since we are very very slow walkers, and we are not "nature" people, nor we have any background on trekking. Binod, introduced to Dhana (guide), which all we can say is the best guide, and most patient person who was always there when we needed some help.At one point my wife started having head-aches, Dhana was very concerned, and assured us that we didn't need to rush, or trek next day in case she wasn't feeling well. Which for our luck, she got better next morning and we were able to continue. During the trek, Dhana was very careful to make sure we don't go into a dangerous route, and always warning us when there was a sketchy part of trek. In our opinion two of the most important elements when choosing an agency for trekking is:1) Guide2) PriceWe had both. Not only that, Binod helped us arrange a pick up service for our Indian Visas while trekking, and also gave us a deal on his hotel which by the way was very nice. You don't need to look further, this agency is it. But in case you do go to other agencies, you will quickly find out you will have wasted time. Have fun trek !!

The Smart Choice. Binod from Nepal Trek Adventures was the key to my great trekking holiday in Nepal. I must have emailed him a million times with questions to which he always had the answer. He planned a private trek for me that was customised to all my needs. He also handled some visa issues that arose once I got to Kathmandu. Can't wait to get back to Nepal to take another trip with NTA.

Perfect time in Nepal. We were recommended Binod from friends who had previously visited Nepal. Binod and his lovely team were all so lovely from the moment we met. This was a fantastic way of experiencing the sights and sounds of the beautiful country. I would certainly urge you to get in contact with Binod and the team to help make your stay in Nepal a friendly, flowing and fab one!

Great Trip. Nepal Trek Adventures provided us with a safe, comfortable, and exciting journey through Nepal. Trekking through the Himalayas was a fantastic experience and I recommend NTA to anyone wanting to visit.

Splendid time in Nepal. We had an amazing trip with NTA company. Everything was really nice! Thank you to our guide and our driver for everything. I would like to recommend to everybody for doing any tour and trek with Nepal Trek Adventures . Awesome way of seeing the Himalayas - the view is spectacular!

Fantastic Trip!. My family and I did the Everest Region in May-June 2014. We were treated to a friendly, well organized, and knowledgeable crew. Tours of Kathmandu, Pokhara, and Chitwan were amazing! These places were more colorful and interesting with our English speaking guides who demonstrated great passion for the area and their culture. The guides were knowledgeable, funny, and amazingly attentive to our family of four, throughout the trip. We were very flexible with our agenda, so we were treated to many instances of local culture off the beaten path that added a personal and private feel to our trip. We changed our plans and itinerary spontaneously on some days. Mr. Binod had no problem accommodating our many spontaneous requests. He seamlessly set us up for any trip that we may have heard about from some other tourist and wanted to see. Mr. Binod's experience, and commitment to his customers, as well as his conscientiousness and caring toward his guides and porters make Nepal Trek Adventure and Expedition the go-to company in Nepal. We cannot wait to return to the area for more adventure! I must say by using a locally owned and operated company, my family and I had a more authentic and personal experience. This was quite a refreshing change from the American company we had used 15 years before where we experienced a tourist "tick-list" approach.We will definitely use Nepal Trek Adventure and Expedition on our return to this wonderful country!

Incredible Experience. I did the Annapurna Circuit Trek May 2014 and had an incredible experience thanks to Nepal Trek Adventure! Binod and his team organised everything efficiently, were reliable, very professional and beyond friendly. The guide they organised for me was friendly, knowledgeable, spoke English and was a great traveling companion. There was not a single problem the whole trip; even when I had to change my itinerary toward the end on my Trek, Binod and his team quickly handled everything for me. I highly recommend Nepal Trek Adventure, you won't find a better Trek company in Nepal!

Friendly, reliable and great service. We trekked Annapurna Circuit in May 2014 with Nepal Trek Adventure. We felt welcomed and were taken good care of from the moment we stepped out of the airport. Binod and his team were beyond helpful. Our guide speaks English and he is a friendly, humorous and fun guy who is passionate about the mountain and very responsible of his job. We also had a sherpa that is helpful and responsible in ensuring our meals and accommodation are taken care of. Even when times that we decided to try out other eating places, he was with us to make sure we are ok. The porters are friendly and helpful. At the last 2 days when the going gets really tough and we were really slow, they offered to help us with our day pack. They sincerely care and did their best to help us made it through and complete the journey.After the trek, 2 of us extended our stay to tour around Pokhara and Kathmandu while the rest of the group left. We thought we were on our own as the guided services will end there. To our pleasent surprise, Binod and team rendered their help in ensuring we got the transportation sorted out from city to city and showed us places to visit and the way to get there They were with us until the last moment of sending us to the airport. We were really thankful for making our trip a very memorable one.

Best in Nepal!!!. "We had the most memorable time on the Annapurna Circuit, thanks to Binod and his team who has made it possible for us. His crew is very experienced, resourceful, well-connected and always a step ahead to take care of our every needs. Our guide speaks perfect English and is cheeky and fun to be with, explaining to us local culture, teaching us simple Nepalese and songs from local movies, and an amazingly experienced mountaineer"

Response & Responsibility. It was my first trekking trip to Nepal and i am pleased to have Binod and his crew of Dhana, Shiva, Rajkumar, Ram and Prakash be our host, guide, sherpa and porters. The were very responsive to our teams needs and nuances and most of all i felt our team were in safe good hands. I noticed NTA's crew checking in daily to their office about our wherabouts and wellbeing and any roadblocks or challenges were handled smoothly and our team was always reassured of a smooth journey. We definately had a great time and on our next trip...i am sure our team will be looking to Nepal Trek Adventure for our next adventure.

dependable and great service. I used Nepal Trek Adventure's taxi service for private pick-up from the airport. They arrived right on time and were friendly and accommodating. I was also provided with lots of useful information regarding available city tours. I would definitely use these services again and book a tour in the future.

Very professional. I found Binod and his team on the Internet. Binod was very responsive and helpful right from the first email correspondence. He is also a smart and professional manager. After arriving in Nepal I had to change my itinerary completely, and he was able to settle all the arrangements in half an hour. This is very efficient by any standard, not to say in Nepal. Binod and his guides and drivers are all friendly guys and would do their best to make your trip enjoyable. Highly recommended.

Nepal Private Day Tours. Excellent management and friendly staff. I visited this country in July 2013 and I found manager of this company is very honest, knowledgeable and informative in replying an email in the correct time with lots of useful details. The tour guide of they provided was very helpful and friendly. Pricing was reasonable and the drivers were best. They are ready to help you anytime and anywhere if you need any help.Once again thanks to management team and you are awesome people.A 100 % recommended agency.

A Trip of a Lifetime. Excellent is the only word to use! From the initial contact (via email) Binod and his team surpassed my expectations. He promised us the trip of a life time and that is what we got. In the past I have taken 'tailor made' tours that have been anything but!!! From the very first meeting Binod did everything within his power to make the trip run smoothly - whether it be regularly reviewing our plans and amending them to meet our needs, supplying us with a SIM card to make contact easy when we were touring, providing us with excellent, knowledgeable guides & drivers, changing money, being available 24/7 to answer questions - the list is endless. Nothing was too much trouble and any request was met with 'just give me a few minutes to see if that is possible' and Binod and his team always made it possible. We could only stay four days and Binod managed to plan a trip which gave us with everything on our wish list - the major sites in Kathmandu, white water rafting, flight over Everest, elephant safari, elephant bathing, jungle walk, kayaking and even some shopping...... We will visit again and we will use Binod and his team to give us our next adventure. I would recommend without any hesitation that anyone who is planning a trip to this beautiful country contact Binod. Thanks again Binod and hope to see you in October, if not before in Dubai.

a great team. I was walking through thamel and stumbled upon NEPAL TREK ADVENTURE AND EXPEDITION, looking for someone to help/organize some trip stuff for me. I had been in, I dont even know how many trekking offices that day, trekking companys seam to be everywhere in nepal. But walking in this place was different. Housed upstairs it was just a little office but thats not what caught me, it was the sounds of laughter and yelling coming from the door. I knocked and binod, a spiffy dressed gentleman (the owner) answered and lead me into his office, past 4 employes all talking and laughing around a table . Right then I knew these guys were fun! I almost wanted to sit down and join them right then and there.They seamed like they loved their jobs and that ment they took pride in what they did. I planned a trip with NEPAL TREK ADVENTURE AND EXPEDITION starting in chitwan and doing: jungle walk, elephant ride, visiting elephant santuary, making "elephant momos" (elephant food), seeing elephant bathing station and, doing a river canoe ride. Then I proceeded to lumbini, the birth place of lord budda. I rented bikes and went around the whole development. From there the final stop was beautiful pokhara, I started my time in pokhara with a trek and ended by paragliding into town. And finished it with a canoe ride out to the rice feilds with my girlfriend. Now I am a 19 year old student and by no means am I rich, binod presented me with a once in a life time trip that I could afford. His is a gentlemen and a man to be trusted, he and his team of guides are a rare breed of men!
The Best. They were perfect! Everything was according planning! I strongly recommend them. The guides and the whole team are very professional.

The Best Treking Team. Biond and his team were the most honest, professional, kind and the best service you can get all over Nepal.They all know the area very well and the guides have great English.From my experience Dhana, my guide, was knew everything and everyone, and most important he was very responsible!!I truly recommend the agency!! Netta

Top ten list to do before you die!. I had such a wonderful time trekking with this agency a big should out to my Nepalese brother Dhana, he was my tour guide for the trek, fantastic, he was full of local knowledge and was always there to put a smile on our faces. I was solo as were all the other trekkers in our group they all came together through this agency. I ended up making life long friends from this experience. The trek itself was unbelievable, to be this close to one of mother natures greats gifts was truly spectacular, i take with me the memories and the smiles of the locals as we passed through their towns, ate with them, slept with them and had a warming experience that has touched me forever. Highly recommend NTAE they were great, staff in the office, friendly and helpful and the guides were excellent! Once in a life time opportunity, well worth the trek!

Get Ready to Have Your Mind Blown. Once in awhile you will have an experience that changes not only your life but your soul. You will come upon a person, a lifestyle, an environment, a smell, a dish of food, or someone's misfortune that will make you stop and reassess. I wanted to experience Nepal and feel the land and the people without being lead to through the scams of the typical tour companies. I have been led down one too many roads and through one too many souks to the "brother" that will give you the best deal. Only to find out behind the next pile of carpets, lay another just like the one under your arm for half the price. I wanted to travel a sacred land and not be spoiled by (or desecrate) anything that wasn't natural about where I was. Binod and his team have changed my life forever. I am brought to tears every time I think about my travels to Nepal and the experience I had there. Ram was my guide and now a dear friend. If you want to find yourself and head off to a far away land to ride elephants, touch Buddha's birthplace, paraglide over rice paddy fields, trek through untouched villages and feel alive, book with Nepal Trek Adventures. You will not be disappointed. Namaste from the USA.

trekking tour - perfect :). I did a trekking tour with this Agency last march. everything was planed very well- our guide Sures made a great job and we compared lot of agencys- the price is really fair. So i wish all the best to the agency and i can really recommend it to all of you.

Great service from Nepal Trek Adventures. Very good experience with Binod from Nepal Trek Adventures. He not only did everything to book my trip answering all my wishes, he also stayed in close contact during the trip, to ensure all was running smoothly. I travel a lot, and Nepal Trek Adventures really impressed me with their friendliness and engagement and standing out for their service level. I absolute recommend Nepal Trek Adventures to everyone.

Feeling Special From Start To Finish. Binod and all his staff has treated me and my best friend a treatment like we are their relative--very warm and accommodating, starting the time that they waved their hands hello to welcome us in Kathmandu, from waving bye bye when we are about to go back to Dubai, giving in to all our wishes, treating us like queens from start to finish, sending us messages of good luck and asking us how our day of trekking has been. We never expected a package tour to be like this, we never felt so safe, it all felt like we were trekking along with our long-time friends! What is supposed to be only a best friend bucket list to travel outside country together, turned out to be a very unforgettable vacation with their sincerity, flexibility and warmth. We have so much to keep and tell even to our great great granddaughters. :) My first time trekking was a true success! Keep it up! inspire more and more nature lovers across the globe of the beauty of Nepal, and its true resource, their people-- including YOU guys. :)

Professional and went that extra mile.
