Amazing vacation with Makalu Adventure Mr Mohan very helpful he made it a personal adventure for us, the guides the best; he spent a lot of time with us planning it to cater for our requirements, his local knowledge is priceless. And he is responsible for making the entire vacation unforgettable. Only thing I would change is next time I would fly from Kathmandu to Pokhara but other than that faultless will definitely book with this company again

Amazing experience. This trip was the amazing experience and took us into Tibet and Nepal, both fascinating cultures so different from each other and our own. The scenery is breath taking - we had to pinch ourselves! Makalu looked after us so well - great accommodation, plenty of food, cheerful, helpful and efficient staff, and well organised itinerary. Would happily travel with them again.

Outstanding Value:. Once again I must share my most recent experience with Makalu Adventure.Together with my friend Claudia we trekked in the Langtang region and climbed Yala Peak.Our crew were first class and we were treated exceptionally well.We encountered heavy snow up high, but our climbing Sherpa looked after us and ensured are safety.I have travelled with the vet competent Makalu Adventure on several occasions. Each trip has been memorable and I can thoroughly recommend them.Mohan has got the balance right. The trips are very well priced and offer exceptional value for money.Needless to say I will return.

Amazing experience in Nepal with the help of Makalu. Last April/May 2014 I visited Nepal with my girlfriend and coordinated several activities with Makalu, right from the moment they picked us from the airport we noticed the great service they provide, I have been around several countries and cannot mention a better service than Makalu´s, they treat their customers with kind respect and professionalism, they are willing to explain their culture and beliefs while showing you around, their recommendations on what to do or what do eat were always right. This is a local Nepali agency that knows what they are doing, do not be afraid of hiring Makalu or prefer foreign more expensive agencies, hiring Nepali agencies help the country and the people directly not thru a third party.

Lhasa to Kathmandu mountain bike ride. Reasonably challenging ride, but really well organised and well supported. Spectacular scenery and well-chosen route made the effort well worthwhile, but the crew were just amazing: tents pitched and packed for you, toilets and washing facilities organised, and really good food coming from a two-burner stove: three big meals per day. Makalu will be getting my business again, for sure! I can't recommend the staff at Makalu enough, from the managers at the office to the guides, drivers and cooks. They're all awesome.

Druk Yul. once again an amazingly well organized trip.If you want to visit Bhutan, no better way than with Makalu Adventure ! It was a truly amazing experience. The co-operation with ABC tours was excellnt.

Best. My husband and i booked a private tour in Nepal. We traveled to Lumbini, Chitwan, Pokhara, Kathmandu, Bhakthapur in 8 days by car. Everything was very well organised and just on time. Accomodations are perfectly choosen. We enjoyed our tour a lot. We plan to come again with our family&friends and travel in Nepal with Makalu Adventures. We had a wonderful time and every detail was very well planned by Mr.Mohan. Enjoy Nepal with Mr.Mohan, you will be in good hands ;)

MTB Adventure Tour; Lhasa - Nth Everest - Kathmandu. Unbelievable scenery and great support from the guides and staff. Guided tour through major temples plus great local knowledge. Very challenging riding but worth every pedal stroke of the 1100+ km. Experienced team and great itinerary. This trip was absolutely awesome ! A once in a lifetime experience. I highly recommend it.

Mountain-biking from Lhasa to Kathmandu. A once-in-a-life-time experience that tests your mind and body to the core, and treats your eyes and soul to a spectacular land with beautiful people and landscape. This is a trip for the true adventurer!! The guides were great - thank you! - and cooks prepared amazing foods, but the true entertainment on this trip was found in the cultural sites, the temples and monasteries, the hours spent on the bike, and definitely being in the presence of Mt. Everest.

Mountainbike trip Lhasa-Kathmandu. A truly amazing trip through the Himalayas. Very challenging but the spectacular scenery makes you forget about all your biking issues at that moment. Friendly and hard working crew. Unforgettable!

Excellent and reliable. We booked our EBC tour through Makalu Adventures blindly on website and paid in advance for the tour and has to say, it was the best thing we did. We chose the perfect company to arrange our trip, nothing was a hassle and we were kept upto date at all times via email and all our questions answered happily. Mr Mohan Lamsal is truly a gentleman and looked after our welfare and our team the best he could. We can't thank him enough for everything he did for us including a special traditional Nepalese dinner with cultural dance. It has been an amazing tour we thank you for looking after us all.We will always recommend Makalu Adventures.

Tibet Lhasa cycle to Kathmandu via Mt Everest base camp. On year sabbatical trip all over South East Asia, this trip was the highlight and one I would recommend anyone who even the slightest bit of adventure in their blood. It was physically demanding but with enough support crew to ensure people of various levels could complete it with a smile and enjoy all Nepal and Tibet have to offer. Thanks for an awesome trip.Nameste Mario

Brilliant Cycle Ride - Lhasa to Kathmandu. i join with a group of 6 men from countries around the world to cycle from Lhasa to Kathmandu via Everest Base Camp. After booking the tour i questioned myself, my fitness and my sanity! therefore i wrote a lot of emails with a lot of questions and got fast helpful responses. Once i met the Sherpa's and Organisers from Makalu adventures most of my worries went away (altitude sickness was still a concern). They were very reasuring and knowledgeable as well as treating us to some great Nepalise customs and tours. Once the cycle ride began in Lhasa all my worries went away. The sherpa's were the most supportive and encourgaing people I have ever met. They even carried my bag from the truck to the tent / hotel after a long day in the sadle. The food was excellent, so good we asked if we could have 'pappa' cook for us every night even when in hotels. The only warning i have is learn how to repair and look after your bike before starting the ride! i had to learn along the way, and thanks to the group i was with i am now at least if not more knowledgeable than my friends back home :) I would definutly recomend Makalu Adventures.

Everest Base Camp and Gokyo Lakes. An absolutely incredible experience. Makalu Adventure was very well organized and delivered beyond expectations. They kept contact with me from the day I started enquiries and got back to me on all my questions. The package was put together exactly as I asked and everything was organized upon my arrival in Kathmandu. My guide was also a huge plus. He was very helpful, knowledgable and professional. Since I am a female who traveled to Nepal alone this was a very important factor for me. I found the trek to be a life changing experience and I would highly recommend using Makalu Adventures.

Traveling across the "Roof of the World", one fantastic adventure!. Makalu Adventure Travel put together a great itinerary for a month long trip in Nepal, Tibet, Bhutan, and India. Our guides were all super, really great ambassadors for their countries and well informed about all the sites we visited. The trip was really tailored to the places we wanted to visit and being a private tour allowed us to stop and take pictures wherever we wanted, something you can't do on a group tour. I wouldn't hesitate to book a tour with Makalu again, thanks for a great trip!

amazing experience - 4 Himalayan countries in one trip. my partner and I recently returned from an amazing trip. I asked Makalu Adventures to put together a trip for us from the information I gave them, the sites we wanted to see, and the dates of travel. It was perfect. We hiked part of the Annapurna Circuit, traveled across the breadth of Tibet, including Everest Base Camp, spent five beautiful days in the lush mountains of Bhutan, and saw the amazing architecture of old India, including the Taj Mahal. On arrival in each country, we were met promptly and helpfully by either Makalu staff or their in country representatives, a guide and a driver. We always felt well informed and safe. What a beautiful part of the world.

Lhasa to KTM MTB Tour. Fantastic journey of a life time. Thank you to all of the organisers, guides, cooks, drivers and especially the bikers who made this trip memorable, enjoyable and utterly fanTAStic! We left KTM as strangers and after more than 1100 kms of bike riding, returned as friends. Look into this trip. Well worth it. Thanks to Makalu. Great food and the daily Wake UP tea was a nice touch. Don't bring the Nepal Lonely planet with you into Lhasa Airport. Had mine confiscated as it had a small photo of the Dalai Lama on page 315. Check out some well written blogs about this trip. Harryhimalaya is worth reading.
Particpated on MTB trip from Lhasa to Kathmandu. Well organized trip. Friendly staff and guides. Food was nice and nutritionally wll suited for biking all day. Good quality tents.

short but sweet. The best way to measure the quality of an organisation is how they react when things go wrong. Unfortunately I had a bad fall on the fourth day of the trek and broke my knee as well as many cuts and bruises. The crew cleaned me up and dressed my wounds with great care and then took me to hospital for an xray. The news was bad so we had to drive back to Lhasa for a flight back to Nepal. At all times the crew were extremely helpful, organising hotel rooms and food as well as dealing with the immigration people. The crew from Kathmandu picked me up from the airport and looked after me until my flight back to Perth.For the time I was there the trek was amazing, the food great and the crew extremely helpful. I will be returning next year to finish the journey and will definitely book with Makalu Adventures.

Amazing Experience. I knew that singing up for the Lhasa to Katmandu bike trip would be a great experience. However, it was the Makalu Adventure team that was really fantastic. The support of the guides and meals of the food allowed for us to keep pushing on through the high passes, off roads and endless 4by4 jeeps racing passed us.

The only way is up(mtb Lhasa/Kathmandu). An amazing mtb trip,after much research decided to use Makalu to guide us across the Himalayas via base camp,the staff,guides and organisation where excellent everything done with a smile,cant praise them enough. The cycling was more of an endurance event,the altitude making it much tougher than you can imagine,so get some serious training in before taking this trip on,camping at Rongbuk and waking up to see Everest made all the hard climbs and sore butts worth while,  We went in September and most of the time it was warm daytime,and around freezing at nights,we had a couple of sleety showers but only on one or two days,You will need a down sleeping bag we bought fake ones in Kathmandu and they where fine,although they did tend to shed feathers so probably wouldn't last to long. If your going to do this route use Makalu the price is right the guides are really on the case,the catering was surprisingly good ,the camping and washing in glacier streams just add to the adventure

Amazing trekk to Everest Base Camp. We chose Makalu Adventure under the recommendation of a collegue who did several trekks with this company. The staff was taking great care of us and was really helpful. Everything was well organized and planned. The guide was very competent and friendy. I already recommended Makalu Adventure to my friend, who plans trekking in Nepal. Thanks a lot guys for such a great experience! We think about coming back for definitely longer trek :-)

Great Everest experience. We chose Makalu Adventure as it was strongly recommended by our friend, who visited Nepal for trekking a year earlier and we were not dissapointed. The staff is very attentive, open and happy to help - starting with the owner of the company Mohan Lamsal, down to our guide Yogi Bharati and the great porter - always smilig Danku. Actually we believe Danku is the best ambassador of the company! We had a problem with getting out of Lukla and needed to do a 1h trek in very demanding conditions to get to the helipad. It was 2 days after our trek was finished and any agreement was no longer bonding the company with us, but all of them were very helpfull and nice. Danku met us on the street just grabbed our luggage and carried it for us.We did 8 days trekking from Lukla to Tyanboche and it was great! Everything was well organized and planned. The guide was very competent. We felt taken care of. And in case of a problem, when weather kept us in Lukla, everyone in there, including the owner were very involved to help find the solution.We also used the company for the 3-days trip to Chitwan National Park and it was great as well.I already recommended Makalu Adventure to my friend, who plans trekking in Nepal.Thanks a lot guys for such a great experience! We think about coming back for definitely longer trek :-)
Trekking. Very nice tour, with clever guides. Nice hotel, good food. Nice nature, nice people, strong porters. We'll be back in Oktober.

Don't hesitate-just book it!!. This has been one of the best adventure biking trips I have ever had the pleasure of doing! Helped out a lot by the fact that Makalu were thoroughly professional and helpful and friendly throughout.I was used to road biking mainly and was a bit nervous as to the difficulty of the offroad,but ended up enjoying the offroad the most! I would say you definitely need a more than average to high level of fitness to get the most out of this trip, so get training and don't miss what could prove to be the trip of a lifetime! Thank you Makalu!

Lhasa to Kathmandu. What an experience! Makalu were superb, they not only catered well for the individual but also for the group. Food and travel arrangements faultless, The cycle experience was very difficult but rewarding and well supported throughout. I have nothing but praise for makalu and would use them again without hesitation.

MTB Lhasa to Kathmandu. I joined my husband and our friends on this trip. Initially I was very cross that he wanted to do something crazy like this, but in the end - what an experience. Some of our group members have already reviewed - all that I can add is that the trip is well worth it. Makalu really gave us value for money, and although the trip was tough, it was more than worthwhile in all aspects. Makalu personnel went out of their way to make sure that we were satisfied. If you ever consider doing this trip, Makalu is the way to go.

EBC and Gokyo-Ri May 2013. I had a most wonderful trek with great porter Dawa and superb guide Yanga. The organisation was perfect, could simply not be better! Prakesh was great, Mr Mohan is the perfect gentleman, everyone always ready to help and inform. Even unforeseen schedule changes were handled with a smile.I would recommend Makalu Adventure to everyone going to Nepal, and if you can ask for Yanga Rai as a guide, he's the best I ever had!

Around Manaslu Trip. It was our first experience with Makalu Adventure, so we did not know what to expect. We chose rather unpopular but extremely beautiful route around Manaslu. We were overwhelmed by the surrounding beauty, majesty of the mountains and warm welcoming of local people. I recommend this trekking to anyone who wants to enjoy the silence and serene nature of Himalayas.Many thanks to Makalu Adventure for organising this trip. We had a responsible, competent and charming guide Shiva Bhandari and a great and strong SanuGanza porter. If we ever come back to Nepal for trekking, we would like to do it with the same team.

Cho Oyu 2013. I have undertaken three separate expeditions with Makalu Adventure over the past four years - two to Cho Oyu and one to Chulu East. I have found Mohan and his team to be honest, sincere and hard working and I would recommend them to others. Makalu provide real value for money so don't expect the luxuries provided by the big money 5-star providers. If I return to the Himalayas, I'll definitely be contacting Mohan!

Mount Everest Base Camp to ABC (north side) trek. I can highly recommend Mohan and his team at Makalu Adventures. Everything was extremely well organised, the food was excellent, the staff were hardworking, friendly and fun, and Mohan himself is a real gentleman, who knows this business backwards.

Island Peak & High Passes of Everest. Fantastically organized bespoke trip from start to finish. Mohan and his team at Makalu Adventure took personal care of every detail from the very moment we arrived at Kathmandu airport, ensuring our planned adventure ran smoothly. Our Sherpa guides and porters were excellent and worked hard to ensure we had a great time, working tirelessly to overcome the challenges we faced along the way.If you want a fantastic adventure in Nepal with flawless organization Makalu Adventures are the team to pick. I'd not hesitate to use them again for trekking/climbing in Nepal.

These guys can really run a trip! Nice Hotel Too!. Makalu Adventure is 1st class if you are used to well run and clean american things. From their Americanized Hotel located in a quiet enclave amid the hustle and bustle of Thamel, to their airport pickup and trekking services, these guys are the best and most reliable I have used. The owner is the Secretary of the Trekking Association of Nepal and he means business. He goes overboard to attract return customers. I highly recommend them.

Fantastic Adventure - High Passes and Island Peak. Not a holiday an adventure!Cannot praise Makalu Adventure enough.Mr Mohan and his team were excellent from start to finish!Everything possible was done to make our adventure work and a great time was had by all.Highly recommend this company for adventures in Nepal.

Best Adventure of my life so far - High passes and Island Peak. If you are planning an adventure in Nepal, these are the guys you need organise it with! Flawless organisation from start to finish. People talk about going that extra mile - these guys multiplied it by 10 and some. Pure professionals, who provide a bespoke and complete service to all.

For me, the best organised photography tour yet!. I went to Kathmandu, Pokara and the Annapurnas with 11 other photographers in March 2013. We aimed to capture images of the stunning mountains, the friendly dignity of its hard working people, and the colour, richness and meaning of its varied faiths. All of us in the group achieved remarkable success. As I had a lung dissease, it was with some trepidition that I agreed to take on the challenge of going to 4,000 metres, but though very difficult, it was worth the effort. Needless to say, I could not have managed to get so far without the excellent, careful, detailed planning and organisation of Mr Mohan's travel company Makalu Adventures. Oxygen was even available if I needed it, which thankfully I did not. It was the most thoroughly organised photography trip I have been on, and I have been on nine previous trips all over the world.I can thoroughly recommend Makalu Adventures for all those travellers who want to travel to such remote places in the world, who want the security of knowing their hotels, food, transport and guides will be skilled and reliable. Their needs will be met. And on top of all that, the price is so reasonable. What more could you ask?

Mera Peak. Great trip organised by Mr Mohan. He is a lovely warm character and happy to help. Sadly our team did not make the summit but our guides and porters supported us in every way and made it a pleasant trip. This was my third time in Nepal and second trip with Makalu Adventure, who i highly recommend.

Patience and Calm. These guys are pretty amazing. My first experience with them was navigating through the chaos of Kathmandu streets after being collected at the airport. What a ride. The patience and calmness of our driver, Itu, proved to be a template for how Makalu get the job done. It looks peaceful on the surface but every effort to make things happen is taking place behind the scenes. Thanks guys for the great hotels, top guides and safe driving.

Family visit to Nepal. Best visit ever. Wife and daughter reaky enjoyed the personal attention given to us. Makalu adventure have excelled in their effort to make this a memorable visit. Thanks Mohan and Serish you are the best.

Makalu - Mera Peak Expedition. From the moment of our first enquiry Makalu Adventures provided us with unsurpassed information and assistance during our 20 day trek & successful summit of Mera Peak. Makalu’s emphasis is on quality, safety and of course having an awesome experience and a successful summit. Every member of our expedition team provided us with incredibly friendly 5 star service; from the cup of tea in bed each morning to the post summit celebration in true Nepali dancing and singing style! By the end of our trip we felt we were saying goodbye to family! The trip was well organised with quality equipment and excellent locally sourced fresh food. This is my second expedition arranged by Makalu and i highly recommend their services be it an expedition or day tour. Makalu without doubt deliver everything they promise.

Kailash Kora Trek. This was a trek with complicated itinerary and a lot of planning. But everything worked as planned! Our group had a wonderful time, the food was amazing (special thanks to the greatest cook Ankami), and the guides were great. On the way back, as we crossed the border into Nepal, the road was closed due to multiple mudslides. It took only one call to Mohan Lamsal, the owner, to resolve the situation. We simply could not be late for our international flight. Mohan Lamsal organized alternative transportation through the sections cut off by mudslides. And where the road was clear a bus was waiting for us to take us to Kathmandu.

Outstanding!. Our travel agent Tara Gupta of India By Design contracted Mr. Mohan Lamsal to arrange our time in Kathmandu. The service provided by his company is amazing! All arrangements went smoothly, we were met by a competent airport representative and a very nice driver. Mohan, his lovely wife, Shila, and their 2 sons met us for a lovely traditional Nepalese dinner with entertainment. Mohan arranged our local tour guide, Tulsi Manandhar and he was truly exceptional. He was kind, genuine, friendly, generous, and had a vast knowledge of history, culture, and HIndu & Buddhist religion. The best thing about Tulsi is that he was a social ambassador and allowed us to actually interact with the local people in the various villages surrounding Kathmandu. I highly recommend Mohan's company, Makalu Adventure Day Tours!!

Merra Peak. My first trip with Makalu Adventures, have to say it won't be my last!Mr Mohan would have to be one of the most wonderful warm people i have met in a long time, he met all our needs as a small private group.His Guides and Porters were amazing and made our trip one i will never want to forget. Thankyou so much team. Highly recomend Makalu, and the best bit is that it is a local company so we are suporting Nepal and suporting local families.

Trekking with Makalu Adventures. I have organised four group trips to Nepal over the last ten years all with Makalu Adventures Ltd and can unreservedly recommend them as a first class and very professional travel company. The treks have been long and strenuous to all corners of Nepal but in all cases the planning, attention to detail, communication and professionalism displayed could not have been better. What is even more surprising is that this service has come at a cost well under that of many of Makalu's competitors. I am currently in the course of organising my fifth trip and it goes without saying that I will be using Makalu Adventures once again.

VISIT TO Kathmandu. Recently i visited Kathmandu and Pokhara. Mr. Mohan had organised everything to perfection and it was quite good experieince. My Kids , wife and myself had really memorable experience in Nepal and we would love to come back again to this lovely country

Very nice operation for fitting travel & trekking.. Dear Mohan, Thanks for so warm and heartful reception meantime in Nepal with every trekking & travel management. I & my wife can never forget your favor and help and every support with sincere efforts & delicacy. Especially Dolpa to Jomsom trekking is the best I've experienced. Again I will revisit you and ask your good service. Highly recommended !! Lee & Jang from Korea.

An Oasis in Kathmandu. Simply said, this is the cleanest most hospitable hotel in Kathmandu. The food is good, service is friendly and the internet and air conditioning actually work. This 4-5 story building, set back just off the alleys of Thamel, provides a peaceful oasis to the chaos of Thamel. The owner is an honest person who strives to provide a western-like atmosphere and comfortable rooms. He deserves to be successful. He will do most anything to please his guests. I am not aware of a better hotel in this city of 3 million people.

Simply the best!. This is a very professional outfit who plans every details and is also very safety conscious. They took myself and my wife and another 8 people to base camp and also to the summit of kalampathar, unforgettable.I cannot recommend these guys enough, forgt the rest, go with the best.We went in feb 2006, and look how they are still growing, great testament to a professional company.

Trek to Nar Phu Region in Nepal. My party of four Americans chose Makalu Adventures for a seventeen day trek in the Nar-Phu area of Nepal as well as touring Kathmandu and Pokhara. Mohan and his staff took excellent care of us throughout. They picked us up from the airport, arranged our local lodging, hired highly knowledgeable English-speaking guides who showed around both cities. I couldn't speak more highly of our trekking crew as well. Our guides knew our trekking route well and were always attentive to our needs. . Our always cheerful cook and his helpers managed to roll out excellent food even in remote locations. In short, at the end of our stay in Nepal, we felt nothing but great admiration and respect for all the people we worked with at Makalu Adventures. In the next year or so I want to return to Nepal and I would consider no other trekking operation than Makalu Adventurs.

Kathmandu and Tibet. What a fantastic tour! A great hotel, a temendous guide for our tour of Kathmandu, problems with the flight to Llasa compensated for both by a trip to the mountains and business class flight. The guide and driver in Tibet were absolutely first rate, the hotel accommodation far better than I had expected. A truly exceptional holiday, due in a very large part to Mohan's commitment and expertise. I have absolutely no hesitation in recommending Makalu Adventure Travel.

MTB Lahsa to Kathmandu. The most amazing adventure and well organised by Makalu. The mountain bike trip was 1,400 kms long over 15 days and included a stay over close to base camp at Everest. The trip was well put together and the team were very supportive, with good hot food and camps set up in advance.The trip includes 5 mega passes that exceed 5,000 metres in altitude and finishes with the world's longest downhill of 140kms.Its a once in a lifetime adventure and Makalu made it all worthwhile.

EBC Trek 2012. A very well organised, personal and welcoming organisation. From day 1 the staff were available to help with any issues that arose and as the trek progressed they excelled with their expert knowledge and understanding of the region and the people of Nepal. Special thanks to Mohan and all his hard working staff who made the entire experience unforgettable, if your planning a trip to Nepal I would seriously recommend Makalu.

Himalaya expedition 2012. I thought the hotel was excellent due to its friendly staff, immaculate rooms and great food. The hotel is based in a busy, thriving market area of Kathmandu filled with amazing restaurants that sell great food for reasonably low prices. When i return to Nepal on another expedition i will defiantly be staying at this hotel and use Makalu adventure day tours to organist it.

Off the beaten track in style. Once again I have utilized the talents of Makalu Adventure to trek in Nepal.On this occasion together with two friends we visited the remote, resticted Upper Mustang region.We enjoyed the company of one guide, a cook, two helpers and a pony man.We followed the normal route to the fabled walled city of Lo Mangthan where we rested for a couple of days.We then decided to go ‘off the beaten track’. Heading east we visited the remote Tashi Kabum cave complex as well as Luri Gompa.After this we headed south and enjoyed some truly spectacular scenery. The landscape was truly lunar and the rock formations were fantastic. A couple of days would be considered hard, and included a couple of 1000m ascents.Our little party enjoyed some truly spectacular campsites. At this stage of the trek we saw no other westerners.At all times our crew took exceptional care of us and the variety of food that our cook produced was exceptional.In short, Makalu Adventure once again proved to be setting the standards that other companies should aspire to.

NEPAL EVEREST BC + GOKYO TOUR. Completed the Everest BC + Gokyo Pass trek in Oct 2012. Makalu Adventures did an outstanding job of planning the entire trip allowing me to enjoy mine time and not worry about any of the logistics or planning. The company does an excellent job of keeping me informed through email, details about the trip, answering all of my questions and finally delivering on all of their commitments 100%. I would use Makalu Adventures in the future for my trips in Nepal and Tibet. Thank you for all of your hard work to make this a trip of a lifetime and a great experience.

Annapurna Cicuit by bike. Having just returned from three weeks' cycling around the Annapurnas, i am still thrilled. Apart from the fantastic landscape and and people as well as the very interesting cultural insights i very much appreciated the professional and good-value organization of our customized trip by Makalu Adventure. Being recommended by friends who had previously done the Lhasa-Kathmandu bike tour it was a safe bet. Especially the attentive and caring guiding by Kalden Sherpa(who may not be a man of many words but masters the economic humour) needs mentioning. I definitely will come back to Nepal and i will definitely travel again with this company. Cheers, Gabriel

Cycle from Lhasa to Friendship Bridge (Nepal border) via EBC. Three of us did the cycle trip in Sep 2012. Mohan (Makalu Adventure) helped us to customize the trip to 16 days. He is very knowledgable and responded to my emails of question rapidly. We were very happy with all the arrangements before and during our trip.The Tibetan guide, driver and cook who took care of our trip, were excellent, they were very caring, and did everything they could to ensure our journey was safe and most enjoyable.We had a great time, and would look forward to traveling with Makalu Adventure again in the future.

Nepal Cultural Travel and Lhasa to Kathmandu MBT. I have travelled with Makalu on two separate occasions. 2011 I participated in the fantastic Mountain Bike Trip from Lhasa to Kathmandu via EBC and fulfilled on of my dreams and in September 2012 my wife and I did a 2 week sightseeing tour around Nepal organized by Makalu travel. On both occasions I was highly impressed with the professionalism with which both tours were organized. Mohan Lamsal and all of his staff are exceptional and go beyond of what can be expected. Both of the tours were well organised and excellent value for money.I can highly recommend Makalu Adventure and we are looking forward to going back for a new adventure with Makalu.Werner Mathiuet

EVEREST BC NEPAL + ADVANCED BC TIBET 2011. As an avid high altitude climber , i have travelled the world to many remote parts. I have lived my desires over the years... But what made this Himayalan expedition a dream come true for me....was simply the professionalism and the passion that drives Makalu Adventure Tours to endeavour so to make this dream of mine...A REALITY TO CHERISH. I was never considered just a paying client to Mr Mohan Lamsal and his staff.... I was treated like family. Having travelled with many adventure companies ... but none come close .... and therefore Makalu Adventures remains unmatched and on top of my list of adventure companies. l have the greatest confidence and respect for them.

Lhasa to Kathmandu. I would highly recommend Makalu Adventure tours. I recently completed the Lhasa to Kathmandu bike ride. The ride was spectacular, and the food, camping and service of the guides were excellent. They certainly went above and beyond to ensure our journey was as organised and comfortable as possible. Unfortunately due to Chinese regulations we could not get to Everest Base Camp. However, Mohan went out of his way to compensate this, organising several days in Chitwan and Phokara. If I was to travel to this area again I would definitely travel with Makalu again.

"Freelance journalist by mtb from Lhasa, Base camp Everest to Katmandu with Makalu Adventure". As a travel journalist I had a fantastic trip with my wife and Makalu Adventures from Lhasa via Basecamp Everest to Kathmandu. After a thorough research we decided that Makalu Adventures should help us realize the dream of our lives. We have traveled in most parts of the World, and we have never experienced a better travel partner than Mohan and his team at Makalu Adventures. Mohan and his staff were always ready with helpfulness and fast solutions to acute problems. The trip was a unique journey through the most spectacular landscape you can experince on a bike. The complete team reached Everest Basecamp partly thanks to the good food, and the essential permits, that Mohan managed to get for us.I recommend mohan and Makalu Adventure to everyone wanting a journey you will never forget.

Lhasa to Kathmandu via EBC. We have recently completed a fantastic ride from Lhasa to Kathmandu via Everest Base Camp (EBC) - well it was meant to be via EBC but the Chinese government in their wisdom was not handing out the requisite alien permits that allow foreigners to detour to EBC. Despite the disappointment of missing EBC Mohan and his staff provided a well organised trip with excellent food, services and guides. As we had finished 3.5 days early, Mohan provided a complimentary trip to the Chitwan Jungle and went out of his way to help us in anyway. I would definitely recommend Makalu Adventure to anyone considering a mountain bike ride or trek.

Cecilia Glimberg Rønne: Mtb Lhasa - Basecamp Everest - Katmandu..... with Makalu Adventure. MAKALU ADVENTURE - from owner Mohan Lamsal who is a wounderful person to all people who works at Makalu - thank you for your kindness. Not only the usually kindness when you travel with an agency, this is something different. You can without a dout lay back in your chair and let the people from Makalu Adventure fix the rest. When we met Mohan the first time we thougt "ok he seems like a nice gay"- what we didn`t know then was that Mohan and his staff where proffesionals from inside and out. Very well organized trip, the timescedule worked, the food was ECELLENT - with short words the team worked very well organized, and you get a lot for the money. Than you for helping us with visa, and for your hard work to help us live a dream, hope we can travel by you again - SOON!!!....Ps. As a freelancephotografer it was great to sit in the car who stopped every time I wanted to take some pictures, and it was nice that the guides know whrer the best photplaces where!

Cho Oyu expedition 2012. Makalu Adventure is the exact image from his owner Mohan, very precis, professionnal, concensius and friendly.The food was excellent, the team well organize, the Sherpa "a big man" in all the sens, and the prize was the chepast i found, but for a realy rich quality and this fact is not usuel for sure !!!I reccommanded MAKALU ADVENTURE to any one who want the best prize / quality and the best HUMAN EXPERIENCE Congratulations and a big thanks to all of you for making that project become trueOlivier Racine Switzerland

Rolwaling and Pacharmo trekking with Makalu Adventure. I spent 27 days trekking the Rolwaling with Malalu Adventure in 2011 and this year I will return for another 27 days in the Dolpo region.I have trekked every year since I was young ( 58 now) and I can afirm that this is one if not the best organization in my trekking.Congratulations Mohan you have a great team, I will be always gratefull with you and especially with Purbha Sherpa .Jose A DelgadoCoral Gables , Fl

I will return:. I have travelled with Makalu on 3 seperate occasions. On each occasion I have been impressed with the quality and excellence of this company. Mohan is a first class individual who listens and acts upon any recommendation.Our three trips have been of a demanding nature-There are only two of us and we need to rely on competent professional staff. Our most recent trip took in the demanding Tilmans Pass in the Langtang region. We encountered very heavy snow up high and the temperatures plummeted. Fortunately our climbing Sherpa and guide ensured both the porters and our safety.In short, if you wish to trek or climb in Nepal do yourself a favour and utilize the considerable talents of Makalu.

Trek to EBC. Having recently returned from Nepal with my son I would highly recommend Makalu Adventures as they were incredibly efficient and well organised. My son had to be evacuated back to kathmandu due to illness and this was dealt with quickly and professionally involving a helicopter and prompt transport to the clinic in Kathmandu. Nothing seemed to be too much for them and made the trek a very pleasurable experience.Sandy M

Trek to Everest base camp. This is the second time that my husband and I have done this expedition with Makalu Adventures. First time was base camp and Island Peak and this timeto base camp with a large group. Both times we have had the most amazing experience with our chosen guides and sherpas. The attention and service is 5 star and there were tears when I had to say goodbye. ItNepal is the most special place and highly recommended. We will be back.

Fantastic Makalu Everest Base Camp Trek. Our family of four (mom, dad, 12 and 14 year-old daughters) spent two and a half weeks in Nepal as part of a larger group of 18 trekking to Base Camp. It was a trip of a lifetime! Not only were we exposed to the breathtaking mountain vistas, but we were also given a taste of the rich cultural and spiritual heritage of Nepal. Throughout our trip, Makalu's obvious expertise and experience in organizing these types of tours shone through and was evident in their professional but friendly approach, amazing attention to detail and seamless planning and execution. Their ability to adapt to unexpected changes, be it weather, illness, delayed flights, obstinate yaks or forced accommodation changes was most impressive. I would recommend them without any reservation! Martin Huysamer.

Everest trekking. My daughter and I have recently returned from a great trekking tour in the Himalayas, facilitated by Makalu Adventures operating out of Nepal. Mohan and his team were amazing. They attended to all of our needs, from evacuation, sickness, communications to meal preferences.Thank you, we will be back.

Makalu Adventure Trekking Agency Kathmandu. We (my wife and me) have been travelling and trekking in Nepal since 1980. The 4 last times (Rolwaling, Dolpo, Renjopass and Gosainkund/Langtang) we had our stay and trekking organised by Makalu Adventure. Our special wishes (route, flights and side excursions) always have been met to our total satisfaction. The guides, sherpas, cooking and porter crews always have been perfect. Especially the kitchen served us tasty food in good variation. Because we often have made programm changes "en route" we apreciated that the office in Kathmandu arranged all changes in flights, transfers and hotels to our utmost satisfaction. This flexibility of Makalu Adventure is for us of big importance. For sure the next trekking (Rara Lake National Park) we will do with a Makalu Adventure crew.

Everest Base Camp 2012. My son and I have just returned from an incredible trip with Makalu Adventure Tours to Base Camp. Their service and attention to detail is quite extraordinary. Without anyone noticing, everything was taken care of - accommodation, meals and the cheerful and hardworking sherpas really made our trip. Nothing was too much trouble. Three of our party had altitude problems and Makalu took care of their evacuation with unbelievable speed and efficiency. The safety and satisfaction of their clients is their top priority. I do not hesitate to recommend them to anyone and in fact, my second son and I are scheduled to join them again in two years time on a kyacking expedition - hope to see you there!

Over the past two years working w/Makalu Adventure Tours. My husband and I have worked with Makalu Adventure Tours over the past two years. Eric and 3 of his friends went in 2010 and at the last minute 2 of the guy's lugguage didn't come in for 2 days so they had to change their entire trek and Makalu Adventure Tours accomodated all of their needs and they had a fabulous trip.In 2011 Eric and I requested that Makalu Adventure Tours help us plan a 3 month adventure to India, Nepal, Tibet, and Thailand. All of the arrangements were excellent and we enjoyed every minute with the guides, cooks, and porters supplied by Makalu Adventure Tours. During that time I had 7 women freinds from Boise join me for an 18 day tour of KTM and the Langtang trek. All of the women were pampered by the guides, cooks, and porters. The cooks made excellent meals and their attention to cleaniness benefitted the group and no one got sick.We would highly recommend Makalu Adventure Tours because Mohan, the owner, is very personable and attends to all of your wishes. The reasonable pricing of the tours is also very helpful for those of us who want an experienced crew and accomodations at not a high cost.

Kathmandu tours and Himalayan trekking. I have used Makalu Adventures to organise local Kathmandu tours and three significant full service high altitude trekking expeditions. The have provided good logistics from timely airport pickups to internal flights to remote airstrips in Nepal, to sourcing full porter crews and providing good quality personal and mess tents. They employ excellent cook teams and guides. Their office service is excellent and they are happy to invest significant time in arranging customised trips with patience and good humour.Importantly they always ensure porters & staff are suitably equipped - to International Porter Protection Group standards.

Day trip in KTM and EBC trekking. We were a group of 18 people who spent a duration of 18 days with Makalu Adventures in April 2012. It was a combination of day trips in KTM and an EBC trek. Makalu gave us excelent service and we can highly recommned their services.

Great trekking company. We spent three days in Himalaya with excellent guides who were also super friendly and very helpful. The guides were very professional and had a lot of local knowledge. I highly recommend this company. Hari, who runs the company, accompanied us on a second trip to a beautiful temple where we could experience the Dasai festival with the locals, and it was almost transcendental to be in the surroundings.

Trekking in Nepal. High Himalayan organized our three-day trekking to Poon Hill. It was our first time to Nepal and we were very thankful for the great input and help we got from Hari at High Himalayan in planning our trip. Both the guide and the porter were very friendly and knowledgeable. Hari was also very accommodating and showed us unique spots of the Kathmandu Valley. I can highly recommend High Himalayan to anyone travelling to Nepal.

An unforgettable journey. First time in solo, therefore I dranded a little bit! But Hari had been helpful months before my trip and was also very flexible during my actual trip in Nepal!He will take care of anything to make you happy on every level!I strongly recommend him and his knowledge !

Such an amazing experience!. This was my first time travelling alone and first time in Nepal so obviously I was quite nervous. But as soon as I arrived I realised there was no need for the nerves! I was very well looked after right as I set foot in Nepal! I spent the first week in Kathmandu experiencing the culture and getting used to this new way of life. I then travelled to Harikrishna's home village of Jibjibe in the Rasuwa district for some time volunteering as an English teacher in the local school. This was an experience of a lifetime that I will never forget. I stayed with Harikrishna's beautiful family in the village who looked after me so well by cooking for me, walking me to school , taking me on treks and accepting me as part of their family. the English teaching was also so rewarding and it was so lovely to be able to help the kids. I will definitely be back!

The most friendly and helpful agency in Kathmandu!. I was recommended the High Himalayan Treks long before I came to Nepal. I was introduced to Mr. Harikrishna by a good friend of mine. We were discussing all details of my future trip online prior to the start and I got answers to all my questions. The trip we made was in Langtang, it was designed on my request, and there's no need to say how beautiful it is there) I'm a person difficult to surprize, I have an outdoor experience and used to do everything myself, but even for me the help of Hari and his team was essential. For the begginers it would be an absolute must.I want also to emphasis that Mr. Harikrishna is an active member of his community. He is well-known in a neighborhood for a very important reason- he runs a lot of charity projects for people living next to him. He has build a big modern hospital near his home village Jibjibe in Langtang, and at the moment he's going through the paper legalization process for school building in the area. In his plans are 3 schools to build this year and he hopes to increase this number next year. He also supports many poor families around by paying the education fees for their kids in order to let the kids study and get a chance for a better life and future of next generation. Most of the guides working in his company where educated and trained at his cost for the same reason - to give the countryside people a chance for a better life. All the money Harikrishna spends on his projects are earned by his company tour services or donated later on by his grateful customers. Don't let go of an opportunity to become one of them!

Journey of a Lifetime!. Last October my mother and I set off on an epic trekking adventure in the himalayas nepal. We wound away up and up the mountain through the canopy of lush green trees, tranquil waterfalls and with fish tail mointain guiding us every step of the way. It proved to be the best physical and spiritual journey I had ever been on. Our guides and porters went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable, organised and safe. They provided entertainment plus...with non stop humour, language lessons, cards and more. Nepal is a beautiful place itself, but the people are the real essence of this beauty. To work hard, live simply, be resilient, to love and to be happy are wonderful values this trip teaches you. Thankyou Hari :)

Exactly the trip we wanted. Last year our group of 22 did a 2 week trip with High Himalayan. It was hands down the most well organised trip we could have imagined. We were lucky enough to have Hari as our guide and he pulled out all the stops to ensure we had a true Nepali experience. From organising a special Nepalese New Year celebration for us in his village at his home to the extra special hike to 5000m on the Langtang Valley, the highlights are too many to count. The porters on the trek were incredibe and some of the most hilarious times were spent playing cards with them around the potbelly stove. If you want to experience Nepal through the locals' eyes and stay away from those overly commercial companies, High Himalayan is for you. Massive thanks to Hari and all the wonderful people who treated us so well for the trip of a lifetime.
Good assistance and recommended for beginner. Our guide, Gopal, is patient and talkative, me and 3 others very happy in our first experience in Nepal

Wonderful experience. We were a group of 20 and every single one of us have taken away very fond memories of our trek with High Himalayan. The cook, guides and porters were extremely friendly and I finished the trek feeling like I'd known them forever! Can't wait to go back for another adventure with these guys!

One of the best experience of my life. Thanks to High Himalayan me and my friend Rebeca had a wonderful experience along the marvellous mountain of Nepal. Everything was really perfect, the people we met through high Himalayan trekking and expedition were incredibly helpful, knowledgeable and available, to the local people in every village was welcoming, the sights were astonishing, the food unforgettable. An absolutely worthy experience, I personally can't wait to come back to Nepal and I definitely suggest High Himalayan to each and everyone, they really make a good service, flexible and adaptable to anyone. Highly recommended, could not ask for more.

Poon Hill Trek. Today we concluded an incredible experience in the Himalaya, namely Poon Hill Trek. High Himalayan Trekking and Expedition's staff, Gopal (guide) and Raju (porter), have been two amazing companions for this 10-days journey. I have no words to describe the high level of organization and time scheduling of this agency. Margherita and I are two young and sportive students which knew very little on how to organize a trek. Luckily we found High Himalayan Trekking and Expedition on Lonely Planet and from there we connected with Harikrishna, founder of the company, which made our lives easier and set everyone up for us. He and his stuff took care of us, and we did not have to worry about anything.We are very grateful to them and I totally recommend it to families, couples, and friends.

Annapurna Panorama Trek. I trip to Nepal on May. I was traveling alone and Hari helped me a lot with the organization. He was very friendly and he always was ready to help. The trek was very nice. 100% recommend.

Short Trip Muktinath Trip. It was my first trek, and Hari managed everything for me, we talked 6 months before i reached Nepal. I did bond with locals, have amazing photos around our journey. Although Hari is not my guide at that time, but he was looking for us time to time. He will make sure that everything is ok for us. The trek is so cultural and beautiful scenic view, from the deepest gorge of the world Kali Gandaki River to High Peak Snow Covered Mountain. I remember Hari always said this is an easy Trek, the trek is flat, from young to olderly also can do it. And i know what is Nepali's flat now, yes, little bit up, little bit down. Thanks Hari, you made a very wonderful trip for us, so many lessons i got while i was there.

Everest Base Camp Trek- Lifetime Experience. My first trek and that too directly Everest Base Camp. Mr. Hari made it so easy for all of us with the help of his arrangements and his super amazing attitude towards life. Hari- You are doing really great and surely you will achieve everything you desire. Thanks mate for making us discover once in a lifetime experience so beautifully. Hope to see you soon and plan many more treks in future. You truly are an amazing person mate and hats of to your contacts and relations you have made, which we all experienced during the trek!!Cheers!!!!

Amazing Népal!. I met Hari and his team in September 2012, and what an incredible journey! They are just perfect and we had so many good times and conversations! I highly recommend if you want to make your trip awesome. ;o)

EVEREST BASE CAMP - A MUST DO. Just got back from the most amazing trek you will ever do…. EVEREST BASE CAMP TREK. The scenery is mindblowing amazing, from turquoise rivers, to scented pine forests, to the snow capped peaks of the Himalya’s to finally the almighty giant of this world - Everest. The journey was such smooth sailing the whole time. No matter the weight they carried the Porters always had an amazing smile that could make anyone smile. I’ve never felt so at peace and harmony with life until this trek. It really is a must do for everyone. No matter your age young or old anyone can do it; just ‘Slowly Slowly’ . The tea houses are great and there is always plenty of food to choose from. Finally though none of this wouldn’t have been such smooth sailing without the guide with the biggest heart for nature, trekking, and NGO work - Hari. Hari you truelly are amazing,! You looked after the group amazingly and bent over backwards for them, always putting the client first. Whether you are seasoned traveIler or a little worried of what Nepal is like – Hari will guide you through everything and make you feel safe as can be. Thanks Hari for giving me the experience and memory of a life time!! For anyone looking to trek, or get a cultural buzz in Nepal I super highly recommend High Himalayan Trekking and Expedition! Thanks Hari!!!!!

Mindblowingly surreal Everest Base Camp trek!!. Hari and his team led an unforgettable experience to Everest Base Camp!! The entire trip was A+++. Hari's bottomless pit of good contacts provided the best accommodation and food the mountain could provide whilst his team of porters were unquestionably incredible!! The experiences along the way of Nepali/Tibetan culture, the mountains, rivers, rhododendron forests to the sparse landscape above the treeline scenery was the most incredible experience of my life!! I was so lucky to arrive at EBC on a full moon and to celebrate my birthday also, soooo lucky!! Highly recommend Hari and his trekking company to all!!!!!!!!

A Cultural Kick, plus everything else!. If there is one Festival that is a must do in life - That is to visit the amazing Holi Festiva… the festival of colourl!! Hari was an absolute doll to pick me up at midnight the night before, then the next day walk me around the fantastic labyrinth Kathmandu during the whole festival. Never been so happy for hours on end. You very quickly feel like a friend rather than another tourist, (which is unlike most other tours I have been on around the world.) Whether its trekking with Hari, doing one of his Cultural tours or doing some volunteer work in a local village, I would highly recommend Hari's company to all ages, colors, shapes and sizes of the world. He is very internationally minded, knows the whole country like the pack of his hand and looks after your safety at all times. Thanks Hari for everything.

Incredible Nepal!. Hari and his team High Himalayan Trekking and expedition makes your trip perfect! I had the chance to meet Hari how is an amazing person how does so much for his country. I spend few days in Hari’s village and family before leaving for Trekking in Langtang region. The trekking guide was Ram how really showed me and explaining me everything about Nepal, Langtang region and his village as well. A very good cultural experience! Hari and his team can organize your trip in Nepal as nobody else can do. Choose them for your trip! Nepal is definitely an amazing and safe country with peoples who deserve to be known. This trip, the people I meet and Nepali lifestyle really change my mind! Thanks to all of them!

An incredible trip!. It was an amazing experience to visit Nepal because, yes, it's a great country but being able to discover it with someone local added definitely a lot to the experience! Hari has been so kind with us, the experience wouldn't have been the same without him and his lovely family. I will definitely contact Hari again if I ever go to Nepal again. Thanks Hari!

earthquake with hari. I don’t want to criticize or to compliment; I want to tell how it was.On April 1 2015 I took my younger son and came to Nepal to do two treks – standard ABC and Gosainkunda Lake. Hari met us in airport (we are acquainted in 2011) and passed us to the hotel. He gave us a wonderful porter Sagar and organized both trips. During trekking we had no problems even if I change the itinerary. While returning from Langtang to Katmandu by jeep we faced the earthquake. You can imagine: everything is closed in KTM, nothing to eat and nowhere to live. Hari met us and invited to live in his rented house, he gave us mattresses and pillows, and we spent this funny aftershock night with him. His young sister cooked some meal for us next day. We spent one more night, and only when we took taxi to airport, Hari led us and started to his village to see what happened with his house. I think it was a real MAN act. I’m almost 60, and if I ever more come to Nepal I’ll use Hari’s help.Sergey Buneev,Ivanovo, Russia

High Himalayan experience. I have now done two tours with this company and found Hari and his team to be fantastic. They gave us a true Nepali experience whilst ensuring our needs and safety requirements were met. I recommend them very highly and will travel with them again.

It was awesome!. It was a great experience to be one month in Nepal and to spend most of the time with High Himalayan Trekking and Expedition. Mainly being up north close to Langtang mountain and following the road to Tibet and the Tamang heritage trail was just amazing. Our guide was well oranised and able to improvise if necessary. So we had always nice guest houses or charming private places to stay over night. As he was well experienced and travelled within Nepal from the lowest to the highest regions we learnt a lot about the country, the local culture (buddhism, yak cheese production, clothes), geographical characteristics (mountains, smuggling paths, special plants and berries) and certain issues uf the time we've been there (landslides, destroyed buildings, fuel shortage). Our guide planned the trip always in consideration of the circumstances and everybodys physical strength. His aim was always to provide us with joy and knowledge to have the best experience possible - so we had it!

Great discovery of Nepal. I have had the luck to stay with Hari for 3 weeks as part of my trip to Nepal.The goal was to go trekking on the Tamang Heritage Trek. In order to give more sense to our trip, we collected funds and clothes for the community around Hari’s village. Through his associative activities, Hari found the perfect project for us and we could even distribute the clothes ourselves in the remote school. Before heading to the trek, we spent 5 days in Hari’s village where Hari's family hosted us. Seeing how people work and live in this region was a fantastic and humbling experience. We then started the trek directly from the village.During the Trek, along with his expert guide input, Hari lead us to the best accommodations around. Since Hari is also teaching economics in Kathmandu University we could discuss broader topics such as the Nepali economy and the best ways for Nepal to improve its system. Finally meeting Hari was one of the highlights of my trip to Nepal.
Nepal Trip. Hari is a remarkable tour guide and person! I would highly recommend his group for you next trip to Nepal!

Truly amazing and humbling experience. The two weeks with Hari were among the best of my life. We had the luck to immerse ourselves in the real Nepali life in the Langtang region thanks to Hari. A truly incredible experience. I would recommend no any other company than his! Hari is also involved in helping his region as much as possible with such a kindness. He'll guide you and you will learn the Nepali lifestyle as well as the Nepal history along your trip. You can also if you want get involved by volunteering with his association, which is great. Don't miss this opportunity! Not at all commercial, just human :)

Excellent experience!. I would highly recommend Hari who is a fantastic guide and amazing person. He helped us organise our trek in Nepal and we couldn't have been happier with our experience. The best thing about Hari's approach is his ethical and moral stance, which many of the bigger trekking companies lack unfortunately. He takes very good care of all his staff and porters, making sure they are all well equipped, as well as supporting their families. He also runs several community support programmes across Nepal. If I return to Nepal, Hari would definitely be the first person I would go to! :-)

Perfect !!!. We made a humanitarian trip to the Tamang people living in the Langtang Valley. Hari is an exceptional guide engaged in the life of the valley. It helps many villagers to survive thanks to its trekking agency . We were received like royalty , cooks accompanying us throughout this trek away from everything. If you search the Nepalese authenticity I highly recommend you contact Hari .Thank you for all my friend !!!I'm waiting for our next meeting whit forward !!

A truly amazing experience. We had amazing 10 days in Nepal with a beaufiful trek in the Anapurnas region (around Gore Pani). The guide from High Himalayan Trekking picked us up directly from the airport. We had the time to visit Kathmandu and Pokara before heading to the Anapurnas. The guide was really nice and helpful. We felt taking care of during the whole trip without to have to worry about anything. We even managed to teach him how to play cards and we spend really nice evening playing cards together and getting to know Nepalese culture.We also liked the fact that High Himalyan Trekking is associated with a local NGO to support people in the mountain villages. It made us feel that our trip also help indirectly Nepalese people.Great choice for eco/sustainable tourism!

Grate people, grate team!. As for me, the main advanture is life is a meeting people. If people are grate around you, you will always have the best time. Team of High Himalayan Trekking and Expedition - one of the best people i have met in Nepal. Open, kind, always helpful, ready to advise and understand. Highly recomended!Larisa Matteyssen, Russia

Inspiring, humbling and overall helpful!!. A truly inspiring team of knowledgeable, helpful and caring people. My trip to Nepal was made because of this experience with this group. Thank you Nepal. Thank you High Himalayan Treks. Thank you Hari. :)

Choose-Your-Own Adventure with Excellent Cuisine. I was recommended 'High Himalayan Trekking and Expedition' from a friend in Sydney. Many friends who had been to Nepal had their own recommendations but when I contacted Hari the director of this company, with a rather specific request to do a not too tiresome trek, visit remote villages, and have a lot time for some meditation and writing, he came back to me with a variety of very appealing packages. Of the choices I decided to volunteer along with a group of French osteopaths and Doctors, and had the very easy job of helping out with the intake of patients for a couple of hours, with plenty of spare time to go off on my own, smoke the local ganja that grew everywhere, read, write, meditate and do yoga. It was an amazing soulful time I had, spending a couple of days at a time in these remote villages, near the Tibetan border.The biggest surprise of all though was just how good the meals were that we received. Each meal was delicious and plentiful. We ate like kings. I hadn't expected that. The company also assisted me purchase art in Kathmandu, and organised a guide (a really sweet college student) for next to nothing, to keep me company while shopping, exploring, eating out around Kathmandu, after mtg journey was done. I saw that Hari is one really well-connected guy in Nepal. He knows everyone!When I now consider the low cost of this incredible trek, I can't think of where else I've found such value for money. I will be back to Nepal again sometime, and Ill have High HimalayanTrekking design another choose-your-own adventure for me again.

Never met a better trekker. This company is simply amazing, fantastic people with awesome knowledge of the districts and mountains. Would recommend in an instant. If u do Nepal, then do it with high Himalayan...

Majestic Himalayas!. Initially when planning a 18 days trek in the Himalayas, which was something I always wanted to do, it seemed so hard and impossible to do....I didn't know what to expect or how to go about making it a reality...I had researched all my options but that didn't even scratch the surface of the reality of the experience.I was lucky to come across High Himalayan Trekking and Expedition through a friend who had done it and they couldn't stop raving about it and Hari and his team. They take care of everything so you can focus on enjoying yourself and the impeccable environment...The brilliant thing is that you can tailor make your trek to just how you want it...This was my highlight...so instead of booking a tour that just tells you what to do, you also have the option (as I like) to choose your own adventure or add to an established route...Further to that, our friendly and laid back guides went above and beyond...they knew everyone in all villages and were well respected....I now consider 'my team' friends for life and we have stayed in touch ever since...Until I visit again which is on the agenda!I can't recommend High Himalayan Trekking and Expedition enough....You will not regret it! Just do it...It will change your life for the better! Frankly, it is one of the best experiences of my life!Good luck and thank me later!

Annapurna Circuit Trek. Last year I went for the Annapurna Circuit Trek in Nepal. This was my second visit and trek in Nepal, the first being the Everest Base Camp Trek.It was an awesome experience with Hari as our lead guide. We experienced adventure, local culture and of course the beauty of the Himalayas and the trek itself. Very well organised. Would love to do another trek with Hari sometime soon.

Amazing experience. What an amazing experience! I did a charity trek in Langtang Valley & ended with a stay in a local village. This was my first ever trek and what an fantastic country to do it in…..absolutely beautiful!Hari is a wonderful tour guide, very knowledgeable & full of interesting stories. Hari & the team really made this an unforgettable adventure with their friendliness & expertise.I would highly recommend visiting Nepal & trekking with High Himalayan Trekking & Expedition.

Spectacular Tour with Hari!. Hari took my mother and I on a wonderful tour of Kathmandu before we started volunteering in his village. He showed us all of the best sites of Kathmandu and he really knew his stuff! The organization is very well run, with 10% of profits going to support his charity organization! I would highly recommend doing any sort of trip with High Himalayan Trekking Organization!

Annapurna Circuit . It was my first trip to Nepal. Met Hari and his great team in Nepal and completed the Annapurna Circuit. It was a memorable journey. Hari and his team were very courteous and supportive through out the journey.I intend to get back again to do Everest with Hari and team. Keep up the Good work Hari

unforgettable experience !!. We was a medical team and we passed 3 weeks with Hari, 2 others guides, 1 Nepal's doctor and cookers.Hari is a very kind person. He always takes care of us. He is always available to share local custom. We were totally immersed !All 3 guides speak very good english ( better than me).The cookers are magicians : they cook very good, typical and varied diet with very little equipment. They teach us nepale's cook recipe.The landscape is very beautiful in the area.I never forget this trip and people i have met.

Come visit Nepal. I have visited Nepal 5 times & with each visit combined a trek with a home stay & some form of charitable work. Hari's experience & dedication to provide us with the most rewarding experience of a lifetime was amazing.Every little detail was taken care of any questions were answered even before they were asked. I have travelled solo, with a close friend, family & also a wonderful group of 22.We trekked Langtang just before the earthquake, Upper Mustang last year to the "Tiji Festival" & Tibet. Leaving Australia with my daughter next Tuesday to visit Hari's village of Jibajibe & trek to Annapurna Base Camp. I highly recommend High Himalaya Trekking & Expedition, you will have the trip of a lifetime & develop a great respect & love for Nepal & it's people. Dhanyabad Hari.

An easy and friendly experience. Kathmandu can be a chaotic and confusing place for a first timer.We met Hari for a day tour of Kathmandu which was a fantastic experience. Hari is friendly, has great English and knows all the great spots in Kathmandu. Hari's English is excellent, he is very friendly and knows all the good spots in Kathmandu. Recommend for a great experience

One of the most rewarding tours I have ever been on. When i signed up for the tour I knew we would be visiting small rural villages and get to witness some of Nepal's traditional culture.... but when we got to the rural district of Nepal I was just blown away with just how immersive the tour was.We stayed with the guides family in his very own home. We visted local schools and were given a royal welcome by all the villager's and school children. Our tour guide Hari was so well known in the villagers that the locals welcomed us into their homes and schools and gave us incredible insight into their way of life and traditions. Most rewarding of all was being able to contribute to some of the schools in this region. The way Hari structures the tour meant we were able to see exactly where our support went, and unlike larger tour companies there were no hidden costs or skimming off the top...I recommend Hari and his team 100%

' A memorable Nepal Kathmandu and High Himalayan visit'. From start to finish this was an amazing experience. Hari organised everything down to the smallest detail and some of the most important..where to buy the best cashmere and where to get the best coffee and pizza in Thamel! We saw some amazing places and met the most amazing people! The High Himalayas was a favourite of mine where you step back in a time staying in picturesque Tibetan villages and experiencing the traditional ways of life of these gentle people. Hari's knowledge of local customs and his ability to translate on our behalf made the trip so much easier and well worth having a personal guide, we saw things and went places we never would have found otherwise. We even got to share his hospitality with his lovely family in his home in the mountain district of Rasuwa for a few days to visit our sponsor children. By the end of the trip I think we loved Nepal as much as Hari and would love to go again!
Hari is a gem!. 5 green circles for this trekking company. Incredibly friendly staff that are willing to immerse you in Nepali culture.

My trek with High Himalayan Trekking and Expedition. French people of 26 years old, I went in Nepal in septembre 2015 to realise a trek with Hari Devkota and the High Himalayan Trekking and Expedition. I am so happy to have realised this project ! It was a mix between a medical trek and a tourist trek. We met a lot of Nepali's people in villages, in the Jibjibe region (Langtang) and also walk in the mountain. Hari, porters, cookers, and all every people of the trek team was so nice with us ! I will never forget this trek and I'll keep in touch with them. I recommand you High Himalayan Trekking and Expedition for your travel project in Nepal ! If you want more information about my travel, contact me : thibault.peclet@hotmail.fr.

Best ever trekking company in Nepal. Hari and his team are a brilliant trekking company that will fulfil every whim and delight for the adventurous to the not so adventurous in Nepal and beyond!! And, not only do this company run fantastic treks/tours but the business owner also founded & operates a completely voluntary NGO in very remote rural Himalaya's building schools, hospitals and educating children, a heart of gold!! Highly recommended.

Part of the dress up trek. This trek in the Langtan Valley was the best trek I have done. Hari and the crew provided best experience, with a well run and coordinated package. A trek or tour package with this company is a must in Nepal.

I had a time of my life in Langtang. Despite the rough monsoon (I suck at picking the right travel season), sneaky bloodsucking leeches, and me being extremely unfit and clumsy, I had the best time trekking with Hari in Langtang. It was my solo trip, I knew close to nothing about Nepal, have never been on a long trek before, and generally felt that it's gonna be an adventure. We stayed with local families in the mountain huts, ate amazing pancakes, and I even got used to the mind-blowing Mustang coffee (stuff with rum - a must-try). We haven't encountered a yeti, so I cannot confirm or deny its existence, but we did reach a Tibetan village at the end of the trek and watched colourful celebration of a local holiday, and even drank wine (they poured it right into my hands!).Fantastic guiding, interesting stories, great memories!

Numbur Cheese Circuit and Yarsa Valley Trek. I was already trekking twice with High Himalayan Expedition. Both treks were very unique and off the beaten trek. Hari, the local porters and kitchen guys (best food you could imagine!) were so friendly, well organized, always smiling and real trekking experts.Trekking with High Himalayan Expedition is not like tours with other guides, its much more like travelling with friends and not just a guided tour. They have a huge knowledge about country and rural regions, the porters are choosen regarding the visited area. So we were allowed to get in contact with the locals (friends and family of the Hari & the local group members) and made some outstanding experiences, something you probably can´t make with other trekking companies.Choose High Himalayan Expedition, you won´t regret it :)

Beautiful trek in Annapurna for a good purpose. We were a group of three people and did a 6-days trekking in the Annapurna region. Although we went during the rainy season, we were able to see the amazing mountains and were not so much affected by the weather. Our guide was very friendly: we even played cards altogether! Moreover, the fact that the High Himalayan Trekking Company is linked to a charity association (High Himalayan Community Project Nepal) gives an additional motivation to choose this Trekking Company! I highly recommand it and really enjoyed my time in Nepal through their organisation.

Unforgettable family adventure of Nepal.. The opportunities that were provided to my family and I on our ten day whirlwind of an adventure of Nepal was absolutely amazing and would not have been achieved if done on our own. Hari and his team/ family went above and beyond to ensure we were all well fed by organising our very own cook to travel with and to provide us with modern Nepali cuisine, provided us with warm bedding, transportation and experiences for us to learn about the Nepali culture and the beautiful nature that surrounded us. Hari was very accommodating in organising ways to visit local schools and sponsor families. Everything was possible and nothing was a problem to Hari. Hari is an incredible knowledgabe and passionate man and provided us with great insight into the history, culture, people and government of Nepal which was very intriguing. I highly reccommendation Hari from High Himalayan Trekking And Expedition.

A True Nepalese Experience. I could not recommend High Himalayan Trek highly enough. The team of people looking after you are some of the most amazing you will meet. You will enter as strangers but leave as family. You don't just get a truly excellent trekking experience, you get to immerse yourself in the culture and meet and interact with many local people. You won't feel like an outsider staring in, you will become part of the community. I will definitely be returning.

Amazing. High Himalayan expedition provided an awesome experience for me. The trip was very well organized And provided everything we needed plus more. I would defiantly use high Himalayan trekking and expedition again for my next trip. Thanks H

amazing experience with Hari. Hi. My daughter and I spent 3 weeks with Hari and his family in his village. We did some volunteer work, hiking and got to know Nepali culture and the routines of village life. Hari and his family opened their arms and hearts to us and we still feel like we are now part of their family. Hari took good care of us and made sure that we had what we needed and answered a million questions on all topics. His daughter speaks English very well so if he was not around, she translated so we knew what was going on. He arranged my daughter's trekking trip up north and she had an amazing time. Hari is such a decent, hard working, caring person. You are in good hands with him.

Very good experience !. We were a medical team. We went to Nepal in October 2014 for 3 weeks, in Langtang valley. Hari and his team was perfect, they take care of us during all the trek. It was a wonderful experience. We tried to give some help in remote villages. Thank you very much to Hari and all this trekking team, for their kindness and all the organization.

Top notch. Met Shree in a restaurant after getting stuck in Kathmandu for 2 days. He organized a guide for EBC trek on the spot. We had a phenomenal two week trek with Temba (highly recommended if you are in the Everest / Lukla region). The day we returned to Kathmandu Shree met us for lunch and he organized another 4-5 day adventure in Pokhara. Great, honest service. We will be back.

EBC, Gokyo, 2 Passes + Personal Itinerary. We knew what we wanted... and it was difficult, but Shree and Epic Adventures delivered. The perfect trekking route, an excellent guide, and a last minute almost impossible Pokhara / Annapurna itinerary made our trip more than we ever expected.

Amazing service! . Epic Adventures was recommended to us by our hotel for a Nepalese cooking class- which was absolutely amazing - Nepal Cooking School! Service was fast and flexible to suit our schedule. Shreeram was professional, friendly & has extensive industry knowledge. He told us about his various amicable charity ventures. As teachers, my sister and I were extremely keen to visit some local schools/orphanages. Shreeram volunteered to take us to one of his charities - a blind orphange. It was a humbling experience, the children were beautiful. They introduced themselves, demonstrated their brail reading & writing abilities & sang to us.
